The Johnson & Johnson Law Department is recruiting for a Senior Patent Counsel to be located at the Janssen Research & Development campus in South San Francisco, CA. The position reports to an Assistant General Counsel – Patents.

Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.

With $76.5 billion in 2017 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 265 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing approximately 126,500 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Six end-to-end Therapeutic Areas (TAs) remain the foundation of the Janssen organizational model. The six TAs are: Cardiovascular and Metabolism (CVM), Infectious Disease and Vaccines, Infectious Disease and Vaccines, Neuroscience, Oncology, and newly added Actelion. The TA model, with end-to-end strategy, development, and value-creation accountability, enables Janssen to attract top talent, gain deep scientific and market insights in each TA, increase pipeline productivity, and sustain growth by empowering TA teams to operate with speed, agility, and deep knowledge in their respective TA space.
Infectious Disease and Vaccines TA

The Infectious Disease and Vaccines TA has an unparalleled track record of delivering novel medicines for HIV and Hepatitis. There is a growing Vaccine R&D; portfolio with transformational opportunities in RSV, HIV, and Bacterial vaccines.

Janssen Infectious Disease and Vaccines also has an unrivaled portfolio and pipeline, including a robust mix of line extensions and novel clinical-stage assets. The TA is committed to continuing its industry-leading work in Infectious Disease and Vaccines, pioneering the next wave of Infectious Disease and Vaccines medicines, and going beyond treating the most significant unmet medical needs

Johnson & Johnson Consumer & Personal Products Worldwide Division of Johnson & Johnson Consumer Companies, Inc. is recruiting for a Postdoc, Toxicology located in Skillman, NJ.

Johnson & Johnson Consumer & Personal Products Worldwide Division of Johnson & Johnson Consumer Companies, Inc. develops and markets Over the Counter (OTC), baby care, wound care and skin care products that address the needs of consumers and health care professionals and incorporate the latest innovations. job_title: Associate Scientist I, Assay Development - San Diego, CA
job_description: Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C., a division of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for an Associate Scientist I, Assay Development located in San Diego, CA.

At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science.

We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Learn more at www.janssen.com and follow us @JanssenGlobal. Janssen Research & Development, LLC is part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies.

The Screening department within Lead Discovery is growing with both new positions and capital investment. The department is responsible for the delivery of small-molecule qualified hits for the initiation of hit-to-lead programs within the Therapeutic Areas. Major activities include assay development, screening, and pharmacological profiling. The Screening Team collaborates closely with Janssen Therapeutic Areas and functional teams, the Innovation Centers, and external collaborators in academia and industry. We seek individuals with a strong ability to connect key stake holders for the delivery of goals and objectives, fostering an environment of collaboration, collegiality and positive communication, and who show superior performance in the context of a multidisciplinary, geographically disperse team.
In this exciting role, you will:

Learn and apply early drug discovery approaches in a multidisciplinary team environment.Collaborate extensively with program teams to identify the most promising compounds in early Hit-to-Lead programs.Develop innovative cellular or biochemical approaches to high-throughput screening (HTS) and hit triage as part of the early stages of drug discovery.Analyze data and present results via PowerPoint presentations.Attend and present data at in-house seminars and external scientific conferences.Publish research in high-quality journals, as appropriate.

Analyze data and present results via PowerPoint presentations.
Attend and present data at in-house seminars and external scientific conferences.
Publish research in high-quality journals, as appropriate.

job_title: GERENTE DE MARKETING - DEPUY SYNTHES - SÃO PAULO / SP

job_description: Janssen Research and Development LLC, a division of Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is dedicated to addressing and solving the most important unmet medical needs of our time, including in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious disease, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Driven by our commitment to patients, we develop sustainable, integrated healthcare solutions by working side-by-side with healthcare stakeholders, based on partnerships of trust and transparency.

Janssen is recruiting for a Senior Scientist to support the Global Molecular Imaging program in Spring House, PA. Experience in radiochemistry and imaging probe development, particularly PET, is required. Radiolabeling of both small and large molecule PET tracers is required, using radioisotopes such as F-18, Zr-89 and I-124. Experience with hot cells and automated PET synthesis modules is desired, and familiarity with other imaging modalities (e.g. optical, MRI) would be an advantage.

Other requirements are the ability to establish a network with the different therapeutic areas, understanding their needs and identifying opportunities, working with external partners (academic institutions, CRO’s) in the development of novel imaging biomarkers, and the ability to work closely with the Global Imaging Team, which will require some travel.Janssen Research and Development LLC, a division of Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is dedicated to addressing and solving the most important unmet medical needs of our time, including in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious disease, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Driven by our commitment to patients, we develop sustainable, integrated healthcare solutions by working side-by-side with healthcare stakeholders, based on partnerships of trust and transparency.

The qualified candidate will have a Ph.D. in chemistry or radiochemistry and at least 3 years of relevant industry experience, or a M.S. with 8 years of relevant experience. This position will require working within a radiochemistry lab environment. The qualified candidate should be highly motivated, and prepared to work in an interdisciplinary environment on projects that will have a major impact on the development of novel pharmaceuticals and the treatment of disease. This position will be based in Spring House, PA, requiring 20-30% domestic travel.

job_title: Sr Scientific Director, Early Therapeutic Area Lead (eTAL) and Strategic Process Lead, Nonclinical safety Neuroscience
job_description: Janssen is actively recruiting for a Sr Scientific Director, Early Therapeutic Area Lead (eTAL) and Strategic Process Lead, Nonclinical safety Neuroscience, to be located in La Jolla, CA.

The Senior Scientific Director, Early Therapeutic Area Lead (eTAL) and eTAL Strategic Process Lead, Nonclinical Safety (NCS) is a scientific leader assigned specifically to the Neuroscience portfolio and has responsibility for leading projects that cover multiple modalities primarily from the nomination of a target through selection of the new molecular entity (NME) and preparation of the First-In-Human (FIH) submission. The NCS eTAL is the interface between the NCS organization and the leaders in the therapeutic areas (TA).

The eTAL has significant scientific expertise in drug discovery, predictive safety/discovery toxicology, laboratory and pharmacology sciences and has specialized knowledge and passion for the therapeutic area. The eTAL will interact with TA leadership in TA forums and discovery portfolio committee (DPC) governance stage gate forums, and, may also serve as the NCS lead or lead delegate as needed (e.g. FIH stage gate). The eTAL is accountable for recommendations for diligence as assigned, and for strategic planning for drug discovery and NME selection paradigms, in partnership with specific NCS laboratory functional leaders.

The eTAL will serve as a coach and mentor for NCS Leads working in their portfolio including providing expert advice and review of target liability assessments and de-risking plans, pre-NME candidate de-selection/selection plans, non-GLP protocols, participation or host for “mock review” forums prior to NME selection and FIH stage gates with the purpose of assuring scientific and regulatory questions are proactively addressed.

The eTAL is expected to maintain scientific depth and expert working knowledge of competitive intelligence and regulatory landscape in TA arena and to tracks milestones, issues, and attrition and should highlight strategic gaps in NCS for action supporting the TA area portfolio. The eTAL may also serve as the NCS lead or lead delegate as needed. The eTAL is a member of the NCS Global Leadership Team and will lead or participate in special strategic projects as needed.
This role will also serve as a “captain” or matrix leader to pull other eTALs together and to establish process for early target liability assessments and target safety evaluation

Accountable as NCS eTAL for managing and coaching (leading with/without authority) NCS leads who work in the neuroscience therapeutic area space, this includes reviewing and providing expert advice on toxplans, study proposals, outputs, regulatory submission review and prep.Accountable as the primary NCS representative in portfolio governance stage-gate or other review forums, and provides coaching/reviewing/providing recommendations for diligence in the neuroscience therapeutic area space, includes interface with stakeholders outside of NCSSets strategy for all TA’s regarding early target evaluation (expression and liabilities). May directly manage small team on these capabilities. Drives strategic planning for NCS preparedness to operate in the designated therapeutic area space, including NCS playbook content, providing management updates, fostering cross-industry activities and forums with regulators and external expertsParticipates and/or helps to drive general training and expert advice forums for NCS leads who work on other parts of the Janssen portfolio. As a member of the NCS GLT is generally involved in recruiting and onboarding new staff and contributing to the overall NCS operations and strategic planning. Supports and drives research publications and maintains visibility with external academic or industry societies to accelerate and assure we maintain cutting edge capabilities for pre-NME toxicology sciences.

job_description: Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C., a division of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies is recruiting for a Senior Principal Scientist, Discovery Chemistry to be located at our J&J; site in Boston, MA.

At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives. We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found.

Janssen Research & Development, LLC discovers and develops innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Please visit http://www.janssenrnd.com/ for more information.
We are Janssen. Our mission drives us. Our patients inspire us. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Janssen Research & Development, LLC, is seeking an experienced, highly skilled, and motivated medicinal chemist to work in our Boston, MA, laboratories, for the position of Senior Principal Scientist, Discovery Chemistry. This position will require the candidate to possess and leverage deep knowledge and capabilities to deliver differentiated clinical candidates to the Janssen product development pipeline within our Disease and Pathway Area Stronghold (DAS and PAS) strategy. Using a mix of internal and external resources, the Senior Principal Scientist will partner with key stakeholders in the Therapeutic Areas and other internal groups, represent medicinal chemistry and lead cross-functional project teams, and be co-responsible for building, managing, and delivering high quality clinical molecules into the pipeline. This specific role requires significant leadership experience to work with biology, academia and biotechs to build a portfolio. Responsibilities of the Senior Principal Scientist will include:

As project leader, drive and establish a path forward for medicinal chemistry functions for one or more drug discovery projects, working in concert with partners in molecular and cellular biology, pharmacology, computational chemistry, ADME, structural biology, chemical development, and other key functionsTroubleshoots roadblocks independently and collaboratively with colleagues in the identification and delivery of high quality drug candidatesExcellent communication to develop effective partnerships and delegates work effectively to team membersAnalyze screening data, perform literature reviews, design, propose, and execute medicinal chemistry plans, coordinate chemistry and biology data to support project initiation (or not), compound progression and patent strategiesIn this role, it essential that the Senior Principal Scientist support or lead cross functional and cross network teams to deliver on Janssen pipeline objectives. In this laboratory-based position, the candidate will join a group of scientists in Discovery Immunology to conduct in-vivo/in-vitro studies to support the discovery and development of novel large and small molecule therapeutics targeting immunological diseases. The position offers an exciting opportunity to engage in the discovery of novel therapeutics for unmet medical needs.
Key duties include:

Support the design, optimization and execution of in-vivo and in-vitro experiments for compound screening, compound mode of action and efficacy in mechanistic and disease models, e.g. acute and chronic autoimmune/inflammatory conditions. Independently analyze and interpret experimental results, SOPs, technical reports etc. Ability to generate and maintain experimental data in an electronic laboratory notebook in a highly organized manner is critical. Demonstrate the ability to interface effectively and positively with all levels of colleagues in research and non-clinical functions. Independently present scientific data in cross-functional project teams/initiatives.

Support the design, optimization and execution of in-vivo and in-vitro experiments for compound screening, compound mode of action and efficacy in mechanistic and disease models, e.g. acute and chronic autoimmune/inflammatory conditions.
Independently analyze and interpret experimental results, SOPs, technical reports etc.
Ability to generate and maintain experimental data in an electronic laboratory notebook in a highly organized manner is critical.
Demonstrate the ability to interface effectively and positively with all levels of colleagues in research and non-clinical functions.
Independently present scientific data in cross-functional project teams/initiatives.

The candidate should have a BS/MS in biological sciences with relevant work experience (BS/2-4 years or MS/1-3 years) in pharmacology or biological research. The individual will be actively supporting and participating on the execution of biology and pharmacology studies involving in ex-vivo/in-vitro laboratory work.Candidate will demonstrate working knowledge with molecular biology techniques (e.g. RNA isolation, quantification, qPCR), and MSD/ELISA based immunoassays. Hands-on experience with tissue collection, in vivo dosing to support pharmacology PK/PD studies and mechanistic models of autoimmunity/inflammation. The successful candidate will also have strong quantitative skills, be familiar with laboratory instrumentation, data and statistics software (PRISM), spreadsheet (Excel) management.The ideal applicant must be self-started, detailed-oriented with good organizational skills and the ability to manage his/her workload and prioritize tasks. Ability to work well in a highly matrixed, interactive environment is critical. Essential functions also include the demonstration of oral, written and interpersonal skills including the ability to document and effectively communicate experimental results.

Janssen is actively recruiting for a Senior Fellow, Nonclinical Safety to be located at any J&J; site in the US or remotely from home.

The Senior Fellow will be responsible for leading and managing independent portfolio and expert reviews. He/she may partner with NCS leads or laboratory staff as requested in specific technology development, portfolio project issue resolution, or research collaboration projects, may act as a delegate for NCS or therapeutic area lead, as needed.

The Senior Fellow is responsible for co-leading, serving as the NCS Global Head delegate as needed, forums around scientific portfolio issue resolution and “mock” reviews and assure that scientific portfolio issues are resolved in a timely manner leveraging partnerships across the NCS leadership team. He/she will provide additional expert input to predictive safety strategies, in vivo exploratory, non-GLP studies and ongoing tox-path strategies.

In partnership with the NCS Global Leadership team, the Senior Fellow will be responsible for providing on-site and virtual professional leadership and drug development coaching and mentoring for emerging leaders in NCS. JOB TITLE: Senior Director, External Innovation Search And Evaluation,
job_title: Senior Director, External Innovation Search and Evaluation,
job_description: The J&J; Innovation Centers, a part of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is currently recruiting for a Senior Director, External Innovation Search & Evaluation to be based in Boston. Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the pharmaceutical, consumer health, medical devices, and diagnostics markets. The more than 265 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employ over 140,000 people worldwide.

Johnson & Johnson Innovation (JJI) constitutes three parts which work together to enable and bring innovation into J&J;: four Innovation Centers (ICs) in Cambridge/Boston, California (Menlo Park), London, and Shanghai (www.jnjinnovation.com); JLABs, a network of startup incubators, and JJDC, J&J; Venture fund. The ICs constitute a platform from which Johnson & Johnson (J&J;) identifies, catalyzes, contributes to, and accesses the most promising medical innovations at the leading life sciences companies and universities across the globe. J&J;’s goal is to build a pipeline of innovative products that will benefit patients and will augment long-term corporate growth. Operating within major hubs of innovation allows J&J; the opportunity to access technologies earlier and to help translate them into products for patients by contributing financial, intellectual, and human capital. The leading diversified healthcare company in the world, J&J; seeks external innovation across a broad range of sectors, including medical devices, pharmaceuticals, diagnostics, consumer healthcare, and digital health.

The Senior Director will play an important role in representing Johnson & Johnson Innovation and Global External Innovation unique strategy, encompassing emphasis on external partnership, synergies between J&J;’s consumer, medical device and pharmaceutical sectors, which enable J&J; to lead the development of new approaches to disease eradication through early detection and interception (“World Without Disease”).

The Senior Director will support the development of an external early stage (before human POC) innovation pipeline aligned with the strategies of J&J; internal business sectors, with primary priority on the pharmaceutical sector. The geographic focus is the East US region, including Boston, North Carolina, Baltimore & Washington DC area, NYC, Chicago, and others.

The role is focused on the early phase of the “innovation funnel”: development of relationships with key players in the external innovation ecosystem, identifying external innovation opportunities that align with J&J; strategy, conducting initial evaluation, preparing introductory information packages for internal discussion and managing the initial scientific communication and handoff to the Therapeutic Area (TA) and Sector Leads, who are located in the IC and represent internal R&D.; To ensure access to the latest information regarding TA strategy and wish list and close collaboration, the Senior Director will develop strong relationships with key internal R&D; leadership and TA and Sector leads.
This position will report directly to the East North America IC Head.

The Senior Director will closely network and develop relationships with all key stakeholders in the innovation ecosystem across the East US geography: leading Venture Capital firms, accelerators and incubators, startup/biotech companies, non-profit, foundations and government organizations that foster early innovation, as well as academic institutions. He/She will work with other team members in the innovation center to initiate and attend partnering and networking events across the region and take responsibility for large scale screening of opportunities from various innovation networks and sources.
The Senior Director will also serve as the focal contact point, responding and following up on unsolicited opportunities in the East US region.

The Senior Director will ensure that all external innovation opportunities presented to the internal teams meet the internal portfolio standards of scientific excellence, that development risks are identifiable, and that mitigation strategies are conceivable.
The Senior Director will work closely with the Strategy and Programs Leader to initiate and implement branding and opportunity sourcing programs.
The Senior Director will coordinate with the other innovation centers to ensure that opportunities are put in a global context and that the best opportunity of those identified globally is pursued.

In partnership with other Innovation Center colleagues, the Senior Director will contribute to the development and enhancement of processes, templates, and data capture systems utilized by the Innovation Centers to attain the highest professional standards in the execution of duties. They will be accountable to therapeutic areas and the Innovation Centers Leaders for the quality of network and relationships, the flow and quality of opportunities, the efficiency of handoff, alignment with business strategy and coordination of external innovation activities with other Innovation Centers.

A minimum of an MD or PhD level degree is required. At least 10 years of highly technical/professional experience is required.A minimum of 7 years of experience in Drug Discovery or Drug Development, with a portion of that experience being gained in an industry setting, is required. Pharmaceutical industry experience is highly preferred. Experience in participating on scientific due diligence teams is preferred.Must have an entrepreneurial, self-starter mindset and ability to inspire others to partner and collaborate.Established network in the innovation ecosystem in the East US is preferred.Frequent travel and attendance of after-hours business events and dinners will be required.

job_description: MD&D; Global Services LLC., a division of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies is recruiting for a Real Wold Data Analytics Lead, which can be located remotely within the United States.

Caring for the world, one person at a time inspires and unites the people of Johnson and Johnson (J&J;). We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the J&J; Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every single day, throughout the world.

The Medical Device Epidemiology - Real World Data Sciences organization at Johnson and Johnson (J&J;) conducts observational research to support product development, product launch, post-market safety and effectiveness, value assessments, and business development of medical devices. The team leads Real World Data (RWD) innovation and methodological excellence across J&J;’s medical device sector. The team generates real-world evidence to answer questions related to epidemiology of the indication, safety, product development, label extensions, value demonstration for payers, and other activities.

The Real World Data Analytics Lead will oversee the overall data programming and analytical needs of the Medical Device Epidemiology – Real World Data Sciences organization. The position will lead the development of standardized process that will maintain and improve the quality, consistency, and efficiency of the team's analytical deliverables. Additional responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

The Associate Director provides lead support for the design, execution, analysis, interpretation, and reporting or communication of data evidence for Pre/Early/Late Development, Research & Discovery, Medical Affairs, Real World Evidence, or Manufacturing Sciences programs for research, development, and/or marketed product needs in Janssen. This position takes a leadership role in providing input to program plans. Identifies and assists in the implementation of innovative statistical approaches. Represents Statistics & Decision Sciences (SDS) cross-functional and intra-departmental teams or working groups, including Janssen senior management-level reviews. He/She abides by the Credo and practices J&J; Leadership Imperatives for Individuals: Lead, Shape, Connect, and Deliver.

Quality and Compliance: Complies with organization and company standard operating procedures in timely fashion, such as training and project time accounting. Understands and aligns with relevant regulatory guidance. Takes responsibility for the quality and timeliness of project deliverables, as assessed by stakeholders such as the project team, the clinical trial team, and the Statistics Area Head. Follows best practices for Data Integrity

Drug Development: Demonstrates thorough knowledge of pharmaceutical research and development strategies and execution. Is an established leader for providing SDS support to experimental design, modeling, analysis planning, analysis execution, interpretation and statistical communications. Is accountable as a point of contact leader for a specific project or program (e.g. CTSL, Indication Lead, Discovery Lead, Manufacturing Lead) and the management of all related project/program deliverables. Is an established leader for providing input to team in terms of optimizing study or trial designs in line with study or indication level objectives, and supports scenario simulations and sample size calculations based on relevant technical and disease/scientific/functional knowledge. May serve on the SDS TA team led by the Global Statistical Sciences TA Head.
Disease Area Knowledge: Demonstrates knowledge across multiple disease areas/targets within or across Therapeutic Areas (TAs).

Innovation: Seen as a recognized leader in an area of technical expertise. Has a track record for suggesting, evaluating and implementing successful alternative or innovative approaches to statistical methods or business processes.

Representation: Represents Statistics & Decision Sciences on cross-functional and inter-departmental teams or working groups, including Janssen R&D; senior management-level reviews. Able to serve as SDS representative for Due Diligence activities.

External Engagement: Actively participates as a member of professional organizations, such as attending meetings sponsored by professional organizations, serving professional organizations as an officer, event co-coordinator, or session chair; works with cross pharma consortiums to develop industry standards. Peer reviews or edits professional journal manuscripts.

Mentor: Supervises contractors/special assignment personnel/interns/co-ops as required. Serves as a role model, and mentor to statisticians and other scientists. Shares knowledge within and across functions. Mentors junior colleagues in techniques, processes, and responsibilities.
Process: Leads process improvement or standards development initiatives. Provides input into hiring decisions and ongoing evaluation of talent.

Complexity: Successfully works on complex programs in terms of Scientific, Statistical, Health Authority, Operational, and/or Partnership issues. Identifies and implements advanced statistical approaches to handle complex project/program related features.

Collaboration: Builds and manages cross-functional partnerships with internal colleagues and with external partners (e.g. Contract Research Organizations (CROs), consultants, researchers/investigators) to achieve results for project specific needs with focus on improving communication, efficiency, and productivity. Often serves a SDS point person for those partnerships. Works cross-functionally to identify and resolve issues. Collaborates within SDS to ensure integrated delivery across all phases of drug development.

Communication: Demonstrates excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills. Demonstrates ability to collaborate and consult with non-statisticians, translating complex statistical concepts to drug research & development partners. Bridges scientific and business needs – integrating quantitative sciences and strong disease or functional area knowledge and appropriate market/competitive intelligence.
Programming: Demonstrates full proficiency in SAS or R, as well as a working knowledge of other relevant computational tools as required.

Per la sede di Cologno Monzese (Milano), Janssen ricerca un MEDICAL AFFAIRS ASSOCIATE INFECTIOUS DISEASES da inserire, a TEMPO DETERMINATO, a diretto riporto del Therapeutic Area Medical Manager nella Direzione Medical Affairs.

Questo Dipartimento gestisce la progettazione e l’implementazione di tutti i progetti di Medical Affairs, locali e internazionali, relativi all’Area Terapeutica Infectious Diseases and Vaccines, nel rispetto delle normative vigenti e delle policies aziendali.

Il Medical Affairs Associate (MAA) collabora con il Medical Affairs Manager nelle attività medico-scientifiche per i prodotti dell’Area terapeutica di competenza ed è responsabile delle seguenti attività:

SUPPORTO ALLE ATTIVITA’ DI RICERCA CLINICA interventistica/non interventistica, locale e internazionale, correlate alla clinica dell’area terapeutica di competenza, assicurando la conformità a Standard Operating Procedures e policies aziendali e il rispetto delle normative vigenti e dei tempi e costi previsti. In questo ambito, il MAA collabora nel valutare la fattibilità strategico-scientifica di ogni singolo progetto; nell’ assicurare l’appropriata gestione scientifica degli studi Medical Affairs, inclusi gli aspetti di sicurezza dei prodotti; supporta la pianificazione e l’esecuzione degli studi clinici, gestiti dal Dipartimento (GCO) che segue la realizzazione di tali studi; supporta la comunicazione dei risultati di ricerca (report clinici, pubblicazioni, convegni, Investigator’s meeting).

CONTRIBUTO e SUPPORTO MEDICO-SCIENTIFICO alle aree di business, assicurando la conformità alle Standard Operating Procedures e policies aziendali e il rispetto delle normative vigenti. In questo ambito, il MAA contribuisce ad organizzare le attività di training scientifico a beneficio della Field Force, a gestire e coordinare l’informazione e la comunicazione scientifica ai medici per le aree di propria competenza (es: allestimento di documentazione scientifica, gestione eventi di Medical Education), a verificare il contenuto scientifico di tutti i progetti di ricerca derivanti da proposte interne o esterne alla Direzione Medical Affairs; supporta la verifica dei contenuti tecnico-scientifici relativi a materiali promozionali e agli stampati di prodotto (scheda tecnica, foglio illustrativo); collabora nella revisione o nel redigere la documentazione scientifica a fini regolatori (expert report; clinical study report; ecc.) e di HEMAR (Health Economics, Market Access and Reimbursment)

DePuy Synthes, a $10 billion franchise within Johnson & Johnson, is a market-leader in the Orthopaedic implants industry and holds approx. $2 billion of Net Inventory.

Working in a dynamic, demanding environment, this role is key to supporting the achievement of inventory-based targets. Supporting the team lead within the Cork based Centre of Excellence (COE), this role covers the baseline monthly reporting requirements and forecasting duties, overlaid with supporting key programs with different business partners and ad hoc queries.

Due to the data driven nature of consolidation, this role requires an individual who will not only report the financial figures accurately, but will use initiative to help highlight focus areas, dedicatedly gain insights and have a desire to continually improve processes through automation and networking.

JJSC Source Finance – Finance Manager
JJSC – Source Finance Manager, Vision Care – Limerick, IE

Johnson & Johnson's Source Finance Organization is recruiting for a Finance Manager to provide financial leadership to the Vision Care Supply Chain Procurement function. In this role, you will partner closely with the Vision Care Procurement and Finance leaders (Source and Supply Chain) to guide procurement strategies, business planning, and cost optimization. The Manager will also be responsible to lead a team, initially of one additional Finance professional focused on providing support to the Procurement function in a global network of manufacturing sites.
The position will report to the Medical Devices Source Global Finance Director.

The J&J; Supply Chain Source Finance team is an organization with global impact, supporting Pharm, Medical Devices, and Consumer Third Party Manufacturing and Procurement organizations to deliver high quality, reliable and cost competitive products. While this role will primarily focus on supporting the Vision Care supply chain, it also provides an opportunity to lead global Source projects and to play a significant leading role in cross sector initiatives to drive standardization of activities/processes across Medical Devices, Pharm and Consumer... thus crafting the way we work across all sectors.

Partner closely with the Vision Care Source and SC finance global functions to guide procurement strategies, business planning, and cost optimization.Develop a team of up to one professional focused on analyzing procurement related cost improvement projects, capital investment requirements, market-based inflation drivers, and functional costs.Influence a broad range of cross functional partners to reduce process complexity and improve the way we work.Drive a value focused finance agenda in strategic projects that are building world-class procurement capabilities.

Act as an ambassador for Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices aligned to our Credo.

JOB TITLE: Sr. Director, Non-Clinical Safety Scientific Operations
job_title: Sr. Director, Non-Clinical Safety Scientific Operations
job_description: Janssen is actively recruiting for a Sr. Director, Global Nonclinical Safety Science Operations to be located in Spring House, PA.

The Senior Director, Global Nonclinical Safety (NCS) Science Operations leads the science operations, staff engagement, and partnership planning aspects of NCS which enables scientific excellence within NCS by transforming operational process and data into business insights, maximizing synergies across NCS and Discovery, Product Development, and Supply (DPDS). This is a critical role that will be responsible for developing, executing, and delivering NCS long term strategic objectives (such as portfolio innovation, NCS Global Engagement).

In partnership with the Nonclinical Safety (NCS) Global Leadership team, this role will be responsible for leading through the development of an overarching NCS scientific operations and staff engagement strategy supported by a continuous improvement framework and change management. This role will be responsible for the development of scientific business analytics and business case proposals, capacity planning, process improvement/efficiency proposals, development of partnership strategies (internal Janssen R&D; and external), and in staff development and engagement strategies. The ability to both challenge current paradigms with creative, out of the box thinking in matrixed team, as well as to develop new more efficient processes, that enable NCS to continue to drive scientific innovation and increased efficiency in execution and delivery of the portfolio will be critical.

Develop strategic framework and execution of key scientific and business operations, partnership, and engagement initiatives to deliver NCS long term goals and objectives, (rolling 3-year plan)Partners with other R&D; and DPDS partners to assure appropriate cross-functional operating framework that drives scientific synergies and operational efficiency with specific emphasis on facility and capital and operating network related to NCS laboratory functions.Lead business transformation efforts; establish and provide cross-functional continuous improvement framework and lead projects to drive NCS operational efficiency. Identifies inefficient processes and transforms them with more efficient, compliant processes.Plans and leads NCS GLT strategic and operating or other meetings to maximize team effectivenessProvides a framework for assuring optimal operating governance with outsource/external partners (playbook for assay development, production). Partners as needed with NCS Global Toxicology Operations team to drive Portfolio, Forecasting & Analytics strategy which develops, consolidates and provides portfolio costing, and provide value statements, cost of ownership models, etcClosely work with the Finance, PMO and Procurement organizations and NCS functions to assure delivery and execution of scientific outputs that are integral to discovery and development programs. NCS lead on long range financial plan with finance lead.Leads and supports development of data science and external innovation strategies with other NCS subject matter expertsServes as coordinator for NCS staff change management and engagement strategy, continuous improvement projects that promotes individual development, team development, development of institutional knowledge and best practices for leveraging the entire NCS network in an optimal manner.
Develop strategic framework and execution of key scientific and business operations, partnership, and engagement initiatives to deliver NCS long term goals and objectives, (rolling 3-year plan)

Partners with other R&D; and DPDS partners to assure appropriate cross-functional operating framework that drives scientific synergies and operational efficiency with specific emphasis on facility and capital and operating network related to NCS laboratory functions.

Lead business transformation efforts; establish and provide cross-functional continuous improvement framework and lead projects to drive NCS operational efficiency. Identifies inefficient processes and transforms them with more efficient, compliant processes.
Plans and leads NCS GLT strategic and operating or other meetings to maximize team effectiveness

Provides a framework for assuring optimal operating governance with outsource/external partners (playbook for assay development, production). Partners as needed with NCS Global Toxicology Operations team to drive Portfolio, Forecasting & Analytics strategy which develops, consolidates and provides portfolio costing, and provide value statements, cost of ownership models, etc

Closely work with the Finance, PMO and Procurement organizations and NCS functions to assure delivery and execution of scientific outputs that are integral to discovery and development programs. NCS lead on long range financial plan with finance lead.
Leads and supports development of data science and external innovation strategies with other NCS subject matter experts

Serves as coordinator for NCS staff change management and engagement strategy, continuous improvement projects that promotes individual development, team development, development of institutional knowledge and best practices for leveraging the entire NCS network in an optimal manner.

Johnson & Johnson Global Services is recruiting for a Senior Manager, Business Solutions Experimentation. The position is based in New Brunswick, NJ

Johnson & Johnson Global Services, the global shared services organization supporting the businesses of Johnson & Johnson, performs select functional work in a consistent manner across regions and sectors using simplified, standardized end-to-end processes and state-of-the-art technology. The vision of Johnson & Johnson Global Services is “to be trusted business partners who deliver increasing value by creating and sustaining globally standard world-class services that enable the power of Johnson & Johnson.” There are more than 2,000 employees in Human Resources, Finance and Procurement who work for Johnson & Johnson Global Services in key service centers located in Manila, Suzhou, Prague, Bogota and Tampa, as well as in local country-based hubs.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Position Summary:

The Senior Manager of Business Solutions Experimentation will partner closely with the Director of Business Solutions Innovation to drive the digital capability innovation strategy for J&J; Global Services (GS) Service Experience to improve the quality and the interaction between GS and its customers. You will be responsible for the execution of experimentation projects, using human centered design techniques to evaluate the white space in the Global Services digital capability strategy and identify emerging solutions that can meet our strategic needs when the need arises. You will partner cross-functional on a global basis to understand unmet needs of Global Services customers and agents and lead experimentation projects focusing on identifying solutions to address these unmet user needs. In addition, you will be responsible for conducting industry benchmarking and research that informs our capability roadmap, working closely with Johnson & Johnson Technology to evaluate emerging capabilities that support the GS strategy.

DePuy Synthes, part of the Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies, provides one of the most comprehensive orthopedics portfolios in the world. DePuy Synthes solutions, in specialties including joint reconstruction, trauma, craniomaxillofacial, spinal surgery and sports medicine, are designed to advance patient care while delivering clinical and economic value to health care systems worldwide. For more information, visit www.depuysynthes.com.

The Senior Manager, Robotics R&D; is a key role in the team for digital and robotic technology for the orthopedic medical device industry. This leadership role will direct the Core Spine Robotics team. The ideal candidate will be a strong collaborator and communicator that takes the time to understand the key stakeholders and will be able to guide the team successfully through the NPD (New Product Development) process. This role will work very closely together with the Program Manager, and the Director of Emerging Robotics and assist with direction and management of the NPD Spine Robotics Team.

Day-to-day lead the team and drive progress in this key NPD program. job_description: Actelion Pharmaceuticals, a Janssen Pharmaceutical Company of Johnson & Johnson, is recruiting for a PH Specialist in Pulmonary Hypertension.

As part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it.

As leader in the field of a rare disease: pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH), with over 15 years of experience in this devastating and incurable cardiovascular disorder, we want to build on this strong foundation to deliver our vision of a normal life for patients with cardiopulmonary disease.

We want to create long-term value for our portfolio through generating a shift in healthcare professional behavior to enable earlier diagnosis, earlier intensification of treatment and continuous risk-based review.

Within the BeNeLux Business Unit PH (Actelion), we are looking for a PH Specialist eager to contribute to our vision and ready to implement the regional sales strategy for our brand(s) in the Belgium.

Within this include individual plans and selling strategies for Key Account Customers as well as the wider business aspects. Develop and implement the Key Account Plan through co-ordination with colleagues and across functions.Achieve required contact rates on target and non target customers through face to face and meetings to ensure appropriate coverage and frequency as documented in Key Account Plan and agreed with line manager.Work with customers to identify partnership opportunities in the form of awareness programs, patient education etc. that will contribute both to optimizing patient careServe as primary contact for all customers in territory. Where appropriate initiate and develop the company’s relationship with new stakeholders. In this aspect work closely with Medical and Marketing colleagues.Ensure all relevant account and customer intelligence is shared within the business and utilized appropriately.Operate day to day activities within the budget allocated. Develop and maintain knowledge of disease area, products, and company materials and resources.Ensure appropriate standards for administration are adhered to. Comply with all company guidelines and policies.

CERENOVUS: Cerenovus is a global neurovascular company that offers a broad portfolio of devices for aneurysm coils, vascular reconstruction devices and other technologies used in the endovascular treatment of cerebral aneurysms and stroke, minimally invasive solutions for stroke prevention and management, and the treatment of cerebral arteriovenous malformations.

The Business Development Manager (BDM) Cerenovus is combined sales and marketing role. From a sales perspective, he/she creates the demand from the clinical stakeholders, thereby driving business performance and market share. The BDM Cerenovus is responsible that the most important clinical stakeholders become promoters of our products and our company. He/she works closely together with the Strategic Account Manager to ensure an optimal resource allocation and the highest impact of their work.

“Caring for the world, one person at a time” inspires and unites the people of Johnson & Johnson. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.

The Global Orthopedics business of DePuySynthes is comprised of Joint Reconstruction, Trauma, Spine, Sports Medicine and Power Tools. Collectively, these businesses are focused on helping patients along the care continuum — from early intervention to surgical replacement, with the goal of helping people return to living active and fulfilling lives.

In the position as Sales Consultant Joint reconstruction DepuySynthes you will play a major role in the Johnson & Johnson Medical organization. You will report to one of the Sales Manager Joint reconstruction. Taking care of a specific territory, you will bring added value to our customers and ensure the financial growth of the business, provide market information & analysis and ensure the improvement & implementation of internal processes.

In this exciting job, every day will be different! You establish contacts with key opinion leaders, surgeons, nurses, operating management, pharmacists, purchase departments and professional associations.
Professional education is a key element that drives our business. Being present in the operating theatre is therefore an essential part of your task.
The business results in your sector are your main responsibility and your personal reward in collaboration with a team of great experimented colleagues.

You analyze and integrate sector data and formulate an efficient and results-oriented yearly sales plan. Being proactive, you explore and achieve new business for our products & services according to the franchise’s strategy.

job_description: Position Title: Total Rewards Cluster Lead (Senior Manager) Reporting to: Head of Total Rewards EMEA GCF: 31 Location: Wokingham, UK - preferred, or High Wycombe, UK Johnson & Johnson is currently looking for Total Rewards Cluster Lead (EMEA) to be based in Wokingham or High Wycombe, United Kingdom. Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 130 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.

With $81.6 billion in 2018 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing over 125,000 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen. Position summary:

We have a unique opportunity for an influential Total Reward HR Professional looking for a strategically focused EMEA role. As the Total Rewards Cluster Lead you will manage the ongoing Total Rewards activities for a group of assigned countries in the EMEA Region and will provide Total Rewards consultation to assigned business client group. You will also participate in the design, development and implementation of Total Rewards programs and practices, and provide advice and interpretation of various compensation/benefit policies. You will also be required to manage the governance to apply modifications into existing plans, and there will be a strong platform for serving as liaison between the Global Total Rewards initiatives and the regional or local talent strategies.
Key accountabilities:

• Under established global framework , oversee the application of strategy and principles for Total Rewards processes to align with business objectives. • Ensure Total Rewards programs are externally competitive and internally equitable and provide consultation to all management levels and recommends policies and programs based on market findings and talent agenda. • Be responsible for development, implementation and optimization of compensation and benefits policies and programs for the cluster within the approved framework and guidelines. • Lead all reviews and recommendations for policy development and modifications, within the Total Rewards scope, between Corporate Services and local HR Leadership, ensuring that the appropriate governance process if followed. • Communicate, monitor, and provide organization wide direction on Total Rewards policies and procedures (compensation, benefits, retirement and perks). • Collaborate and engage with Country/Cluster HR Heads to ensure that the TR programs and operations are aligned with Corporate Services TR and Global Services HR strategic initiatives and plans. • In partnership with Global Service TR to drive key initiatives, change management and develop effective end to end process that results in high efficiencies and positive employee experiences. • Oversee third party service providers of Benefits, Benefits Administration, Retirement and other benefits for the cluster of countries assigned. • Participate as a Total Rewards subject matter expert in key business initiatives • Lead change management efforts that align with company and transformation initiatives. • Direct external market benchmarking and job analyses, identify market trends and initiate appropriate actions to maintain the company's competitive position within the cluster/region. • Utilize insights and analytics to drive strategic solution • Serve as a role model for high quality customer service; ensures that the needs and expectations of all customers are consistently met or exceeded.
To succeed on this role, you will need to have:
• University degree – minimum Bachelor • Extensive Total Rewards expertise
• Significant experience in forward-thinking Total Rewards environment experience

• Experience with all compensation components, understanding of long-term incentives, sales incentives programs and expatriate packages • Experience in Benefits & Retirement Plan research, design, recommendations and communication. • Expertise in administration of benefits and retirement programs for the countries of responsibilities and the competitive Rewards marketplace

• M&A; Due Diligence, Integration and harmonization experience. • Experience of driving change programs across countries and functions. • Ability to build relationships, mentoring and collaboration skills, with leaders at all levels and key partners • Experience in development and reporting of HR analytics to manage performance and drive data-based decisions for HR and the organization; use of HR Systems and strong skills with Excel • Demonstrate high levels of innovation and creation with strong analytical skills. • Track record to drive business results – identifies and capitalizes on opportunities, identifies risks/issues, assesses implications, formulates recommendations, and drives sound decisions that deliver results • Previous experience in a Large corporate Matrix environment • Excellent written and verbal communication abilities; formal presentation and facilitation skills • Open to move across HR roles (within Global Services, Corporate Services, Business Partner)

All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

A member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, the world’s leading healthcare company, DePuy Synthes is dedicated to providing patients all around the globe with a lifetime of movement solutions. DePuy Synthes has been a pioneer in the fields of orthopaedics, spinal care and neuroscience therapies for decades. From non-surgical pain management to complete surgical solutions, it’s range of treatment options include those for treating or reconstructing damaged or diseased joints, caring for traumatic skeletal injuries, treating spinal disorders and deformity, and repairing injured soft tissue. In addition, DePuy Synthes offers a wide range of state-of-the-art therapies for neurological and central nervous system care.

In order to achieve our set goals & targets, we must all lead using our Leadership Imperatives and achieve our Leadership Performance Standards:
LIVE OUR CREDO: Demonstrate and inspire the behaviours that reinforce Our Credo.
CONNECT: Collaborate internally and externally in order to develop insights to drive innovation

SHAPE: Driving meaningful innovation through our insights to meet unmet needs and generate value and solutions for our customers. In order to do this we must be ambitious and courageous in challenging the status quo and adapting to change.
LEAD: Everyone is a leader and is accountable for their own development and that of others. We must leverage diversity and ensure we have open and constructive conversations.

DELIVER: Is “HOW” we accomplish our business results. We must focus on our ability to inspire and mobilize people; empowering them to act boldly with speed and agility, to do even more than they thought they could.
What type of mark will you make?

Your rare talents and perspectives can make a vital contribution to creative products that improve the lives of people everywhere. Main purpose:

The individual operates at the technical interface between Janssen Vaccines & Prevention Leiden (JVL) and the (external) DP manufacturing sites. The main purpose of the individual is to set up the plans for process development, process characterization and process validation activities and ensure this is done in according to the project specific timelines and in compliance with applicable quality and regulatory standards. The related responsibilities focus mainly on late stage process development activities and process performance qualification until planning for Continued Process Verification as part of Life Cycle Process Validation.
Key responsibilities:
• Accountable for the setup, reporting and timely execution of (outsourced) process development, characterization and validation activities
• Responsible for establishing and maintaining a trustful and professional relationship with the external partner (if applicable)
• Responsible to ensuring close collaboration with the FFP manufacturing specialist and ensuring alignment with project needs through Technical Integrator
• Responsible as technical subject matter expert in case product or process specific assessments are required
• In case studies are outsourced, responsible for review of the documentation prepared by the external partner that is required for process development, characterization and validation
• Responsible for timely informing/escalating issues as needed
• Responsible to provide input and review the required documentation which will be included in the filings
Key Performance Indicators:
• Delivery of assigned project deliverables in full as planned, most importantly pre-clinical and clinical batches
• Pro-active identification of issues, problem-solving capabilities, and timely implementation of solutions at external partner
• Trust and professionalism within the team and in relationship with external partner
• Communication skills, including conflict prevention/handling
• Flexibility to help within the development and manufacturing team based on work load
Qualifications
Specific professional/technical requirements
Education: MSc/BSc in relevant discipline, like pharmaceutical sciences, pharmacy, (bio)chemistry or other life sciences or engineering.
Languages: English (required), Dutch (plus)

Specific Knowledge: In-depth understanding of Life Cycle Process Validation (including late stage process development, process characterization, process performance qualification and continued process verification) and GMP manufacturing of vaccines and/or large molecules.

Experience: At least 10 years of experience in vaccine and/or large molecule process development and GMP drug product manufacturing. Experience with the following is a strong advantage: technology transfers, GMP manufacturing and outsourcing.

Other: Independent on location, flexible, collaborative, communicative and motivating, enjoys working in a team. Is able to travel frequently (10%) and stay abroad for up to 1 week. Interpersonal skills and business acumen are key for this position.

job_description: Depuy Synthes, a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for an Orthopedic Product Specialist based in Halifax, Nova Scotia to cover major Acute Care Sites in NS, NB and PEI.

DePuy Synthes, part of the Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies, provides one of the most comprehensive orthopedics portfolios in the world. DePuy Synthes solutions, in specialties including joint reconstruction, trauma, craniomaxillofacial, spinal surgery and sports medicine, are designed to advance patient care while delivering clinical and economic value to health care systems worldwide. For more information, visit www.depuysynthes.com.\

Attaining sales/market share objectives. Executing national/regional/local promotional activities and programs Effectively leading the territory with timely and accurate account plans. Calling on existing and prospective customers and providing excellent customer service. Providing product information and appropriate customer prices. Developing new accounts and growing existing accounts within established geographic territory.

JOB TITLE: Senior Director, Global Head Investigative Immuno And Hematotoxicology (Immunotoxicology)
job_title: Senior Director, Global Head Investigative Immuno and Hematotoxicology (Immunotoxicology)
job_description: The Senior Director, Global Head Investigative Immunology and Hematotoxicology, Nonclinical Safety (NCS) will define the strategy and execute the development of novel therapeutics spanning across multiple therapeutic areas and modalities. This role will be responsible for establishing a new group within Nonclinical Safety that will evaluate potential immune and hematopoietic system-related risks associated with our pipeline, this includes: building appropriate laboratory capabilities, working with Project Toxicologists, providing strategic and scientific input to multidisciplinary Project Teams across the pipeline from discovery through post-registration.

The Senior Director will be responsible for leading the Investigative Immunotoxicology group to establish novel in vitro and biochemical assays/in vivo biomarker models to assist in understanding potential human risks associated with candidates, pre-NME in order to inform internal decision-making. He/she will lead a team of internal employees and oversee external (Contract Research Organizations) resources to generate data to inform risk assessment.

The Senior Director, Global Head of Investigative Immunotoxicology will be member of the Nonclinical Safety Senior Leadership Team and will serve as needed as delegate leadership to early portfolio governance and in evaluation of due diligence opportunities. He/she will be a member of the Nonclinical Safety Leadership team that is responsible for the review and approval of nonclinical safety strategies as well as major issue review and recommendations for resolution.

This role will lead a team of PhD level and technical level staff providing leadership, mentorship, and career development opportunities for his/her global team members. This role will be responsible for future capital planning, innovation strategy, budget, resource and timeline commitments for the group.

The Senior Director will have a desire for learning and innovation, and continue career development through participation in scientific meetings, and increase visibility for self, Janssen R&D;, and J&J; through publications, participation in external organizations, and presentations at major scientific, industry, and regulatory meetings.

Ph.D. in immunology, immunotoxicology, toxicology or related discipline (pharmacology, cell/tumor/molecular biology, or related field) and/or professional degree (DVM, VMD) with training or extensive experience in immunotoxicology, immunology or related biologic disciplines15 + years of pharmaceutical/biotechnology research management or related experience in drug development is required; direct experience with risk assessment for biotherapeutics is requiredKnowledge of GLPs and Health Authority regulations and guidelines for the development of biologics (e.g. ICH, FDA, EMEA, PMDA) is requiredProven track-record in leading complex scientific and laboratory teams, including direct people management, laboratory management experience is requiredExceptional diplomacy and negotiating skills are required. This role requires excellent communication and interpersonal skills, a high level of organizational ability and attention to detailGood communication skills, attention to detail, troubleshooting skills and ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment is required. Strong scientific and technical skills including flow cytometry (particularly as applied to the immune system), molecular imaging, immunoassays and expertise in animal and cell-based models is required.Leading edge knowledge of principles, concepts and practices in Immunotoxicology Is required as well as ability to propose mechanistic hypotheses, design and oversee the execution of experiments is required.

job_title: Senior Technical Data Architect, Data Engineering
job_description: Janssen Research and Development, a member of Johnson and Johnson Family of Companies, is recruiting for an Senior Technical Data Architect, Data Engineering to be located in Raritan, NJ.

At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives. We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found.

Janssen Research & Development, LLC discovers and develops innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Please visit http://www.JanssenRnD.com for more information.

We are Janssen. Our mission drives us. Our patients inspire us. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it.Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Exciting opportunity to be part of new and growing technical data management team contributing to our next generation data strategy driving effectiveness and efficiency of clinical trials from collection to submission.

The development of best-in-industry Data Science capabilities is critical to our ambition to be most innovative healthcare company. Combining various data streams and providing data near real-time data and visualizations are key component to obtaining our ambitions.
We are looking for individuals who have aptitude and motivation learn the next generation data strategy and help shape and grow with us in this journey.

The position is primarily accountable for providing expertise, delivery and oversight of technical clinical data management activities from data stream integrations to submission-ready tabulation packages. Also responsible for contributing to our automation and innovation efforts.

Principle Responsibilities Include; Development of data transfer agreements with ancillary data vendors ensuring use of standards, fit-for purpose data models and transfer intervals. Create and review specifications and mapping for data models to be used for quality review and for final data model (SDTM or other). Ensure quality review of datasets (e.g., Pinnacle 21 compliance checking); ensure datasets are available for stakeholder use (medical review, central monitoring, adaptive decision making, etc.) and compliant for database lock and submission-ready tabulation packages. Develop and maintain working knowledge and expertise in programming languages utilized in current data management (SAS, SQL, etc.) and apply continuous learning as part of next generation data strategy (R, Python, Scala, Java, etc.).

Bachelor’s degree in Computer or Life Sciences or equivalent work experience required.3 years of relevant experience in pharmaceutical industry is desired, experience in other industries. in Data Engineering role will also be considered. Knowledge of protocol, current clinical drug development processes preferred.Knowledge of eDC systems is required.Intermediate programming skills in one or more SAS, SQL or other languages R, Python, etc. is required.Working knowledge of SDTM including Define.xml, CDASH, metadata preferred. Ability to work with cross-functional team interpreting data requirements.Strong project management skills and knowledge of team management principles are required.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Aptitude and motivation learn new technologies and make appropriate recommendations for consideration is preferred.Vendor management oversight experience a plus.

The successful person in this role will provide mentoring and support to the clinical project scientists on the team and will work with PMO, Finance, and the Clinical Leader to assure appropriate resourcing of clinical studies. He/She will work closely with the clinical project scientist team and Clinical Leader in Late Development, in collaboration with other functional disciplines, including GCO, Data Management, Statistics, Regulatory, QMMC, and GMS to ensure flawless and integrated execution of study start-up planning, oversight, and reporting of clinical studies in Oncology. Together with the Clinical Leader, the Study Responsible Physician will represent the clinical team in governance and committee meetings relating to the overall strategy and operational implementation of the clinical studies in the development plan.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: • Lead the project scientists, ensuring appropriate training, mentoring, and supervision across the assigned study/studies within the clinical development program.• Work closely with functional partners (Data Management, Biostatistics, Regulatory, GCO, QMMC, GMS) to ensure an integrated and strategic approach to flawless execution and systematic oversight of study protocol(s) in late development in close collaboration with key functional stakeholders.• Provide support for clinical study/studies within a development program including:o Working closely with the colleague study responsible physicians and clinical project scientists in collaboration with GCO and GMS to ensure comprehensive medical monitoring, thorough and timely responses to address site issues and eligibility questions, and detailed, real time review of serious adverse events and deaths.o Working in partnership with colleague study responsible physicians and clinical project scientists to ensure development of high quality study protocols including use of consistent processes/standards across studies.o Collaborate with the Clinical Leader, Clinical Project Scientists and Procurement on key study design elements including assessment of complexity and cost of protocol-required evaluations.o Participate in strategic study start-up planning in collaboration with GCO, C&G;, and RTAEs including early site assessment, feasibility, and use of simplified contract and budget templates to accelerate rate of site activations.o Co-lead and oversee clinical development/authorship of informed consent forms, eCRFs, study manuals, clinical study reports, and regulatory submission documents. o Work closely with Medical Writing to support protocol or protocol amendment completion.o Work closely with Clinical Leader, Project Physician, Regulatory and GCO to address protocol questions from Health Authorities and Ethics Committees in a consistent fashion.o Work closely with GCO to track study recruitment and implement action plans to address early impediments to study enrollment. o Work closely with Quality Management & Quality Assurance to review audit findings and implement effective corrective action plans.o Work closely with clinical scientists and data management to support medical review and data query resolution.o Interact with clinical investigators and Key Opinion Leaders as appropriate.o Work with GCO to provide oversight of CRO/study vendors’ performance as it relates to study start-up and conduct.o Work with the Clinical Leader, with Data Management and with Statistics on analysis of study results and completion of study reports.• Work with the Clinical Leader to support the development and compilation of NDA/MAAs and to support responses to Health Agency questions and HA presentations post-filing.• May review/co-author medical publications emerging from clinical trial results.

• May act as a liaison between company and clinical investigators, vendor managers, and CROs.• May be asked to assess and plan for external clinical research opportunities in collaboration with Clinical Leader and BD.• May interact with medical consultants in concert with senior clinical staff, in conducting IDMC and Investigator meetings as well as Advisory Boards.
An MD is required; Advanced degree (PhD) is a plus.

• Working knowledge of the use of Microsoft suite of software products including Excel and Word is required. • Fluent in written and spoken English with excellent communication skills is required.

job_title: Principal Scientist - DNA-Encoded Library (DEL), Discovery Chemistry
job_description: Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C., a division of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies is recruiting for a Principal Scientist, DNA-Encoded Library (DEL), Discovery Chemistry located in Spring House, PA.

At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives. We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found.

Janssen Research & Development, LLC discovers and develops innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Please visit http://www.janssenrnd.com/ for more information.
We are Janssen. Our mission drives us. Our patients inspire us. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Janssen Research & Development, LLC, is seeking an experienced, highly skilled, and motivated medicinal chemist to work in our laboratories in Spring House, PA, for the position of Principal Scientist - DNA-Encoded Library (DEL), Discovery Chemistry. This position will require the candidate to possess an in-depth knowledge of all aspects of DNA-encoded library technology and extensive hands-on experience with the design, reaction development and synthesis of DNA-encoded libraries, as well as data analysis, hits selection and validation and Hit-to-Lead optimization. This individual will significantly contribute to the overall DELT strategy and the advancement of this technology at Janssen. The incumbent will play a leading role in the design and synthesis of Janssen DNA-encoded libraries, and the development of novel DEL-compatible reactions. He/She will collaborate closely with other functional areas in Discovery Chemistry and Lead Discovery, and with external CROs and research institutions to effectively execute our DEL strategy. Responsibilities of the Principal Scientist will include:

Lead the design, chemistry development and synthesis of DNA-encoded libraries through collaborations with both internal and external partnersLead the effort to develop novel on-DNA chemistries that can be applied in DEL protocolsImplement building block enrichment strategy to enable the DEL buildA core team member to contribute to the overall DEL strategy and the advancement of this technology Collaborate closely with Lead Discovery team to enable the DEL selectionSupervise a group of scientists to deliver on DEL objectives Serve as a scientific leader and expert in DEL with both internal and external partners and provide recommendations regarding emerging external capabilities.Ensure optimal interaction/communication and provide updates on project status to Discovery leadership Maintain significant personal laboratory presence
