job_description: Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices, a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for an Associate Director, Clinical Research, Digital Surgery Platform, to be located in Somerville, NJ or Cincinnati, Ohio and may require up to 25% domestic and international travel.

Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices is currently $20 billion in World Wide sales. The business is expected to experience solid growth over the next 5 to 7 years. Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices contains key surgical platforms such as Wound Closure, Orthopedics, Open and Minimally Invasive Stapling, Energy, Biosurgery, Aesthetics, ENT, and Cardiovascular surgical products.

Ethicon’s long-term vision is to use digital technology as part of a holistic approach to surgery across the episode of care to enhance surgical efficiency, promote better clinical outcomes and increase patient satisfaction. This unique position will provide scientific leadership for Ethicon’s Digital Surgery Platform, collaborating closely with the multi-functional evidence teams: Medical, Clinical, Pre-clinical and Health Economics and Market Access.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Major Accountabilities:

Lead team of clinical research professionals to develop and deliver appropriate global evidence generation strategies (Pre-and Post-Market approval- studies, Investigator Initiated, Real World Evidence) aligned to the needs of the R&D;, Regulatory, Professional Education and Commercial Digital Surgery platform Ensure input and strong alignment from key regional MD CR&D; leads and other strategically important countries/regions in the development of the clinical evidence generation strategies; Contribute and support the design of appropriate clinical trials to meet the premarket and post market needs; Strengthen capability in and drive implementation of real world evidence to deliver cost-effective evidence solutions for Digital Surgery platform Identify areas of highest impact for the Digital Surgery portfolio, create and implement solutions that significantly impact ROI, and communicate impact across the organization Develop network with key surgeons in EU and US to assist in execution of Digital Surgery clinical trials for registration in both regions Lead teams to ensure appropriate interpretation and dissemination of all evidence generated, based on EDS, including CSRs, abstracts, manuscripts, etc. Support clinical scientific discussions with regulatory agencies / notified bodies to drive support of the clinical and regulatory strategy, including proposed clinical investigations; review process of clinical evidence generated for marketing authorization, line extensions, etc., including during sponsor regulatory inspections; Provide scientific, technical, and strategic assessment and/or oversight on New Business Development opportunities, and support acquisition of innovative products/devices that will position our company for future growth and success

Neben der intensiven Einarbeitung und der bedarfsgerechten Weiterbildung sind hervorragende Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten - national und international - sowie überdurchschnittliche Sozialleistungen wichtige Elemente für unsere Mitarbeiter. Con el porfolio y pipeline más interesante del sector, Janssen ofrece la oportunidad de formar parte de un proyecto innovador, puntero y referente dentro de la industria farmacéutica.

Buscamos incorporar profesionales con talento, ganas ilimitadas de contribuir, aprender, y buenos ¨team-players¨, dispuestos a afrontar cualquier reto y a lograr resultados excelentes. Buscamos personas que sean capaces de encontrar oportunidades y proactivamente fomentar su propio desarrollo.

- Creación y seguimiento de la cartera de clientes para alcanzar los objetivos de venta establecidos por la compañía.

JOB TITLE: Account Manager (m/w/d) Medizinprodukte Elektrophysiologie - Eastern Region
job_title: Account Manager (m/w/d) Medizinprodukte Elektrophysiologie - Eastern Region
job_description: Uns verbindet die Leidenschaft für unsere Mitmenschen: für Kunden, Patienten, die Gesellschaft, füreinander. Als eines der größten Gesundheitsunternehmen der Welt suchen wir Persönlichkeiten, die mit uns Großes bewirken wollen – das Wohlbefinden und die Gesundheit von Menschen weltweit und in Deutschland zu verbessern. Wir schätzen Charakterköpfe mit Teamgeist, die Verantwortung übernehmen und mit uns innovative Produkte und Services entwickeln. Dafür bieten wir ein modernes, flexibles Arbeitsumfeld und unzählige Karrierewege in unserem internationalen Netzwerk.

Mit dem Geschäftsbereich Biosense Webster ist Johnson & Johnson führend im Bereich der kardiologischen Elektrophysiologie. Die "Elektrophysiologie" ist ein Spezialgebiet zur Untersuchung und Behandlung von Herzrhythmusstörungen in der Kardiologie. Die Aufgabe der Elektrophysiologie besteht darin, Herzrhythmusstörungen (insbesondere Herzrasen) bei einer Herzkatheteruntersuchung mit Hilfe von Elektrodenkathetern zu diagnostizieren und kurativ zu therapieren.

Biosense Webster Inc. leistet seit 30 Jahren mit seinen Herzkathetern Pionierarbeit und ist ein innovativer Anbieter auf dem Gebiet der Mappingsysteme des Herzens. Als der führende Anbieter von Navigationssystemen und Ablationstherapie stellt Biosense Webster Inc. die weltweit größte Plattform von Navigationssystemen in den Kliniken bereit.
Diesen Erfolg möchten wir mit Ihnen weiter ausbauen. Zur vertrieblichen Verstärkung unseres Teams im Außendienst suchen wir daher zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen
Account Manager (m/w/d) Medizinprodukte Elektrophysiologie - Eastern Region
Wir suchen erfahrene Persönlichkeiten wie auch ambitionierte Hochschulabsolventen mit dem notwendigen Enthusiasmus, sich in dieses spannende Umfeld einzuarbeiten.

Ihre Hauptaufgaben bestehen in der Akquise von Neukunden und der konzeptionellen Betreuung von Fokuskunden. Sie tragen die strategische Verantwortung für Ihr Gebiet und stimmen sich dazu eng mit dem regionalen Verkaufsleiter und dem klinischen Team ab. Sie können Ihre Kollegen ebenso motivieren, wie sich selber und ein „Nein“ spornt sie zu Höchstleistungen an, durch Überzeugungsarbeit daraus ein „Ja“ zu machen.

Durch Ihre offene Art und Ihre Expertise können Sie mit allen Hierarchieebenen im Krankenhaus auf Augenhöhe kommunizieren. Networking ist für Sie nicht nur ein Begriff, sondern eine Lebenseinstellung.

The Business Technology Leader (BTL) is responsible for defining technology strategy in Germany.
For these areas, the BTL will serve as a critical point of contact for the General Manager of Germany and his board.

He/she will be responsible for developing IT as a competitive advantage and enabler for the business, identifying how technology can help to accelerate business growth in these areas. This individual should be a passionate change agent and have a good understanding about the challenges and opportunities of doing business in EMEA.

The well-being and development of our employees are central aspects of our company creed. Individuals who would like to fully realize their potential as part of our international, innovation-driven corporate family and who aspire to have challenging work, will find that our company provides just the right conditions. We consider intensive initial training, further education that is tailored to our employees' work and excellent opportunities for development - both nationally and internationally - to be just as essential as a good work-life balance, attractive compensation and above-average employee benefits. One aspect that distinguishes our company is the large number of measures we have to support our trainees and promote career development in ways that are also compatible with family life.
De afdeling, werkzaamheden en verantwoordelijkheden.

Het team reliability management binnen de afdeling maintenance bestaat uit een groep van 11 (Ass.) Maintenance Engineers (MO) die verantwoordelijk zijn voor de betrouwbaarheid van Utilities en Productie apparatuur. Iedere MO heeft de verantwoordelijkheid voor het onderhoud van een deel van de Utilities of van het productie apparatuur. Dit onderhoud wordt aangestuurd via SAP. De MO is niet uitvoerend, maar verantwoordelijk voor de regie over alle openstaande orders, i.e. regie over voorbereiding, werkuren, uitvoer, inclusief checks in het veld, veiligheid en kosten. Het onderhoud wordt uitgevoerd door een contract partij of door interne technicians. Alle werkzaamheden worden verricht volgens GMP, ISO en/of EH&S; regelgeving.

De onderhoudsstrategie wordt bepaald aan de hand van Reliable Centered Maintenance (RCM). Op basis van risico’s op het gebied van veiligheid, milieu, kosten, kwaliteit en doorstroom wordt bepaald wat preventief of correctief wordt onderhouden en wat het spare-part beleid is. De MO is verantwoordelijk voor de uitvoer en opvolging van het RCM proces.

De MO werkt nauw samen met de technische eigenaar, de systeem eigenaar en de gebruiker. Samen met eventueel andere disciplines vormen zij het asset team. Het asset team is verantwoordelijk voor de huidige en voor de toekomstige status van systemen en equipment: i.e. betrouwbare systemen, 5-jaar vervangingsstrategy en introductie van nieuwe technieken en nieuwe technologiën. Voor deze functie zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Reliability Engineer.
Minimale functie-eisen:

Technische HBO opleiding (bijv. werktuigbouwkunde of instrumentatie)Ervaring met onderhoud gerelateerde werkzaamheden. Zelfstandig inzetbaar: in staat zijn zelf te plannen en daar naar te handelen;Herkennen wanneer issues niet zelf op te lossen zijn en geëscaleerd moeten worden;Ervaring met GMP, ISO en SH&E; regelgeving;Ervaring hebben met SAP is gewenst;Goede communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk; In staat zijn individuen en teams aan te sturen. Bij voorkeur ervaring met change management.Ervaring met Process Excellence, projectmanagement en troubleshooting is gewenst.

Job title: Country Recruiter Location: Taiwan [Role Description]

The Country Recruiter will be responsible for managing the talent acquisition process for selected J&J; groups(Consumer, Janssen, Medical Devices, vision care & AMO) spanning all Operating Companies in Taiwan This position will report to the Talent Acquisition Lead of Taiwan & HK [Responsibilities] • Work on the complete, end to end recruitment process with Key stakeholders(Hiring Managers, Business Based HR (BUHR), Service Center and other J&J; Specialist Groups (when necessary) • Collaborate with relevant stakeholders in creating staffing plans, developing strategies and implementing agreed action plans • Deploy and use job appropriate behavioral and competency based interview methodology • Coach hiring managers or teams on interviewing and candidate assessment techniques • Identify and share recruitment best practices across business units of focus using the J&J; Talent Acquisition Service Delivery model • Maintain current knowledge of business, marketplace, legal and recruitment trends and requirements • Contribute to development of and implement agreed sourcing strategy to achieve significant reduction in agency sourcing which may include supporting other markets when required • Interview prospective employees and evaluate candidates for employment factors such as job experience, education and training, knowledge, skills and abilities, organizational culture considerations, and other data pertinent to classification and selection for a wide variety of nonexempt and exempt positions • Consult with hiring managers on recommended starting salaries and other offer package details including, but not limited to, sign on bonuses, relocation, vacation, stock options, annual bonus, etc., Negotiate offers • Provide candidate offer package recommendation to line manage • Check professional references and drive other candidate due diligence activities in compliance with the recruitment operating procedures • Manage all data associated with the recruitment process - e.g. candidate information, interview process details, offer information ensuring accurate and timely encoding of all information in the Recruitment Technology • Ensure that the recruitment process flow complies with agreed Service Level Agreements (SLAs) keeping in mind to keep the process moving forward • Manage all recruitment reports ensuring accuracy and submission in a timely manner • Provide company information to candidates and appropriately engage candidates on the value proposition of the Johnson & Johnson experience • Ensure that the process and the final hiring decision are properly handled in a timely manner. Gather/compile/maintain/provide regular metrics for HR-related activities • Establish close relationship with Third Party Vendors, collaborating to improve overall recruitment process, measuring and reporting their performance regularly
[Requirements]

• Bachelors’ degree and above • Min 3 years experiences in Human Resource with demonstrated capability in staffing activities, business partnering, and strong working experience in area of recruitment and/or consulting • Flexibility and ability to work on a broad variety of HR matters • Must have a demonstrated capability in recruiting for wide variety of levels and positions in multiple functional disciplines • Strong customer and marketplace focus; negotiation and influencing skills; project management, and time management are required • Ability to work within a team approach is required • Good interpersonal communication skill • Good command of English communication skill • Proactive & positive & innovative mind • Strong negotiation & communication skill • Strong analytical, problem solving and project management skills • MS Office skills (Word, PPT, Excel) proficiency
[Desirable]

• Experience with Taleo other similar Applicant Tracking System is an asset • Experience with Targeted Selection/Behavioral Interviewing • Experience with Candidate sourcing, mapping especially building talent pipeline • Experience in managing vendors as part of the recruiting process • Experience in candidate sourcing, candidate database research is a plus

Johnson & Johnson Vision is recruiting for a Lens Fabrication Technician III to be located in Jacksonville, FL.

Johnson & Johnson Vision is committed to improving and restoring sight for patients worldwide. Since debuting the world’s first disposable soft contact lens in 1987, it has been helping patients see better through their world-leading ACUVUE® Brand Contact Lenses. In 2017, J&J; expanded into cataract surgery, laser refractive surgery (LASIK) and consumer eye health and now serves more than 60 million patients a day across 103 countries with its eye health portfolio. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

A Lens Fabrication Technician III has deep understanding over key contact lens manufacturing processes, and is expected to assist process engineers in the development of new processes. This role visibly demonstrates standards of practice for junior technicians.

We are currently seeking a highly motivated individual for the position of Senior associate Scientist/Scientist in our cancer drug translational group. The successful candidate will join an interactive research group evaluating novel cancer therapeutic targets for hematological malignancies.
RESPONSIBILITIES

Apply expertise in cancer cell signaling, tumor models and translational research to plan, design, execute and troubleshoot experiments required for preclinical experiments and validation of experimental therapeutic reagents.
Apply different cell biology, molecular biology and biochemical tools to study biological mechanisms of drug action and evaluation of drug combination rational.
Search, evaluate and adopt the latest methodologies to advance projects.

The ideal candidate holds Ph.D. in life sciences and has 0-5 years of relevant post-doctoral experiences, preferably in industry setting, supported by track records of innovative research demonstrated by publication in peer-reviewed journals.

Experiences on a variety of standard biochemistry, cell and molecular biology methods, organoid/3D, primary cell cull culture, gene knock down/our technologies, nucleic acid technologies and multi-color flow cytometry analysiss especially in hematological cancer setting is a plus. Training and background in functional genomics, immune cell interactions and tumor microenvironment will be highly valuable.
The candidate needs to critically read and evaluate scientific literature, solve technical problems, committed to generating data and results with utmost rigor and integrity.

The successful candidate has excellent organization and record keeping skills; effective communication for both written and oral presentations; works efficiently both as an individual contributor and a team player.
· Based in Ultimo
· Join a leading brand in healthcare
· Free on-site gym

JOB TITLE: Associate Director, Biology Drug Discovery, Hepatitis DAS
job_title: Associate Director, Biology Drug Discovery, Hepatitis DAS
job_description: The Hepatitis DAS in Shanghai, China, is seeking for an Associate Director to lead a team of scientists working on anti-HBV drug discovery. The qualified candidate will join a diversified team of scientists in a science-driven environment aiming to discover and develop novel medicines for the treatment of HBV infection. The candidate will contribute to forming the strategy towards viral entry, replication and assembly assay development; understand mechanism of action and reverse genetics studies; lead a multi-disciplinary team of scientists to ensure progress and success in delivery of antiviral drug discovery program.
Hold a Ph. D degree in biochemistry, molecular virology or a related field with more than five years of industry working experience.
Be able to lead drug discovery project team from pre-clinical stage to clinical initiation.
Be able to supervise internal team and oversee external CRO where conducting experiments involving in biochemistry, biophysics and molecular virology.
Be able to multitask, trouble-shoot and meet the timeline of milestones in a fast-paced company environment.
Be able to interact and lead global functional representatives in project team.
Excellent communication skills in a diverse multicultural environment.

JOB TITLE: Regional Scientific Advisor (m/w/d) Hämato-Onkologie Für Die Region Berlin, Brandenburg, Sachsen-Anhalt, Sachsen
job_title: Regional Scientific Advisor (m/w/d) Hämato-Onkologie für die Region Berlin, Brandenburg, Sachsen-Anhalt, Sachsen
job_description: Uns verbindet die Leidenschaft für unsere Mitmenschen: für Kunden, Patienten, die Gesellschaft, füreinander. Als eines der größten Gesundheitsunternehmen der Welt suchen wir Persönlichkeiten, die mit uns Großes bewirken wollen – das Wohlbefinden und die Gesundheit von Menschen weltweit und in Deutschland zu verbessern. Wir schätzen Charakterköpfe mit Teamgeist, die Verantwortung übernehmen und mit uns innovative Produkte und Services entwickeln. Dafür bieten wir ein modernes, flexibles Arbeitsumfeld und unzählige Karrierewege in unserem internationalen Netzwerk.

Im Geschäftsbereich Pharmaceuticals, bei Janssen in Neuss, widmen Sie sich einigen der größten medizinischen Herausforderungen unserer Zeit. Als Mediziner tragen Sie dazu bei, ganzheitliche Therapiekonzepte für Patienten mit chronischen oder lebensbedrohlichen Krankheiten zu entwickeln. Dabei müssen Sie sich dank eines modernen und flexiblen Arbeitsumfeldes nicht zwischen Familie und Karriere entscheiden.
Regional Scientific Advisor (m/w/d) im Bereich Hämato-Onkologie (Myelome) für die Region Berlin, Brandenburg, Sachsen-Anhalt und Sachsen
Diese Tätigkeit kann aus dem Home Office ausgeübt werden; dabei sollte der Wohnort jedoch in der jeweiligen Region liegen.

Die Förderung und Entwicklung unserer Mitarbeiter/innen sind zentrale Werte unserer Unternehmenskultur. Menschen, die in einem internationalen Unternehmen ihre Potenziale entfalten und an ihren Aufgaben wachsen möchten, finden bei uns beste Voraussetzungen. Neben der intensiven Einarbeitung und der bedarfsgerechten Weiterbildung sind hervorragende Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten - national und international - sowie eine attraktive Vergütung und überdurchschnittliche Sozialleistungen wichtige Elemente für unsere Mitarbeiter. Darüber hinaus ist unser Konzern gekennzeichnet durch nachwuchs- und karrierefördernde Maßnahmen im Einklang mit Familie und Beruf.

JOB TITLE: Regional Medical Advisor (m/w/d) Hämato-Onkologie Für Die Region Berlin, Brandenburg, Sachsen-Anhalt, Sachsen
job_title: Regional Medical Advisor (m/w/d) Hämato-Onkologie für die Region Berlin, Brandenburg, Sachsen-Anhalt, Sachsen
job_description: Uns verbindet die Leidenschaft für unsere Mitmenschen: für Kunden, Patienten, die Gesellschaft, füreinander. Als eines der größten Gesundheitsunternehmen der Welt suchen wir Persönlichkeiten, die mit uns Großes bewirken wollen – das Wohlbefinden und die Gesundheit von Menschen weltweit und in Deutschland zu verbessern. Wir schätzen Charakterköpfe mit Teamgeist, die Verantwortung übernehmen und mit uns innovative Produkte und Services entwickeln. Dafür bieten wir ein modernes, flexibles Arbeitsumfeld und unzählige Karrierewege in unserem internationalen Netzwerk.

Im Geschäftsbereich Pharmaceuticals, bei Janssen in Neuss, widmen Sie sich einigen der größten medizinischen Herausforderungen unserer Zeit. Als Mediziner tragen Sie dazu bei, ganzheitliche Therapiekonzepte für Patienten mit chronischen oder lebensbedrohlichen Krankheiten zu entwickeln. Dabei müssen Sie sich dank eines modernen und flexiblen Arbeitsumfeldes nicht zwischen Familie und Karriere entscheiden.
Regional Medical Advisor (m/w/d) im Bereich Hämato-Onkologie (Myelome) für die Region Berlin, Brandenburg, Sachsen-Anhalt und Sachsen
Diese Tätigkeit kann aus dem Home Office ausgeübt werden; dabei sollte der Wohnort jedoch in der jeweiligen Region liegen.

Als Regional Medical Advisor agieren Sie als wissenschaftlicher Experte und sind für die Implementierung der Medical Affairs Produkt Pläne in dem Ihnen zugewiesenem medizinisch wissenschaftlichen Bereich verantwortlichSie pflegen einen proaktiven und reaktiven wissenschaftlichen Austausch zu medizinisch wissenschaftlichen Informationen mit externen Experten aus Medizin und Forschung. Insbesondere der Auf- und Ausbau, sowie die Pflege des Key Opinion Leader Netzwerks, der Austausch mit Fachgesellschaften sowie gesundheitspolitischer Organisationen zum Aufbau und Erhalt einer medizinisch wissenschaftlichen Partnerschaft auf AugenhöheIn Ihrer internen Schnittstellenfunktion agieren Sie als medizinischer Berater und der Erarbeitung medizinisch relevanter Fragestellungen zur klinischen Prüfung (interventionelle und nicht-interventionelle Studien) sowie der Leitung medizinischer Projekte in enger Abstimmung mit zuständigen FachkollegenSie erlangen wertvolle strategische Kenntnisse über die Therapiepfade, wissenschaftliche und klinische Aktivitäten und Entwicklungen in den Kernindikationen und liefern einen Beitrag zur Identifikation der Data Gaps und Medical Needs als Basis der Entwicklung von Patient Outcome Lösungen. Ferner unterstützen Sie proaktiv die Erarbeitung und Implementierung einer medizinischen Strategie

JOB TITLE: Visita Médica Reumatología Y Diabetes - Pamplona
job_title: Visita Médica Reumatología y Diabetes - Pamplona
job_description: Janssen Cilag S.A., compañía líder en el sector, busca incorporar un profesional de Visita Médica para su unidad de Reumatología y Diabetes, en la zona de Navarra.
Con el porfolio y pipeline más interesante del sector, Janssen ofrece la oportunidad de formar parte de un proyecto innovador, puntero y referente dentro de la industria farmacéutica.

Como parte de Johnson & Johnson, nuestra misión en Janssen es transformar la vida de los pacientes mediante el descubrimiento y desarrollo de soluciones innovadoras para cubrir las necesidades médicas más importantes de nuestro tiempo.

Buscamos incorporar profesionales con talento, ganas ilimitadas de contribuir, aprender, y buenos ¨team-players¨, dispuestos a afrontar cualquier reto y a lograr resultados excelentes. Buscamos personas que sean capaces de encontrar oportunidades y proactivamente fomentar su propio desarrollo.
Principales funciones que desempeñar:
- Creación y seguimiento de la cartera de clientes para alcanzar los objetivos de venta establecidos por la compañía.
- Aumentar la penetración del producto asignado en el mercado.
- Asesoramiento y promoción del producto asignado.
- Gestión del territorio a través de un plan para alcanzar los objetivos establecidos.
- Preparación de cada visita.
- Desarrollar presentaciones centradas en el producto y orientadas a cliente.
- Preparación de reporte de ventas y documentación requerida.
- Realizar seguimiento con los diferentes clientes para resolver cualquier cuestión y asegurar satisfacción.
- Ejecutar estrategias y tácticas clave para impulsar el negocio.
- Investigar los análisis de negocios para reconocer las oportunidades, fortalezas y tendencias
del territorio.
¿Qué ofrecemos como compañía?
- Compañía certificada como empresa EFR (Empresa familiarmente Responsable) durante los 10 últimos años

- Diversidad de medidas disponibles para los empleados: horario flexible de entrada y salida en oficinas, gimnasio en oficinas, vehículo de empresa para posiciones de campo, plan de pensiones, seguro de vida, seguro médico privado, ayuda a hijos menores de 3 años, ayuda a familiares con discapacidad, ofertas en productos Johnson&Johnson;, etc.
- Oportunidad de crecimiento profesional en una empresa líder del sector farmacéutico, reconocida por su innovación a través de proyectos exigentes en los que aprender de los mejores profesionales.
- Plan de carrera alineado con los recursos globales de Johnson & Johnson que te ayudarán a seguir creciendo como profesional.
Visita la web nuestra web para obtener más información sobre la compañía y nuestros productos: http://www.janssenpharmaceuticals.com
Titulación Universitaria finalizada. Valorable Ciencias de la Salud.
- Disponibilidad para viajar
- Posibilidad de residencia en Pamplona.
- Permiso de conducir
- Experiencia previa en Visita Médica a partir de 1 año.
- Valorable experiencia en el área terapéutica
- Historial de resultados demostrables
- Capacidades de comunicación, organización, planificación en un entorno de ventas competitivo.

Base-business Engineer (EWHU & Matrix)

The base-business engineer is the primary Engineering point of contact on the field to support the manufacturing activities, working with production supervisor and associates, quality technicians and engineers, planers and maintenance associates. In close partnership with other Departments, he/she fixes safety, quality or equipment performance issues, leads and implement improvements on those areas. This position offers a wide range of interactions with different functions within the Plant and range of projects & tasks, thus offering a chance to develop a broad range of skills (technical, Quality & Compliance, HSE…).

Equipment and processes correction & corrective action in case of technical or quality issues, in close partnership with Maintenance and Quality Departments.Identification & implementation of process & equipment improvement with regards to Safety, Quality, and/or efficiency.Lead or support to validation or verifications triggered by raw material or component changes, including project management and execution of the validations / verificationsEngineering support to base-business activities upon partner department’s request : Non-Conformances and CAPA investigations, product complaint, Procedure and Work Instruction changes…Primary Point of contact with regards to process and equipment validations during internal and external audits.

Janssen R&D;, a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting a Senior / Principal Scientist - Drug Product Development Scientific Integrator, based in Beerse, Belgium. The Pay Grade Level for this position is: 31.

Janssen Research & Development area develops treatments that improve the health and lifestyles of people worldwide. R&D; development areas encompass novel targets in neurologic disorders, gastroenterology, oncology, infectious disease, diabetes, hematology, metabolic disorders, immunologic disorders, pulmonary hypertension and reproductive medicine. The Principal Scientist Scientific Integrator is the DPD (Drug Product Development) representative and single point of contact on the CMC new product development teams.

The Principal Scientist leads a sub team of DPD scientists including Oral Solid Dosage Development, Parenterals & Liquids, Pharmaceutical and Material Sciences, Primary Container & Device, integrating DPD activities so that deliverables are being met balancing cost/time/quality. Specifically, the Scientific Integrator (SI) will provide scientific technical leadership, ensuring the focus on scientific excellence is maintained within the DPD/CMC teams.

This role will be focused on defining the DP development strategy across phases (E2E and LCM), through in depth understanding of the compound properties and TPP, aligned with DPD function, CMC and CDT team.Driving the project advancement (NME - TOO) in partnership with DPD functions, CMC lead, CDT functions (preclinical and clinical), JSC while ensuring scientific standards are metOverseeing the planning and execution of DPD project deliverablesDelivering clinical and commercial robust formulations and manufacturing processes, meeting manufacturing performance, cost needs, in line with QbD/DTV principlesThe scientific integrator will overview the project as core member of the CMC team, with key interactions with API and analytical integrators, clinicians, technical groups, external consultants and vendors as well as portfolio management functionsThe scientific integrator will also connect to and collaborate with other functions/partners such as QA, JSC, GTS, RA, NCS, DMPK and QS.Leading and providing technical leadership to a team of DPD scientists including OSD, PLG, DPD Engineering, PS, PCD, CSC engineers, ensuring the focus on scientific excellence is maintained within the DPD/CMC teamsLeading the BioPharm team, composed of CMC, clinical, preclinical, regulatory, toxicology and/or other relevant functions to ensure correct formulation selection in view of the required PK profile, to determine bridging strategies, to define clinically relevant controls and ultimately correct specs.Responsible to have a full product and process technical/scientific understanding.Responsible for and driving the Level 1 Governance Review for the assigned projects. Managing the DP risk register and defines mitigation plans. He/she will ensure rapid identification and resolution of problems.

Depuy Synthes Companies of Johnson & Johnson is the largest, most creative and comprehensive orthopedic and neurological business in the world. DePuy Synthes Companies offer an unparalleled breadth and depth of products, services and programs in the areas of joint reconstruction, trauma, spine, sports medicine, neurological, craniomaxillofacial, power tools and biomaterials. Building on the legacy and strengths of two outstanding companies, more agile and better equipped to meet the needs of today’s evolving health care environment. With a focus on activating insights to develop innovative, comprehensive solutions, we are encouraged to advance patient care in greater ways than either company could accomplish on its own.
For our Engineering Science and Technology (EST) department in Bettlach, we are looking for a Manufacturing Engineering Team Leader.

You will provide leadership and direction for a team of engineering technician resources and activities, along with ensuring the engineering team performs within budget and to plan, using best practices, innovation, and people development. You will be partnering with manufacturing and quality in the identification, definition and execution of projects and delivers technical requirements for the launch of products as well as continuous improvement of the supply chain capabilities.

You encourage and support the identification and development of innovative solutions to problems and opportunities.

Actively invest in the professional development of engineering staff including work knowledge and abilities requiring application of standard engineering techniques, procedures and criteria in carrying out engineering tasks, project management, statistical analysis, presentation of data and technical writing. Provides technical support and direction across the site and mentors engineering staff.

Supervise a team consisting of engineering technicians and you are responsible for employee performance management and professional development. This includes but is not limited to identification of training needs and opportunities for development.

You assist in the development and implementation of department strategy outlining technological, organizational and cross-functional needs in alignment with site and engineering level strategic goals, technological guidelines, and organizational models.

Assisting in planning and scheduling the engineering project and capital portfolio, ensuring initiatives enforce to good engineering and documentation practices, are appropriately staffed, are run within budget, and are aligned with prioritization and strategy on a site and cluster level.
Allocating resources to facilitate attainment of project goals within established timelines and budgets and monitors smooth execution of plans and programs.
Creating and maintaining an environment of innovative continuous improvement, focusing on safety, quality, delivery, process development and cost reduction,
Assists in setting, tracking and communicating business metrics for the team in line with location and company objectives and leads course corrections when necessary.
Creating and leading a department, capital investment and savings budget.

Facilitating collaboration between multi-functional teams including associates in Engineering, Product Development, Operations, Regulatory, Quality Assurance, Planning, Materials, etc. to drive business and organizational results.
Actively participating in or leading activities associated to the DePuy Synthes Engineering Cluster, MD&D; Engineering Initiatives, and Virtual Teams.
You are assisting with solving day-to-day problems, discrepancies, and investigations of nonconformances.
Ensuring alignment to the safety requirements for equipment and processes and defines, coordinates, and executing corrective actions involving internal and external resources.
Supporting the development of SOP's, Work Instruction, and other control processes or practices as it pertains to the area of responsibility.

You are planning, conducting, and coordinating activities related to the development of new or improved processes including researching current and emerging technologies, evaluating process cost, quality, and capability alternatives.
Ensure utilization of appropriate engineering principles and standard strategies as e.g. Lean and 5S principles when implementing improvements of existing manufacturing processes.

Ensure adequate and consistent development of user requirement specifications for new equipment and processes for new capital projects using standard templates following applicable HSE and legal requirements.
Ensure consistent development and review of business cases and financial justification for all CIP and capital investment projects in alignment to internal, franchise, and J&J; requirements.
Ensuring cycle times of the manufacturing processes are correctly determined as a basis for process improvements and the implementation of improved technologies.
Ensure adherence to applicable risk management practices when introducing new products and/or processes.
Assisting with and following up on addressing internal and external audit findings making sure open action items are given appropriate priority and are addressed as needed.

Janssen Vaccines & Prevention B.V. is a global biotech company which is part of the Johnson & Johnson family of companies. Within this family the company focuses on the development, production and marketing of vaccines and antibodies to prevent and combat infectious diseases. At the Leiden Site, talented and multi-scaled people are working in a dynamic culture in which innovation and a 'can do' state of mind are the central points. In order to strengthen our team we are continuously looking for enthusiastic, talented people who have the ambition to develop themselves and can be of value to the company.
Due to the continued growth of the EVM department and expansion of our responsibilities we are currently seeking for a fulltime;

The Engineering-Validation-Maintenance (EVM) department (> 30 persons) is a young, motivated and dynamic team responsible for the technical support of all utilities, production and laboratory areas and all involved equipment on the Janssen Vaccines & Prevention site Leiden.

We work in a challenging environment where we make great progress in commercializing our vaccines. Engineering has a large project portfolio to improve the existing environment. The Validation group looks after the correct qualification and validation status of GMP critical equipment and processes. The key-focus point of the maintenance group is asset maintenance management of all assets within JVP.
As Maintenance Engineer Equipment you will play a critical role in the asset maintenance management of our process and manufacturing equipment in our vaccine manufacturing plant “Valerio”.

Your main responsibility will be to lead the asset maintenance management of our critical GMP manufacturing equipment. You will be part of a multidisciplinary team of maintenance specialists in which you will;

Serve as the Maintenance Subject Matter Expert for a number of systems across the production platform.Support the maintenance supervisory team together with the other equipment engineer in setting up, aligning and improving operational maintenance processes like; RCM, spare part management, maintenance and calibration contracting and execution.Interact with peer functions in related support departments like; Operations, Engineering, Process Engineering, Quality Assurance to assure efficient and reliable technical support to our customers.Participate in the EVM 24/7 support team which means that on a regular basis (once every 6 weeks) you will be available for first line support outside normal working hours.

The Demand Planner position is responsible for developing and communicating a consensus forecast for a defined portfolio of product ranges at cluster/affiliate level. Starting from a regionally generated statistical baseline forecast, the Demand Planner further develops and completes the total sales forecast with activities associated to strategies on customer, brand and product level. The Demand Planner is responsible to integrate historical data, market data & strategic plans collected thru the S&OP; Process by close collaboration with sales, marketing, shopper marketing, finance and supply to come up with a total forecast that defines the business direction and aspiration with support of the demand planning manager.

job_description: Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.

Janssen Pharmaceutical joined the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies in 1961. Today, Janssen Pharmaceutical is one of the most innovative pharmaceutical companies in the world. Our research and development centre develops products for a wide range of disease areas, such as mental disorders, neurological problems, infectious diseases, immunological disorders, cancer, and cardiovascular and metabolic conditions.
We are currently looking for an
HealthCare Compliance Officer (m/f/d)

Serves as a Health Care Compliance Officer (HCCO) for Janssen Germany. Leads and drives the Health Care Compliance (HCC) program to ensure business practices and activities are in compliance with related J&J; internal guidelines, local laws and regulations and anti corruption laws including the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. Serves as a strategic business partner for management and coach towards all covered employees, to assure that the company culture of compliance is a natural element in day to day business.
This position is located in Neuss, reports to the Pharma EMEA HCC Sector Lead and dotted line to the Janssen Germany Managing Director.

job_title: Quality Engineering Manager - Product Software Development (d/f/m)
job_description: Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.

Innomedic develops medical software for the Depuy Synthes business unit. This includes software tools and web applications to support the use of complex implants as well as the development of patient specific implants. Another focus is on development-supporting web applications and analysis tools for implant design. We are working in a regulated environment using cutting-edge tool chains to meet requirements of international standards.
Join our team working on groundbreaking products in medical technology.
To strengthen our successful team at the location Philippsburg-Rheinsheim (between Heidelberg and Karlsruhe), we are looking for a
Quality Engineering Manager (d/f/m)

job_description: Janssen Research & Development, LLC, a pharmaceutical company of Johnson & Johnson, is recruiting for an Intelligence and Knowledge Management (IK&M;) Lead, in one of the following locations: Raritan, NJ; Titusville, NJ; Spring House, PA; Beerse, Belgium; Leiden, Netherlands; or High Wycombe, UK.

At Janssen, we focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found. We discover and develop innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Our ultimate goal is to help people live healthy lives. Please visit www.janssenpharmaceuticalsinc.com for more information.
We are recruiting for an exciting opportunity in Regulatory Intelligence in our Global Regulatory Policy and Intelligence group.

This is a challenging and rewarding opportunity for a passionate and focussed Regulatory Intelligence professional to provide regulatory information and analyses to the business for projects in development and on the market.

The Intelligence and Knowledge Management (I&KM;) Individual Leader (Intelligence Lead) will develop situational analyses and recommendations that reflect the current regulatory landscape, the projected or desired future healthcare environment, and the needs of internal development programmes. The Intelligence Lead will provide focused regulatory analysis and intelligence to impact regulatory strategy development for high priority projects and product issue management, primarily within the Janssen portfolio. Monitor therapeutic area and Health Authority requirement specific news and major publications. Develop and provide competitive benchmarking summaries and regulatory background packages. Proactively update existing summaries and analyses, anticipating business needs for priority projects. Directly contribute to the development of processes and initiatives to manage, disseminate, and retain business critical knowledge, including new regulatory requirements. Support global and regional policy initiatives. Contribute to the evaluation and management of use of data sources including regulatory subscriptions and other databases. Provide feedback and assess impact to members of the J&J; community. Maintain partnerships within the J&J; intelligence and knowledge management communities to coordinate across organisations and maximise resources, leverage tools, and avoid duplication of effort.

The Intelligence Lead will establish strong partnerships with regional regulatory leaders, other intelligence/benchmarking groups and other subject matter experts. The Intelligence Lead will also contribute to facilitating access to analyses and information through regulatory knowledge sharing systems.

A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree required. Advanced degree in pharmacy, medicine, library & information science, or a life science-related discipline or equivalent experience preferred. Experience in information searching and associated technology required. Working knowledge of regulatory policy activities, gained within health authority, industry, or trade associations preferred. Working knowledge of the regulatory framework and how that applies to pharmaceutical and healthcare product development required. A minimum of 8 years of regulatory or medical product development experience required with a Bachelor’s degree OR a minimum of 6 years with an advanced degree. Track record of successful working in collaborative, matrixed environment. Ability to work across different business and cultures on a worldwide basis. Ability to make complex decisions that resolve regulatory or business issues and demonstrate acute understanding of the impact of decisions taken. Exercise excellent judgment in assessing priorities and initiating projects, both with and without direction.

This position may be based in Spring House, PA; Raritan, NJ; Titusville, NJ; Beerse, Belgium; Leiden, Netherlands; or High Wycombe, UK; and may require approximately 5% domestic and/or international travel.
BE VITAL in your career; be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies
Responsible to lead and implement the global EHS&S; strategy for the Janssen Cilag offices in Spain.

Based in Spain site, EHS&S; Specialist is responsible for ensuring the local facility EHS&S; operations are in compliance with federal, state, local EHS regulations, as well as Johnson & Johnson EHS Standards. EHS&S; Specialist partner with site leadership teams to establish and implement site EHS&S; strategy and Management Action Plan (MAP) in alignment with the JJSC strategic imperatives and EHS&S; goals.
This position will work closely with the Spanish EHS&S; team and various internal and external stakeholders.

Internal: Global Health, HR, sales & marketing operations, field forces, offices, Supply Chain, Quality leaders and other site and multi-sites functional leaders such as Global Health, Engineering and Facility Management.
Develop, support and facilitate site EHS&S; committees/teams to ensure implementation of the EHS&S; Safety Culture, EHS&S; prevention program, system, risk control and monitoring in efficient way.
· Maintain local EHS&S; office and warehouse standards by ensuring site EHS management systems are aligned & maintained consistent with.
· Collaborate with other functions to manage EHS aspects of external manufacturers, suppliers and contractor programs.
· Develop a strong partnership to manage and monitor fleet safety, Facility Management, Engineering and global health programs with local functions.
· Set, deploy a strategy to implement efficient long term EHS&S; safety culture program.
· Drive operational excellence in EHS&S; risk control and Serious Injury & Illnesses program deployment.
· Lead and implement system and processes for sustainable EHS&S; risk assessment, monitoring and control for each applicable EHS&S; chapter and specific campaign such as Step Right Campaign.
· Mentor and coach sites partner to engrain EHS&S; processes in operation on daily basis.
· Ensure strict alignment on reporting process and EHS&S; tool deployment.
· Ensure permanent Compliance level and immediate escalation process in respect of J&J; alert and reporting guidelines.
Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
Experience: 4 years of EHS experience is required; must include extensive experience with local regulated environment.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

EHS&S; or Scientific Background. Technical experience in diverse EHS areas including but not limited to air, water, Biosafety, Ionizing, Occupational Safety, hazardous and medical waste, fleet safety, ergonomics, industrial hygiene and chemical handling is highly desirable. Demonstrated project management skills are required and individual must have technical/working knowledge of federal, state and local regulations.
Competencies/Skills and Abilities
· Excellent interpersonal, communication (written & verbal), problem-solving, influence, planning, organizing, and time management skills. Superior team player.
· Good interpersonal skills and classroom instructor skills are required.
· Business management – produce & maintain project schedules & budgets
· Interfacing – associates & local, state & federal inspectors
· Organizational skills – generate all required reports & record keeping systems
· Experience is required in identifying, evaluating and controlling EHS risks in the workplace.
· Ability to quickly interpret complex regulatory issues and provide recommended course of action.
· Ability to lead local EHS professionals and manage additional multi-site EHS resources.
Computer Skills:
· Proficient in MS Office software programs including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
· J&J; Worldwide EHS data reporting and tracking systems.
· Internet, intranet and database tools (internal and external) as needed to support the EHS function.

A member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, the world’s leading healthcare company, DePuy Synthes is dedicated to providing patients all around the globe with a lifetime of movement solutions. DePuy Synthes has been a pioneer in the fields of orthopaedics, spinal care and neuroscience therapies for decades. From non-surgical pain management to complete surgical solutions, it’s range of treatment options include those for treating or reconstructing damaged or diseased joints, caring for traumatic skeletal injuries, treating spinal disorders and deformity, and repairing injured soft tissue. In addition, DePuy Synthes offers a wide range of state-of-the-art therapies for neurological and central nervous system care.
Currently we are looking for Talents for:
Consignment Specialist
Location: Brno, Czech Republic
Contract: Permanent

While we strive to better serve our customers, we stay committed to ensure robust compliance and to improve cost management. Consignment inventory enables us to service some of our large customers seamlessly. It is critical to have a strong governance and consignment management to deliver desired outcomes. Thus, following our strategic decision, we look for a Consignment Specialist in Czech Republic.

Reports to: Commercial Analytics Manager
Location: Leeds or Pinewood

Caring for the world, one person at a time... inspires and unites the people of Johnson & Johnson. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.

We have more than 250 operating companies in 57 countries employing 120,200 people. With $81.6 billion in 2018 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing approximately 130,000 people in 60 countries throughout the world.
Summary of Role:

Your role will be to provide accurate and timely reporting on sales force performance for the UK and Ireland (IRE). You will generate insights that will be used to influence and drive strategic business decisions. You will be responsible for executing day-to-day configuration, support, technical training and maintenance of Salesforce. You will provide daily supervision and contribute to the development of the team.
Key Stakeholders

Working as part of the Commercial Analytics department you will work with a wide range of internal teams including Sales, Marketing and Finance. You will work closely with the Sales Force Effectiveness Lead to shape and build current and future capabilities to support Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices UK & Ireland business growth.
Main Responsibilities

Own the shaping and technical capability development for SFE (Sales Force Effectiveness). Identify and build new reports and dashboards to meet evolving business needs. Derive insights and recommendations from raw data to drive business performance. Ensure accurate, efficient and consistent reporting. Utilise advanced visualisation software to build dashboards. Primary Salesforce administrator and technical expert. Ongoing development and deployment of new business processes and tool functionality. Provide technical training to the sales team on tool usage. Ongoing master data validation, maintenance and mapping updates. Lead projects and process improvements initiatives. Oversee daily activities of assigned employees. Training and development of employees. Review and approval of commercial reports. Represent the commercial analytics function in cross departmental meetings and initiatives. Collaborate with regional teams to adopt and drive standardisation. Ongoing business partnering to drive tool adoption and utilisation effectiveness. Proactively drive the UK and Ireland Sales Force Effectiveness (SFE) agenda and play a leading role in the SFE Governance meetings.

Within the J&J; Medical Devices supply chain, the Reliability and Business Analytics group is responsible for reliable KPI reporting and analytics projects. To enable this, a data warehouse has been developed as the single source of truth for key supply chain PLAN metrics for the Ethicon and Cardiovascular and Specialty Surgery (CSS) business units. The platform consists of a Teradata database and a Tableau visualization layer.

The Data Analyst will lead the further expansion of the platform and continuously drive capability improvements to turn data into business insights. The scope of this position encompasses all Ethicon and CSS business units in all regions worldwide. This individual will be the main point of contact for assigned KPI’s, will maintain an in-depth business relationship with the key stakeholders and will facilitate, govern, and lead report creation.

J&J; Surgical Vision in Groningen is the Center of Excellence for the development of innovative solutions for the surgical ophthalmic market, mainly intraocular lenses (IOLs). The site is responsible for the design and manufacture of these products. A project has started to further develop IOL manufacturing technology with a high degree of automation. Therefore, the Quality Department is looking for a
Quality Assurance Engineer – Design Quality and/or Process Validation oriented

As a QA Engineer you have a good working knowledge of the applicable regulations regarding the development and production of medical devices, in line with the Medical Devices Regulation, 21CFR Part 820 and ISO 13485 and ISO 14971.

Within our quality department there are several areas of focus. In this role your main area of focus is product, process and technology development. This includes design control, risk management, equipment and process qualification and validation.

You have a close loop approach to quality, like working in teams and projects, are result driven, while having a pragmatic and critical attitude that ensures that the site is in compliance and delivers products of high quality.

Key Quality representative in multidisciplinary team to support new product or process development projects, ensuring compliance. Within development projects you are the process owner of risk management and you set up risk management documentation (FMEA) with a multidisciplinary team. Ensure correct validation processes application (IQ/OQ/PQ/PPQ) via proactive support, and review and approval of documentation. Support, perform and assess statistical analyzes and support in the implementation of statistical process control techniques, sampling schemes and other quality techniques Ensure that the change control procedures are correctly applied, and you review and approve project and Quality documentationCommunicate recent developments about Standards and cGMP in your area of work. Identify critical areas for improvement and prioritize and execute the quality improvements initiatives resulting from this. As needed, you perform or support non-conformance / CAPA root cause investigations, defining action plans and drives these to completion.Responsible for inspection readiness of the projects in scope of your work, and act as an Subject Matter Expert during internal and external audits (e.g. Notified Body or FDA);Escalate any quality or compliance issues to upper management. Maintain a relevant network of contacts with quality and other expertise within JJSV and other J&J; companies, but also with other MDD companies and professional associations, which will allow you to identify best practices for the work.

For our Patent Law Department in Allschwil, Switzerland, we are looking for a Patent Attorney who will be responsible for:

Pro-actively look for inventions within Janssen and create and maintain awareness about use and necessity of patent applications among Janssen employees in order to ensure that new inventions are timely identified by or communicated to the IP department to review for possible patent application filings.Perform thorough analysis of prior art to fully understand the technical and commercial value of the invention and to be able to determine the optimal scope of the patent application.Prepare, draft, prosecute and ensure filing and maintenance of patent applications in order to secure protection for Janssen inventions in the form of Intellectual Property. The candidate possesses the initiative and experience required to manage a patent portfolio independently.Interact with internal clients and discuss research projects, inventions and developments with these clients in order to advice on ‘freedom–to-operate’ thereof as well as on the patent exclusivity that such developments enjoy.Managing/supporting with internal clients and external counsel patent litigations.Provide IP related support for R&D; collaborations between Janssen and third parties.Participate in business development by providing expert advice in license negotiations with other companies and analyze any format agreements with these companies in order to defend and support Janssen’s interests in the domain of patents.Pro-actively monitor, identify and analyze changes, developments and trends in case-law and patent legislation, in Europe, the USA and PCT, in order to timely redirect existing or new Janssen patent applications to these developments. The candidate possesses the willingness to share the learnings with colleagues in the Global Law department.Pro-actively monitor competitor moves and positions regarding patents in order to timely identify any potential violation of Janssen patents and in order to be able to take timely appropriate or corrective actions.Develop, educate and inform for IP related processes and procedures, within the own department as well as within other departments (laboratory notebooks, document retention) in order to ensure a correct, uniform and qualitative approach to patent applications.

The Director contributes to the strategic statistical direction at Janssen through expert-level guidance and input to Pre/Early/Late Development, Research & Discovery, Medical Affairs, Real World Evidence, or Manufacturing Sciences programs for research, development, and/or marketed product needs in Janssen. Manages Direct Reports as a People Leader, and is a leader for strategies, structures, processes, skills, and culture within Statistics & Decision Sciences (SDS).

Provides collaborative leadership to other drug development scientists through consultation and mentoring. Oversees the delivery of analysis, interpretation, design, and reporting or communication of data evidence for research, development, and/or marketed product needs. In partnership with other Quantitative Sciences (QS) functions, contributes to strategic long-term decision-making by Janssen Senior Management. Participates in external activities to help shape the external drug research and development and regulatory environments. Serves as a role model for living the Credo and demonstrating the J&J; Leadership Imperatives for Leaders: Lead, Shape, Connect, and Deliver.
Leadership and Expertise:

Is recognized as a leader within Janssen R&D;, in particular as a statistical scientific advisor/strategist for a Therapeutic or Functional Area, and for organizational leadership skills. Has an established track record for strong organizational leadership with the potential for SDS Leadership Team membership. Gaining recognition as a rising external scientific and/or cross-pharma industry leader. Holds self and others accountable for creating and supporting an environment of trust, collaboration, ethical behavior, diversity, and inclusion. Acts with and leads others to act with a high degree of accountability, agility, and transparency.

Demonstrates strong skills in leveraging and maximizing the contribution of diverse team members as both single contributors and members of efficient teams. Develops internal talent and attracts external talent through industry and academic connections. Provides leadership support through hiring, developing and retaining team and others. Holds self and people managers accountable for conducting effective performance management and meaningful career development conversations.
Quality and Compliance:

Serves as a role model for compliance with organization and company standard operating procedures in timely fashion, such as training and project time accounting. Understands and aligns with relevant regulatory guidance. Takes responsibility for the compliance of team members and for the quality and timeliness of team deliverables.
Resource Management:

Supports decision making and aligns priorities to R&D; priorities. Demonstrates ability to prioritize/allocate resources against organizational priorities. Assesses and coordinates external statistical support providers.
Drug Development:

Plays a central role in sharing the knowledge and aligning the strategy across all SDS support (Pre/Early/Late Development, Research & Discovery, Medical Affairs, Real World Evidence, and Manufacturing Sciences) for a particular Disease/Functional Area. Has an advanced understanding of drug development processes and programs. Has strong experience in regulatory activities (e.g. submissions, interactions). Demonstrates ability to influence drug research & development strategic plans formulated with Senior Management. Ensures consistent approaches across compounds and in alignment with regulatory guidance where appropriate. Develops and oversees the development of strategic quantitative frameworks and scenario simulations to evaluate risk tolerance and options in order to optimize program and analysis strategies. Bridges scientific and business needs – integrating quantitative sciences and strong disease or functional area knowledge and appropriate market/competitive intelligence.
Disease Area Knowledge:
Demonstrated knowledge across multiple disease areas/targets within or across Therapeutic Areas (TAs).

Proactively takes the lead to identify opportunities for innovative solutions to address project critical needs efficiently and effectively. Drives development and implementation of innovative statistical methods and/or drug development strategies.

Represents Statistics & Decision Sciences (SDS) on Review Committees (e.g. Development, Document) and provides approval for Regulatory Documents. Interacts with Health Authorities and external key opinion leaders as a J&J; statistical expert.
External Engagement:

Identifies critical external scientific/statistical/business trends. Actively contributes to external relationships/industry connections that drive internal outcomes and industry-level guidelines (i.e. enhancing competitive edge, knowledge sharing, talent attraction, corporate reputation advancement, etc.). Supports and enables others to establish similar relationships and connections. Actively contributes to external forums/policy shaping/white-papers to shape best practice statistical science. Actively participates as a member of professional organizations, such as attending meetings sponsored by professional organizations, serving professional organizations as an officer, or event co-coordination, or session chair. Works with cross pharma consortiums to develop industry standards. Contributes to the advancement of statistical methodology through publications. Peer reviews or edits professional journal manuscripts.

Serves as a role model, and mentor to statisticians and other scientists. Takes a lead role in sharing statistical knowledge, within SDS and/or cross-functionally. Mentors junior colleagues in techniques, processes, and responsibilities.

Identifies, leads, and implements process improvements. Develops training and standards. Demonstrates adaptability to change and serves as a role model to drive departmental alignment with strategic changes.
Demonstrated performance in progressive, advanced, complex programs/studies.

Demonstrates strong skills in negotiating agreements and building internal cross-functional partnerships and external relationships that improve communication, efficiency, and productivity. Collaborates effectively with SDS colleagues and with external sourced partners to achieve results for project specific needs. Works across a matrix organization and cross-functionally to identify and resolve issues. Leverages SDS role in drug research and development to help support broader R&D; Operations (RDO) objectives.

Demonstrates excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills. Demonstrated ability to collaborate and consult with non-statisticians, translating complex statistical concepts to drug research & development partners and positively influencing their decisions.
Demonstrates full proficiency in SAS or R, as well as a working knowledge of other relevant computational tools as required.

Ph.D. in Statistics or related field with strong relevant experience, or Master’s in Statistics or related field with commensurate years of relevant experience.Proficient in SAS or R programming. Highly effective written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.Demonstrated people leadership and management skills.Demonstrated ability to work in interdisciplinary contexts outside statistics.

Master’s in Statistics or related field with commensurate years of relevant experience.
Proficient in SAS or R programming. Highly effective written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.
Demonstrated people leadership and management skills.

Caring for the world, one person at a time, inspires and unites the people of Johnson & Johnson. We believe in collaboration, and that has led to breakthrough after breakthrough, from medical miracles that have changed lives, to the simple consumer products that make every day a little better. Over 125,000 employees in 60 countries are united in a common mission: To help people everywhere live longer, healthier, happier lives.

Our Family of Companies is organized in to three primary business sectors – pharmaceuticals, medical devices, and consumer healthcare. At Janssen, we are dedicated to addressing and solving some of the most important unmet medical needs of our time in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Driven by our commitment to patients, we bring innovative products, services and solutions to people throughout the world.

JOB TITLE: 【Janssen】 R&D Japan Clinical Science Div., Hematology Clinical Lead (Manager)
job_title: 【Janssen】 R&D; Japan Clinical Science Div., Hematology Clinical Lead (Manager)
job_description: 【Janssen】 R&D; Japan Clinical Science Div., Hematology Clinical Lead (Manager)

JCL is accountable for all scientific discussion/deliverables, especially study design and outlines, study results and clinical data package in clinical studies in the assigned compound(s), from early to post-marketing, that JCoT is responsible. JCL is responsible to execute designing, implementation and completion of clinical studies fulfilling clinical data package for appropriate New Drug Application (J-NDA) submission and is also responsible to execute appropriate communication with PMDA with regard to clinical studies; e.g. PMDA consultation, J-NDA submission, etc.
Compound life cycle management:
Executes R&D; KOL management.
Execute R&D; publications based on the agreed R&D; publication plan.
Development planning and execution:
Creates, revises and maintains study design and outlines, scientific rationale, Protocol Element Document (PED) and full protocol of the clinical studies aligned with the clinical study plan.
Provides leadership to implement study protocol, knowledge transfer to JCOL, and execute clinical study oversight of clinical studies, in addition to creating and updating the following documents:
- Investigator’s Brochure (IB)
- FAQ on patient eligibility or other medical issues and potential concerns during execution of clinical study in Japan.
- Summary of the compensation system for subject health injury in Japan.
- Criteria of protocol deviation, if any.
- Medical monitoring plan/medical review plan, if any.
- Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP)
- Analytical risk based monitoring plan,
- Related other documents to clinical studies
- Training materials for JCOL and study operation team involved, if any.
Provides leadership to execute medical monitoring while conducting independent clinical study in Japan (Local study).

Provides leadership to execute risk and feasibility assessment of full protocol of the studies including impact assessment of unapproved in Japan, out of scope in J-labelling, imported drugs regardless approval in Japan.

Provides leadership to create Clinical Study Report (CSR) of the Local study, relevant parts of Common Technical Document (J-CTD), including discussion on appropriate data interpretation from top line results and tabulations, and key message clarification.
Provides leadership to file CTD as JNDA including labeling discussion.
Post marketing activities:
Contributes to package insert (J-labelling) development.
Supports to develop risk management plan including post marketing surveillance studies led by JSS.
If post marketing clinical study in Japan is considered, practical support will be necessary by JCL.
Reporting lines and talent pipelines:
Provides feedback regarding Japan Clinical Scientists and Study Responsible Physician (in case of the Local study) to be reported to the Assoc. Dir.
M.S. or equivalent is required (M.D., Ph.D. – preferable).

5 years of pharmaceutical industry experience overall including clinical study experience at least three years. Preferable to demonstrate leadership in two or more development programs which led to successful clinical trial execution and registration in Japan.
Strong oral and written communication skills in both English and Japanese.
Good planning and tracking skills.
Demonstrates influence, negotiation and conflict resolution skills, including the ability to influence without clear reporting authority.
Good problem solving skills for developing creative solutions.
Critical Leadership Imperatives:
Builds strong and positive relationships with R&D; leaders and partners, colleagues and related functions.
Identifies unsolved needs per insights and find effective solutions thought-out cross function-wide collaborations.
Delivers add-value solutions from insights, and challenge against status-quo for positive change onto the organization.
Takes risk and manage it without jeopardizing quality and/or compliance.
Responses talent development, talent fulfillment, and performance improvement, by having diverse visions, experiences, and ability.
Contributes high performance organization by transparent conversation.
Demonstrates leadership to act speedy, agility and accountability.
Acts to yourself to make local R&D-wide; decision-making, which makes balance between short-term performance and long-term vision.

job_description: HR Advisor with Slovak, Czech & English
Location: Prague
Full time fixed term contract

Are you willing to work in a Shared Services center organization, a multinational company with a strong background? We are looking for a new colleague to join our HR Services team on a position as HR Advisor. We are seeking an enthusiastic and proactive team player, who would like to work in open-minded and friendly HR Services team. This is an excellent opportunity for junior candidates who want to get their first experience in the HR field.

As HR Advisor, you will be responsible for administration of HR Employee Database, for providing administrative support across the Czech Republic and Slovakia from Hire to Retire (e.g. Onboarding, Personal Data Changes, Maternity and Parental Leave, Benefits, Job and Compensation Changes, Terminations) that includes also scanning of the documents, preparing employees files and uploading them into the internal system.

The HR Advisor is preparing employment contracts and other HR documents (e.g. termination letters or contract amendments), providing regular reporting activities and ensuring correct record (employee files) management as per legal or company requirements.

You will share knowledge/information with the team on regular basis to achieve best practice and resolving of administrative issues quickly and effectively. In this role, you will also work with stakeholders, such as Talent Acquisition, Payroll or HRBP on daily basis to achieve better cooperation, to gather E2E process overview and to provide better customer service to J&J; employees.
