The role of Lead Network Solutioning is ownership, management and delivery of network infrastructure requests throughout their lifecycle. The scope covers all aspects of Voice and Data networking including traditional Data requests, UCC, IPT, Contact Centers, Telepresence and Wi-Fi and may include involvement in critical global requests in addition to regionally specific. The role is responsible for understanding and addressing business requirements, building solutions which comply with J&J; standards and working with in-house resources, capacity teams, outsourced teams and vendors to ensure cost-effective and on-time delivery of solutions that meet business partner’s requirements. The role will also be responsible for effective communication with business partners and stakeholders. When required, the role may become involved with operational support related to the delivered solution.
Major Duties & Responsibilities
Approximate Percentage of Time
Tasks/Duties/Responsibilities
Conduct network solution requirements gathering and develop options and alternatives

Provide pre-project consulting to the business and recommend network solutions to solve business problems. Work with IT and business to define requirements for current project needs. Develop solutions compliant with J&J; architectural standards and work with Global Engineering team to design non-standard solutions when required.

Build solutions and implementation plans utilizing the appropriate internal and external resources (Ordering & Quoting team; Change Management team; Implementation Planner Capacity team; vendor resources) and ensuring full involvement of business partners and communication to all stakeholders.

Ensure flawless execution of implementation plan in conjunction with vendors and resource teams. Co-ordinate service introduction, hypercare, documentation, operational handover and if necessary, provide support for operational issues.

Provide regional and global support for request management process; representing region to develop global standards, processes and best practices for Networking; acting as an escalation point for specific projects.
Other Duties
Involvement in vendor selection and governance processes
Backup and support roles and functions in the Network team to ensure delivery of consistent customer service
Key Working Relationships
Internal
Business Units, Internal Global Network Services organization; Project Management Organization
External
Vendors, capacity teams/contractors; outsourced engineering resources
Required Minimum Education: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience

· Good technical knowledge and experience with two or more of the following infrastructure components: SDN, SDWAN, DHCP/DNS, WAN/LAN topologies and services, WLAN, MPLS, IP management tools, network management applications, Internet, IPT, QOS, EIGRP/BGP, unified communications, multimedia/VoIP solutions, SIP, and contact center technology
· Knowledge and/or Certification on Cisco data networking products and IOS, firewalls, load balancing technology and/or contact center and unified communication solutions
· Familiar with Cloud Solutions such as Azure, AWS
· Proven experience in managing outcomes in an IT infrastructure environment
· Experience translating business requirements into technical network solutions
· Experience in network and infrastructure planning and development
· Experience managing technically complex telecommunication deployments and projects
· Excellent written and oral communication skills
· Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively
· Strong customer service focus
· Willingness to work some unsociable hours – weekends and evenings – to support implementations
· Reliable, result oriented and analytical person who always takes accountability/responsibility
· Can work under pressure and manage stressful situations confidently & effectively
· Essential to have a positive attitude, be business-focused, customer & service minded
· A team player who is also self-motivated and can investigate and drive issues independently
· Possess strong communication (bi-lingual in English and Mandarin) and interpersonal skills to interact effectively with other services, end-users and management
· Strong documenting and technical writing skills
Preferred Qualifications
Preferred Minimum Education: Masters / Bachelor’s Degree
Preferred Area of Study: Computer Science, Telecommunications, Electronics/Electrical Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Engineering
Preferred Related Industry Experience: Experience in Health Care/Pharmaceutical sectors would be advantageous
Preferred Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
CCNP certification, CISCO VOIP Training/Certification - Essential
PMP, Agile, Scrum Master, Lean certification (good to have / non mandatory)

For our production site in Grenchen we are currently looking for a:
Maintenance Planner (fix term contract for 2 years)

The Maintenance Planner position is responsible for assisting with the development of Reliability Based Maintenance strategy, based on preventive and predictive maintenance. They will work directly with the production and maintenance technician to find the best way to implement maintenance activities in production. The Planner position requires hands on maintenance experience and will be utilized when needed. All tasks will be performed while supporting the policies, goals and objectives of the company.
Your Responsibilities:

Plans and schedules all preventive, predictive, corrective, and special projects work orders (W/O’s) issued to the Maintenance Department by all other departments of the plant and serves as liaison for the coordination of any technical support needed from plant personnel.Perform all job duties in full accordance with the Worldwide Policies on Information Asset Protection, maintain password(s) as Confidential, and protect Critical Business Information. Incumbent knows, understands, incorporates and complies with all applicable laws and regulations relating to business activities and Policies and Procedures of the Health Care Compliance Program and Code of Conduct.Serve as principal service contact between the Maintenance Department and all other departments of the plant for coordination of W/O’s generated. Supports the Maintenance Department by receiving, plan, job estimates and coordinating W/O’s related to repairs, preventive maintenance and predictive maintenance. Works as Custodial and principal user of the Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS). After receiving the work order, especially corrective, preventive and emergency ones, the incumbent reviews the W/O, clarifies details with originator assuring the proper objective of the W/O, ensures W/O is properly approved and the due date for completion is attainable. (If not, then incumbent must negotiate it with originator and come to consensus). Estimates cost of jobs to be done in terms of labor, time, materials or spare parts and outside services to be contracted, if any. Team working with the affected manufacturing area and the Production Planning group, coordinates equipment & facility resources and/or machine availability to perform W/O’s minimizing impact to the business.Check parts availability and reserve/order against the work order number. Knowing the work force skills distribution, incumbent must ensure the proper utilization of such skills according to the nature and magnitude of the tasks included in the W/O. Prepares a daily, per shift, per maintenance mechanic/technician work program, at least the day before such program will take place, and hand delivers the program to the respective area Maintenance associate for its execution. Coordinates all shutdown schedules requesting work requirements from all departments and team working with Engineering Supervisors/Engineers/Special Projects and Validation/Project Group. Attends weekly Planning and Tactical Group meetings to ensure adequate communication channels are open and clear at all times. Establish constant communication with Production Planners to reduce, at a minimum, any possible interference between production and maintenance works. Ensure commitments are written and followed at all times. When W/O could have any environmental impact, Planner must ensure the compliance of any documentation required by the Environmental Engineer. Plans and controls all contractors’ jobs for Preventive, Predictive and Corrective W/O’s Must observe all company safety norms and regulations at all times and notify any violation or deviation to his/her Safety Administrator. Tracks and reports pertinent Maintenance performance metric information. Partners with Maintenance Coordinators to create action plans and improvement ideas based on the tracking data. Supports all facets of regulatory audits including historical data retrieval, data interpretation and trending information. Conduct weekly PM meetings with Production to assure 100% on-time completion of all PM’s.

job_title: 2019 EMEA Full-Time IRDP in Portugal - Customer Strategy Manager
job_description: Want to use your unique combination of expertise, dedication and drive to spark bold innovation while tackling some of the world's most pressing health challenges? With the power of the world's largest broad-based healthcare company behind you, you'll amplify your impact—and find that you can touch the lives of people everywhere.

Johnson & Johnson is working to fuel a healthier world, from health-centric consumer products to spearheading innovative research. We support Consumer Healthcare, Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices—blending passion, science and technology to change the trajectory of human health.
The Program

The International Recruitment and Development Program (IRDP) is a two-year program that hires high-potential MBA and Master’s students from around the world and helps them develop into the leaders of tomorrow. The program is a career differentiator: IRDP participants gain the expertise and experience they need to take on leadership positions at Johnson & Johnson.
The Opportunity

Hiring companies within Johnson & Johnson partner with IRDP participants, accelerating their professional development through challenging and enriching experiences. Opportunities are available across our consumer, pharmaceutical and medical device business segments in the following fields:
Business development Finance Health economics Information technology Marketing Market access Operations Product management Project management Sales Supply chain

Johnson & Johnson Vision Care is the contact lens division of the largest and most comprehensive manufacturer of healthcare products in the world. In 20 years Johnson & Johnson Vision Care has established itself as the world leader in contact lenses and its ACUVUE® brand is currently the No. 1 selling lens in the world, distributed in over 70 countries worldwide. JJVC had recently integrated the business of CEH (solutions, drops) to broaden the offer. Job Purpose Responsible for creating, developing and implementing a strong marketing BNL plan in full alignment with the cluster strategy to achieve the strategic and business objectives for the BeNeLux. The BeNeLux team is part of the FBI Cluster team which include France Benelux and Iberia. Main Responsibilities • Actively participate in the BeNeLux strategy within the management team • Plan and implement the marketing plan for the ACUVUE® brand to both customers (opticians/ KA) and consumers in alignment of the FBI strategy. • Implementation of local initiatives to ensure strong and effective competitive differentiation specific to Belgium and Netherlands. • Lead the different elements of the marketing mix for Benelux: New products launch / Advertising and PR / Pricing / Targeting of customers / Promotional plans • Lead the sales meeting from preparation (sales messaging) to presentation and tracking of the results closely with the sales team and FBI marketing cluster. • Lead and decide the best allocation of the country A&P; budget, striving for efficiencies wherever possible. • Management of external agencies and monitoring of budget allocated for marketing plan execution. • Strong partnership with key stakeholders in the local management team, as well as with the regional (FBI + EMEA) marketing team. • Shape digital strategy aligned with the EMA guidelines and recommendation (acuvue.be / acuvue.lu) • Responsible for monthly forecasting per brand • Highly involved in Business Plan preparation, both on the strategic shaping and deliver final presentation on outcomes. Based in Amersfoort (Netherlands) with frequent meeting in Diegem (Belgium) - Remote work can be considered. Reports to the FBI Marketing Director based in Paris with a dotted line to the Commercial Business Unit Manager based in the BeNeLux.

Background required • Proven previous marketing experience or relevant marketing background • Digital experience + Ability to deliver successful integrated campaigns. • Strong communication and presentation + analytics skills • Fluent in Dutch and English (French is a bonus.)• Collaboration and team spirit • Puts the CREDO at the heart of every day-to-day activity and behavior with people.
Preferred• Business School • Sales experience would be a plus. • Consumer Goods and Professional marketing experience (combination if possible) would be beneficial.

Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly based healthcare Company, touching the lives of nearly a billion people every day. Our Family of Companies throughout the world compete in consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices and diagnostics markets and have the skills and resources to tackle the world's most pressing health issues. 1. 포지션: Sr. Q&C; Engineer 2. 계열사: 존슨앤드존슨 컨슈머 (Consumer) 3. 근무지: 충청북도 청주시
[Responsibilities]
1) Raw Material Sampling
- Sampling all incoming raw materials.
- Check the incoming raw materials for physical damage of RM package, information refer to RM SPEC and physical identification.
- Clean up the RPM Sampling Room.
2) Raw Material Testing and Release
- Test all the tests item of each raw material based on the QSP, Specification and Korea Regulatory.
- Record the results on Certificate of Analysis and Test Record of J&J; Korea.
- Collect CoAs from suppliers for incoming raw materials.
- Document control for J&J; Korea Certificate of Analysis and Test Record.
- Keep MSDS for raw materials.
3) Retain Sample and Standard Sample control
- Keep all of incoming raw materials for retain sample.
- Control raw material standard samples for RM Lab and Mixing Room.
4) RM & PM Laboratory Control
- Control reagent for inventory and new coming.
- Disposal of chemical waste refer to SOP.
- Keep clean and arrangement.
- Get sample and test Purified water regarding to Korea Regulatory and J&J; SOP.
- Keep the raw data of TOC and conductivity.
5) Instrument maintenance in RM & PM lab
- Instrument Calibration and Qualification.
- Record the ‘ RM laboratory Instrument History Card’
- Clean up all the equipment after testing.
6) Document control
- Inspection logbook review for PM
- Raw Material CoA (J&J; Korea and Supplier).
- Raw Material and Reagent MSDS.
- Raw Material SOP.
- LIR.
- Instrument Calibration Protocol & Report.
- Instrument: User manual, Qualification data and report, Certificate.
7) EtQ and GSS control
- Issue and revise QSP and SOP.
- Create Investigation and GCC on EtQ.
8) GMP and SHE (Safety Health and Environmental) compliance
- Ensure GMP and SHE requirements are adhered at all time
- To ensure work station are clean and orderly
9) OOS/OOT investigation
10) Trouble Shooting
- Investigate Issue of raw material, equipment etc.
- Report and discuss with Manager
11) Training
- SOP/TM/WWSP training related RM lab and Good Laboratory Practice
- Attend external training and share with other functional team
- New Employee training
12) Back up
- Back up RM & PM test and document
- Back up for lab control (glass washing, reagent waste disposal, equipment maintenance, inventory control, lab cleaning)
[Requirements]
1) Minimum Bachelor’s degree with Pharmacy, Science or Chemical Engineering, Microbiologist
2) Over 4 years’ experience in Pharmaceutical, Cosmetics industry
3) Solid knowledge of local regulations, cGMPs, Quality Assurance, Audits & Regulatory Compliance, etc.
4) Fluent in English both oral or written
5) Sufficient knowledge on manufacturing processes
6) Leadership, collaboration and interpersonal skills
7) Good communication and presentation skills
8) Decision making and problem solving

JOB TITLE: Staff Electrical Design Engineer, R&D, SURGICAL ROBOTICS
job_title: Staff Electrical Design Engineer, R&D;, SURGICAL ROBOTICS
job_description: The Ethicon is currently recruiting for a R&D; Staff Electrical Design Engineer in our Surgical Robotics franchise, located in Cincinnati, OH.

Ethicon, part of the Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies, has made meaningful contributions to surgery for more than 60 years from creating the first sutures, to revolutionizing surgery with minimally invasive procedures. Our continuing dedication to Shape the Future of Surgery is built on our commitment to help address the world's most pressing health care issues and improve and save more lives. Through Ethicon's surgical technologies and solutions including sutures, staplers, energy devices, trocars and hemostats and our commitment to treat serious medical conditions like obesity and cancer worldwide, we deliver innovation to make a life-changing impact. This is an opportunity for a key role in bringing exciting new products to market to support the J&J; / Google robotics venture. For more information, visit www.ethicon.com.

The R&D; Staff Electrical Design Engineer in Surgical Robotics is responsible for acting as an electrical / electro-mechanical experienced team member supporting and leading various assignments. This position you will lead the definition, design, development, implementation, and integration of the electrical aspects of key robotic surgical instruments.

For Robotic Surgery, this represents an excellent opportunity for a candidate who is excited by building transformational surgical capabilities. You will be leading technical design and development across advanced sensing, communications, and system controls through applications of electrical / electro-mechanical technologies. This position holds accountability for our critical enabling technology programs, and will work closely with our internal R&D; teams and with external development partners as well. Ultimately you will be a technical leader responsible for projects from conception through final execution, partnering with other core development teams including mechanical, biomedical, equipment/testing development, and clinical disciplines to integrate enabling technologies across a broad array of surgical solutions. He or she will design and implement project strategies, be a leader with any outside co-developers, lead and execute R&D; projects.

For Robotic Surgery, this represents an excellent opportunity for a candidate who is excited by building transformational surgical capabilities. You will be leading technical design and development across advanced sensing, communications, and system controls through applications of electrical / electro-mechanical technologies. This position holds accountability for our critical enabling technology programs, and will work closely with our internal R&D; teams and with external development partners as well.

Ultimately you will be a technical leader responsible for projects from conception through final execution, partnering with other core development teams including mechanical, biomedical, equipment/testing development, and clinical disciplines to integrate enabling technologies across a broad array of surgical solutions.
He or she will design and implement project strategies, be a leader with any outside co-developers, lead and execute R&D; projects.

A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related science/engineering degree is required.An Advanced Degree is preferred.A minimum of 7 years design-related experience is required. Experience in a regulated environment is highly preferred.
A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related science/engineering degree is required.
An Advanced Degree is preferred.
A minimum of 7 years design-related experience is required.
Experience in a regulated environment is highly preferred.

Experience designing, developing, and launching medical products.Strong electrical design and analysis skills, including an understanding of electrical systems and subsystem interface to overall system design. This will included digital, analog, and communications technologies. Knowledge of electronic manufacturing is also key to this role.Track record in R&D; delivering solutions with complex system components and architecture is required.Ability to explain (both written and verbal) complex technical issues to quality engineers, marketers, and technical writers is required.Excellent collaboration and teaming skills to work with manufacturing engineering and suppliers to understand the considerations associated with Design for Manufacturing (DFM), Design to Cost (DTC), and working with other team members and consultants to produce prototypes and optimize designs for manufacturability.Experience translating high-level customer needs into technical options and analyzing the tradeoffs and business impact.Experience with defining test acceptance criteria, developing test methods, and creating test protocols/reports is required. Building prototypes, products, and systems for testing; along with setting up and running laboratory simulations is desired.Experience leading design control activities and design history file implementation per FDA & CE mark standards for medical devices is desired.Experience with capital equipment and disposable medical devices is desired.Experience working with software, firmware and hardware is desired.Understanding of surgery, surgical procedures, and the design and application of surgical devices, as well as the quality system / regulatory environment is desired.Designing test procedures, coordinating tests, analyzing results, and developing written reports.Conducting and/or participating in technical design reviews of requirements, specifications, designs, etc.Strong understand of design control; the ability to develop and execute design plans, design verification and validation.
Experience designing, developing, and launching medical products.

Strong electrical design and analysis skills, including an understanding of electrical systems and subsystem interface to overall system design. This will included digital, analog, and communications technologies. Knowledge of electronic manufacturing is also key to this role.
Track record in R&D; delivering solutions with complex system components and architecture is required.
Ability to explain (both written and verbal) complex technical issues to quality engineers, marketers, and technical writers is required.

Excellent collaboration and teaming skills to work with manufacturing engineering and suppliers to understand the considerations associated with Design for Manufacturing (DFM), Design to Cost (DTC), and working with other team members and consultants to produce prototypes and optimize designs for manufacturability.

Job description:

Our Discovery Sciences Organization at the La Jolla site is looking for a motivated, detail-oriented and collaborative (Senior Associate) Scientist - Compound Logistics to join our Global team. He/she will be involved in the day-to-day compound management operations to effectively support the needs of the local Drug Discovery teams and the global HTS team.

The successful candidate will drive efficiency & innovation by design of professional services, automating common and time-consuming tasks, and participation in the continuing development and implementation of new robotic handling methods and Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS).

In summary, a multi-disciplinary approach to manage the automation/informatics of daily operations, provide flexible and adaptive support of local & global research goals, and develop new state-of-the-art systems and processes is expected.
Key Roles & Responsibilities:
Accountable for all aspects of Compound Logistics from support of daily operations and delivery of screening plates to strategic input into next generation compound management workflows.
· Work collaboratively in the CL team to deliver quality and timely weighing, solubilization and screening plates, in accordance with service level agreements.
· Operate and troubleshoot automated storage & retrieval systems and state-of-the-art liquid handling platforms.
· Operate and evolve compound handling methods and processes to enable efficient execution of Drug Discovery activities.
· Design, develop and implement innovative, outstanding, efficient & effective automation solutions.
· Manage and ensure integration of local support solutions with worldwide compound management strategies.

· Collaborate with all key stakeholders within department or across functions and contribute to (Global) CL team visibility. Participate in site-wide communication and training on hardware and software capabilities.
Accountable for all aspects of Compound Logistics from support of daily operations and delivery of screening plates to strategic input into next generation compound management workflows.
· Work collaboratively in the CL team to deliver quality and timely weighing, solubilization and screening plates, in accordance with service level agreements.
· Operate and troubleshoot automated storage & retrieval systems and state-of-the-art liquid handling platforms.
· Operate and evolve compound handling methods and processes to enable efficient execution of Drug Discovery activities.
· Design, develop and implement innovative, outstanding, efficient & effective automation solutions.
· Manage and ensure integration of local support solutions with worldwide compound management strategies.

· Collaborate with all key stakeholders within department or across functions and contribute to (Global) CL team visibility. Participate in site-wide communication and training on hardware and software capabilities.
Minimum Qualifications:
· A minimum of a B.S. degree in Chemistry, Engineering or related field is required.
· A minimum of five years of experience in a compound management or pharmaceutical laboratory automation group is required.
· Strong skills in automation and robotics: demonstrated in depth hands-on experience with laboratory equipment commonly employed in Compound Management (hard- and software related).

· Dynamic Scientist with proven track record of design, developing and implementing efficient workflow processes, automated sample management, liquid handling, integrated data handling, and informatics to challenge existing procedures and improve compound flows using automated systems and strong problem-solving abilities.
· Experience with interaction with instrument & software vendors is highly sought.
· Success in working with multiple customer groups to deliver solutions enabling them to achieve their goals. Project management experience is a plus.
· Excellent computer, verbal and written communication skills and the ability to responsibly complete daily tasks on time are required.
· The ability to work well within a team and the ability to train colleagues.
· The successful candidate should demonstrate significant management and leadership skills, be self-motivated, well-organized, and be able to think strategically.

job_description: C-SATS, now a part of the Johnson & Johnson Institute, is a first of its kind online performance improvement system for surgeons. Started by a team of doctors, engineers, and biostatisticians as a research project at the University of Washington, C-SATS provides objective, quantitative feedback on surgeons' intra-operative skill. Once our hardware captures surgical video from operating rooms around the country, our software platform provides detailed performance evaluation using expert reviewers, non-technical crowds, and Artificial Intelligence.

As a part of the Johnson & Johnson Institute, C-SATS can now harness the reach, collective resources, and passion of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies to support the professional growth of those who care for others.

C-SATS is the first AI platform for surgery. Our systems and processes are on the verge of massive scale. We need a self-motivated, high-performance Software Engineer to help us realize our vision. You will tackle meaningful and challenging problems every day. You'll write reliable and elegant services to keep doctors zealous about our company and our products. By joining C-SATS, you will become part of a tight-knit, startup-minded team committed improving medical outcomes through the constant effort of driving innovation in healthcare.
This is the best opportunity for a full-stack open source Software Engineer to positively impact the trajectory of human health.

You will be responsible for a critical part of C-SATS, and your work will have a direct impact on patient outcomes. C-SATS measures technical skills in healthcare practitioners, skills that directly impact clinical outcomes; poor performers generate 3x more complications and 5x more deaths than top performers. Our system generates 10 times the amount of information about an individuals' skills in 1/10th the time of traditional peer review. Major medical centers have completed 1.5 million assessments with C-SATS, and they depend on our system to ensure the quality of their practitioners and the safety of their patients.

JOB TITLE: Therapeutic Area Lead / Marketing Manager Hip & Knee
job_title: Therapeutic Area Lead / Marketing Manager Hip & Knee
job_description: Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices (DePuy Synthes) is looking for a Marketing Manager Hip & Knee that will lead the marketing activities for our Global Hip and Knee portfolio. Executive summary of the role: You are the architect, leader and coordinator of the overall strategy for the therapeutic area, responsible also for the implementation and execution of this strategy. You will drive market share gain and market expansion and shape the market to obtain profitable growth in line with business planning and targeting. You are leading a cross functional team that consist of sales, marketing, HE&R;, Medical Education, Account Management, Customer Solutions, Pricing, etc. Main areas of responsibility: • Map out the therapeutic area and disseminate all relevant data: reimbursement, therapeutic area potential, procedure numbers, technology penetration, pricing, hospital capacity, patient pathway, clinical evidence by product range • Succeed in the implementation of New Product launches supported by a structured roll out plan involving a professional education and marketing activities • Establish and share competitive product and market insights and build the product strategy accordingly • Understand, in depth, the needs of all the different stakeholders in the therapeutic area. • Drive a high performing cross-functional team by inspiring and involving all members and be very clear on the objectives and expectations. • Ensure top of the class sales & marketing capabilities including sales force education that matches the changing environment. • Enforce collaboration with the EMEA team Business environment & context: • From product management to creating value for clinical and non-clinical stakeholders in a therapeutic area within Health Care Compliance standards. • Price pressure and tender environment demand a value driven approach. • New and different decision makers and influencers. • Added value drives the decision-making process of a multiple stakeholder team in our accounts.

Required: • Being able to think strategically and show strong operational capabilities at the same time • Previous marketing and sales experience for 7 years, ideally in medical industry • Proven ability to manage complexity & thrives in uncertain/ambiguous circumstances • Ability to connect and effectively collaborate across a diverse group of business stakeholders in a matrix environment • Strong passion and track record for innovation & will to make things happen & deliver • Strong communication & influencing skills • Driven by results performance & excellence in the job • Demonstrated business success in delivering growth and gaining share • Ability to build respect and trust with customers, employees and internal stakeholders • Integrity and Credo-based leadership • Self- awareness and adaptability • Skilled in Excel and Power Point

• Fluent in EnglishPreferred: • Master’s degree or equivalent • Knowledge of the current healthcare landscape and market environment where a value approach is a key driver • Knowledge of DePuy Synthes Hip and Knee portfolio • Proven track • Experience working for a mid-size or multinational company

job_title: Außendienstmitarbeiter (m/w/d) Bereich Endoprothetik - Gebiet: Steiermark & Kärnten
job_description: Caring for the world, one person at a time – seit mehr als 125 Jahren inspiriert und vereint uns dieser Geist, um innovative Ideen, Produkte und Services zu entwickeln und damit das Leben und Wohlbefinden von Menschen zu verbessern. Mit mehr als 71,9 Mrd. $ Umsatz in 2016 und rund 127.000 Mitarbeitern ist Johnson & Johnson einer der weltweit größten und der in seinem Produktspektrum umfassendste Anbieter auf dem Gebiet der Gesundheitsfürsorge.

DePuy Synthes, ein Geschäftsbereich von Johnson & Johnson Medical, zählt mit seiner mehr als 100-jährigen Erfahrung zu den traditionsreichsten Unternehmen der endoprothetischen Orthopädie, Traumatologie, Chirurgie und Sportmedizin. Die breit gefächerte Produktpalette reicht unter anderem von Osteosyntheseimplantaten für Wirbelsäulen und Extremitätenchirurgie, Gelenksendoprothesen und Refixationssystemen für Sehnen und Bänder bis hin zu Fluidmanagement- und bipolaren Hochfrequenz-Systemen.

The Surgical Process Institute has led the way in developing digital technologies that improve the standardization of surgical workflows in the operating theatre. SPIs unique digitized and customizable surgery workflow engines enable surgery teams to perform more efficiently, reduce operating time, and deliver better patient outcomes.

Being SPI’s Project Manager Clinical Solutions, you are responsible for the end-to-end implementation and delivery of SPI’s solutions within our client’s hospitals. Being involved in the late sales stages, the Project Manager is leading the project kick off and responsible for planning and executing the project including the required hard- and software solutions.
Are you ready to work doing something you are passionate about?

Core responsibility is the successful implementation of SPIs digital solution within our customers hospital theatresCollaborating with our sales and clinical workflow team, you will plan and execute the implementation of the SPI software solution. As initial step, you will perform a stakeholder and process analysis of operating workflows and also participate as observer during surgical proceduresSupported by the IT Implementation Manager and the Workflow Consultant you manage the successful implementation and launch of SPI process concepts, software tools and necessary hardware on time and on budgetAfter successful soft- and hardware installation incl. interfaces to existing hospital systems, you will coordinate and execute the required training workshop enabling our customers to utilizing the systems in and efficient wayDuring the post-go live hypercare phase, you will ensure regular customer satisfaction and ensure system utilization. In addition, your responsibility includes regular reporting & analytics providing our customers with valuable insights to improve their operating workflow

A member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, the world’s leading healthcare company, DePuy Synthes is dedicated to providing patients all around the globe with a lifetime of movement solutions. DePuy Synthes has been a pioneer in the fields of orthopaedics, spinal care and neuroscience therapies for decades. From non-surgical pain management to complete surgical solutions, it’s range of treatment options include those for treating or reconstructing damaged or diseased joints, caring for traumatic skeletal injuries, treating spinal disorders and deformity, and repairing injured soft tissue. In addition, DePuy Synthes offers a wide range of state-of-the-art therapies for neurological and central nervous system care.

JOB TITLE: [IT]IT Lead, Business Analyst, Digital Product Line For Janssen
job_title: [IT]IT Lead, Business Analyst, Digital Product Line for Janssen
job_description: Janssen Pharmaceuticals discovers and develops innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases.

At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives. We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found.
The IT Lead, Business Analyst for Digital PLO will be based in Tokyo, Japan and will report into the Regional Digital PLO member in Japan.
The Digital product line organisation has an Asia Pacific regional focus with 2 primary platform responsibilities;
· Digital eco-system, that includes websites, mobile applications, multi-channel (email, webinars) engagements, content management and hosting platforms.
· User Productivity & Collaboration solutions with a focus on innovative ways of working using cloud, mobile, video and social technologies.

The position will work closely with the Product Line Leader, regional BTLs (Business Technology Leaders), BPO, EA & shared services teams to evolve the product line to meet business strategic objectives. Additionally, the person will be responsible for overseeing delivery of business technology projects, requirements gathering, release planning and technical application life cycle management, specifically in the context of the Japan market.
Primary Duties & Responsibilities
· Be a technology partner, working with business partners to identify unmet needs, propose IT solutions, and assist management in the development of business cases and project charters

· Cultivate relationships with external agencies, partners, J&J; suppliers and customers, to develop deep insights into the needs of our business departments, patients, customers, markets and communities and become the go-to person for our business / technology partners.

· Lead the technical discovery process for Digital and Productivity projects, scoping needs, gathering requirements and producing functional specifications for a solution build, based on regional and global standards
· Conduct Business Analysis: Map out business process; Capture business requirements and specifications (story boards, use cases); support translation into technical requirements.
· Support continuous process improvement; mapping current and future state, root cause analysis for process gaps and improvement to identify and resolve business and technology related issues.

· Take a regional view on technology solutions, building a good understanding of business practice in other countries through a network of IT colleagues, in order to leverage or create harmonised solutions where possible

· Proactively match business needs with existing J&J; technology capability, by showcasing local/regional best practice with key stakeholders, encouraging adoption of core systems and highlighting value in a business context
· Work with Regional Product Line Owner/s to shape long term solution roadmap according to business priorities, and understand the technology used
· Provide rapid prototyping and conceptual designs where requirements are ambiguous or unproven
· Manage delivery of local/regional solutions through J&J; Application Services team, acting as Product Owner in scrum development
· Ensure J&J; information and assets are appropriately managed, valued and protected in accordance with Information Asset Protection and Compliance policies
Qualifications
· Bachelor of Computer Science / Information Technology or related Business / Engineering degree or at least 5 years of relevant experience
· Experience of platforms and technologies comprising the digital ecosystem (e.g. static/dynamic web, mobile apps, campaign email, hosting approaches, media and content management systems)
· Knowledge of technology solutions within the local Japan market such as LINE will be highly regarded
· Experience of HealthCare solutions for engaging Doctors, Careers or Patients through digital channels is highly desired

· Knowledge of platforms and technologies within the Productivity & Collaboration domain, this includes latest Microsoft O365, enterprise social apps, messaging, video or chat tools as well as single device solutions
· Knowledge of supporting Commercial Domains such as CRM (Veeva, SFDC), data analytics will be highly regarded
· Ability to relate business priorities to associated technology investments is required.
· Ability to recommend priorities to multiple stakeholders based on the highest business value is required.
· Knowledge of trends in technology and opportunities in healthcare is preferred.
· Experience in project delivery in a dynamic and emerging market as part of a complex, global organization is required.
· Broad technology experience with ability to lead assessments of proposed solutions and develop recommendations is required.

· Understanding of the business impact of different solutions and ability to assess impact and communicate the tradeoffs between business needs, technology requirements, timelines, costs and risks is required.
· Good understanding of Agile delivery methodology.

· Working knowledge of SDLC(CSV, Computer System Validation) and rRDM(Business Analysis methodology) including requirements elicitation, system design, development and validation/regulatory requirements.
· Experience working in process-driven environments (SDLC, Agile) coordinating internal and external delivery partners toward a single goal
· Certification in Business Analysis (e.g. ISEB Business Analysis Diploma) and Project Management (e.g. PRINCE2, PMP) areas highly regarded
Competencies
· Both Japanese and English language (spoken & written) in a business and technical context

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal, and comfortable communicating and collaborating across all functions and with internal and external partners across multiple countries
· Effective team working and ability to build effective relationships with customers, matrix teams, suppliers and partners.
· Highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
· Good at facilitating workshops and meetings, and negotiating
· Genuine passion for technology, understanding how things work, and for applying technology to bring value to businesses/customers
· Continuous learner, able to demonstrate a familiarity with current trends
· Capable to take a “hands-on approach” to experiment and try things if needed
· Can communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders at different levels

"Caring for the world… one person at a time” … inspires and unites the people of Johnson & Johnson. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. This culture of caring is the focus of our corporate philosophy, that are anchored in the internationally applicable Credo

DePuySynthes Companies of Johnson & Johnson is the largest, most comprehensive orthopedic and neurological business in the world. The industry, requirements and customer expectations are in a constant change. Package Development is directly affected by this. This role in will be essential to the Package Development Team in Zuchwil as it is capable to deal with future needs and requirements with internal and external stakeholders. JOB TITLE: Scientist, X-Ray Crystallography - La Jolla, CA (#1 Of 2)
job_title: Scientist, X-Ray Crystallography - La Jolla, CA (#1 of 2)
job_description: Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C., a division of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies is recruiting for a Scientist, X-ray Crystallography, located in La Jolla, California.

At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives. We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found.

Janssen Research & Development, LLC discovers and develops innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Please visit http://www.janssenrnd.com/ for more information.

The Lead Discovery group is a critical part of the Discovery Sciences (DS) organization in Janssen R&D; and is committed to the delivery of high-quality chemical starting points needed for the generation of small molecule clinical compounds in all five Janssen Therapeutic Area (TA) discovery teams. This mission requires deep scientific expertise in a number of disciplines including chemistry, cellular and molecular pharmacology, enzymology, HTS, and structural biology coupled with an ability to work collaboratively with internal and external partners. Building on a strong legacy of success, we are currently seeking an outstanding individual to join our team as Scientist, X-ray Crystallography.
The Scientist will:

Be responsible for crystallization of protein-small molecule complexes and determination of high-resolution structures by X-ray crystallography.Work closely with protein scientists, biophysicists and protein NMR scientists as part of an integrated structural biology effort.Be a member of drug discovery teams, working closely with computational and medicinal chemists on structure-based drug design approaches for small molecule agent optimization.Contribute to multidisciplinary Fragment-Based Lead Discovery (FBLD) efforts.Contribute to increase the structural biology scientific expertise of the group by publishing high-impact research papers and establishing academic collaborations.Mentor lab scientists and contribute to the strategic planning of the Structural Biology group.
Be responsible for crystallization of protein-small molecule complexes and determination of high-resolution structures by X-ray crystallography.
Work closely with protein scientists, biophysicists and protein NMR scientists as part of an integrated structural biology effort.
Be a member of drug discovery teams, working closely with computational and medicinal chemists on structure-based drug design approaches for small molecule agent optimization.
Contribute to multidisciplinary Fragment-Based Lead Discovery (FBLD) efforts.
Contribute to increase the structural biology scientific expertise of the group by publishing high-impact research papers and establishing academic collaborations.
Mentor lab scientists and contribute to the strategic planning of the Structural Biology group.

Ph.D. or equivalent and postdoctoral experience in structural biology (for example; x-ray crystallography, biophysics, protein engineering) or related field is requiredExpertise in crystallography software packages (for example Phenix/CCP4/PyMol/Moe) in a mixed Linux/Windows or Mac computational environment is required.Deep scientific expertise in structural biology, with strong experience in both protein crystallization and high-resolution structure determination is requiredStrong record of external publications and presentations is requiredOutstanding written and oral presentation skills is requiredResearch experience in cryo-electron microscopy (Cryo-EM), Micro-electron diffraction (Micro-ED), or other structural biology technologies is strongly preferredExperience with the crystallization and structure determination of membrane proteins (GPCRs, ion channels, transporters) is preferred.Experience in Structure Based Drug Design (SBDD) utilizing X-ray crystallography and/or protein NMR is preferredResearch experience with other biophysical techniques such as MST, ITC, NMR, DSF, SPR is preferredExperience in scientific programming (Unix shells, Python) is preferredThis position is located in La Jolla, CA, and will require less than 10% travel.
Ph.D. or equivalent and postdoctoral experience in structural biology (for example; x-ray crystallography, biophysics, protein engineering) or related field is required
Expertise in crystallography software packages (for example Phenix/CCP4/PyMol/Moe) in a mixed Linux/Windows or Mac computational environment is required.
Deep scientific expertise in structural biology, with strong experience in both protein crystallization and high-resolution structure determination is required
Strong record of external publications and presentations is required
Outstanding written and oral presentation skills is required
Research experience in cryo-electron microscopy (Cryo-EM), Micro-electron diffraction (Micro-ED), or other structural biology technologies is strongly preferred

This position is located in La Jolla, CA, and will require less than 10% travel.

job_description: With $81.6 billion in 2018 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, pharmaceuticals and medical devices. The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson conduct research and development in a variety of therapeutic areas to discover novel therapeutic approaches to address unmet medical conditions. Janssen has a rich portfolio of small and large molecules, as well as vaccines, driven by strong science and innovation.
In order to further strengthen the scientific teams working on our small molecules portfolio, we are recruiting enthusiastic chemists at various seniority levels and with differentiated expertise:

The Medicinal Chemistry team is recruiting candidates with a strong background in organic and/or medicinal chemistry. The medicinal chemistry group focuses mainly on developing innovative small molecule therapeutics to treat diseases like Alzheimer’s disease, various types of cancers and infectious diseases like Hepatitis B, influenza etc. In this endeavor, the chemistry teams work closely together with colleagues from the associated Biology teams and with several internal and external partners aiming to progress the most innovative science and gain access to the latest state-of-the-art technologies and expertise.

The Medicinal Chemistry team is recruiting candidates with a strong background in organic and/or medicinal chemistry. The medicinal chemistry group focuses mainly on developing innovative small molecule therapeutics to treat diseases like Alzheimer’s disease, various types of cancers and infectious diseases like Hepatitis B, influenza etc. In this endeavor, the chemistry teams work closely together with colleagues from the associated Biology teams and with several internal and external partners aiming to progress the most innovative science and gain access to the latest state-of-the-art technologies and expertise.

The Discovery Process Research (DPR) team is recruiting candidates with a strong background in synthetic organic chemistry. The DPR teams operate across a portfolio of projects at the interface of the discovery and development space, from lead identification through the selection of drug candidates. The group facilitates medicinal chemistry research by finding solutions to synthetic bottlenecks, enabling access to novel chemical space and translating chemistry innovations to the development of efficient routes for the synthesis of small molecule drug candidates advancing into development

The Discovery Process Research (DPR) team is recruiting candidates with a strong background in synthetic organic chemistry. The DPR teams operate across a portfolio of projects at the interface of the discovery and development space, from lead identification through the selection of drug candidates. The group facilitates medicinal chemistry research by finding solutions to synthetic bottlenecks, enabling access to novel chemical space and translating chemistry innovations to the development of efficient routes for the synthesis of small molecule drug candidates advancing into development

The API Process Research and Development (API PRD) department is recruiting chemists and engineers with a strong background in process and organic chemistry. The API PRD group generates creative and innovative ways towards new synthetic routes and solutions that enable large scale manufacturing of target API’s. Process chemists and engineers team up with analysts, crystallization and safety experts to design the best manufacturing process. These cross functional teams work closely together with the pilot plants and bridge with commercial production. New chemical processes are developed meeting stringent requirements concerning safety, environment, technology, economy and quality. As a result of these endeavors, drug candidates are accelerated through the development pipeline by enabling sufficient supplies of active ingredient in support of clinical trials, registration and finally commercialization.

The Janssen campus in Beerse (Belgium) hosts 5,000 employees and has a unique ecosystem covering the complete drug development life cycle, with all capabilities from basic science to market access on one campus. The integrated environment of our campus gives our people the chance to experience many different aspects of drug development throughout their career. It has a successful track record of over sixty years of drug discovery and development, and it is one of the most important innovation engines of the Janssen group worldwide.

job_description: Biosense Webster, part of the Johnson & Johnson family of companies, is recruiting a Field Market Development Manager headquartered in Irvine, California, but field-based in the Northeast sales area. The Northeast sales area includes New York, New Jersey, Rhode Island, Vermont, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Connecticut, Maine, and parts of Pennsylvania.

Atrial fibrillation (AFIB) is a quivering or irregular heartbeat (arrhythmia) that can lead to blood clots, stroke, heart failure and other heart-related complications. 20 million people around the world suffer from AFIB each year. Biosense Webster, Inc. is the global leader in the science of diagnosing and treating heart rhythm disorders. The company established its leadership in electrophysiology with the development of the first real-time, 3D cardiac mapping and navigation technology, as well as the first electrophysiology catheter. The introduction of the company’s CARTO® 3 System in 2009 revolutionized 3D mapping technology by increasing the accuracy, speed, and efficiency of the cardiac ablation procedure.

The Market Development Manager is the only field-based marketing role at Biosense Webster with both sales and marketing responsibilities. The position reports to the Senior Manager, Market Development, and is part of the commercial marketing organization. All activities are aligned with the Area Director and field sales organization to ensure maximum effectiveness.

The Market Development Manager will oversee and utilize resources with business partners including, but not limited to, Customer Engagement and Education (CEE), Health Economics and Market Access (HEMA) and Strategic Customer Group (SCG).
Key Responsibilities:

Increase overall awareness of the AF disease state among all stakeholders Engage with hospital administrators and physicians to gain alignment on projects Identity accounts, align objectives with Area Director and Commercial Programs Manager and execute plans that will ultimately allow us to reach more patients Promote and improve the use of all available customer resources developed by commercial marketing, CEE, HEMA, and SCG Connect physicians with commercial and strategic marketing to advocate products and programs that will strengthen customer relationships Plan and execute national-level marketing projects that will contribute to organizational goals Work with field sales teams to achieve business objectives Serve as a member of sales area leadership team

job_description: Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies is currently recruiting for a Senior Manager, Procurement - IT Infrastructure Category Lead. The position will be based at a J&J; location in Raritan, NJ.

Caring for the world, one person at a time, has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.

With $81.6 billion in 2018 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing over 125,000 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

The Senior Manager, Procurement IT Infrastructure Category Lead will be responsible for leading an IT Procurement organization in support of approximately $300 million in spend for Johnson & Johnson Companies. This portfolio of spend is of variable complexity in nature and requires comprehensive and consistent collaboration with key business partners within the Johnson & Johnson Technology Services organizations – as well as with additional stakeholders across Global Procurement and various operating company organizations – to effectively manage.

This individual will identify, develop and direct the implementation of Procurement goals and strategy. Plan and direct the organization’s activities, and deliver against targets for financial performance, quality, and service and compliance adherence.

The successful candidate will provide Global and Regional Leadership for developing end-to-end category leadership such as category strategy development, maintaining key relationships within the business, and managing key supplier relationships. The position must shape, connect and lead resources to deliver on key projects in the areas of IT Infrastructure.
The Senior Manager, Procurement IT Infrastructure Category Lead’s scope of responsibilities include:

JOB TITLE: Scientist Process Engineering API Small Molecule Development
job_title: Scientist Process Engineering API Small Molecule Development
job_description: Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees, committed to inclusion and proud to be an equal opportunity employer, our over 125,000 employees in 60 countries are united in a common mission: To help people everywhere live longer, healthier, happier lives.

At Janssen, the Pharmaceutica Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. We discover and develop innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases.

Small Molecule Pharmaceutical Development (SMPD), the CMC organization (chemistry, manufacturing and control) within Janssen Pharmaceutica N.V., employs hundreds of scientific researchers and specialized technicians. The API Small Molecule Development department (API SM) is responsible for designing processes to supply large quantities of new chemical entities for R&D; and commercial purposes. API SM develops practical, efficient, safe, and green chemical processes for drug candidates at all stages of development.

The Chemical Technology & Engineering group (T&E;), a unit within the API SM, is expanding and looking for chemical process engineers on different levels: Scientist, Senior Scientist, Principal Scientist.
Job description Scientist role: Responsibilities and duties

You will play a key role in the evaluation of the scale up of chemical processes. As a member of a cross-functional team (organic chemists, analysts, process safety engineers, purification specialists, pilot plant engineers) you will be responsible for developing a deep understanding of our processes to ensure the highest quality product is manufactured within our API facilities. This includes late stage development, scale-up, new product introductions, and technology transfers, with the aim of delivering robust operational performance and scientific excellence.You will actively participate in process design (experimentation and modeling) to deliver safe and robust API manufacturing routes whilst reporting progress to your peers, management, and to our customers. You will assume the role of process engineer within a specific cross-functional API project team whilst also being responsible for the development of digital twins for our entire portfolio. An understanding of chemical kinetics and mass transfer will be applied to replicate our chemical process in silico ensuring efficient development, and smooth scale-up to enable successful transfers of our new processes to our pilot and commercial plants. You will also participate in the conceptualization, development and implementation of mechanistic models and material property prediction tools and convey outputs from simulation studies clearly and concisely such that team members are well informed about the possibilities and limitations of modeling

Die Cilag AG ist ein internationales Produktionsunternehmen der Pharmasparte des Johnson & Johnson Konzerns und stellt an ihrem Produktionsstandort in Schaffhausen pharmazeutische und medizintechnische Produkte sowie chemische Wirkstoffe (APIs) für die globalen Märkte her. The Manager, Commercial Insights, Taiwan is responsible for effectively integrating and synthesizing qualitative and quantitative information into actionable insights that inform decision-making and drive organizational action and business growth for Janssen Taiwan.

Reporting to the Commercial Excellence Head, this position will partner closely with market access, finance, medical affairs, IT and commercial teams on their analytics needs, and provide reporting and research support for senior management.
Responsibilities

Be a strategic advisor to the business by integrating activity, perception and performance data to identify objective and actionable insightsBe the point of contact with IT in the ongoing maintenance of master data and the local data lake platform Source, QC and integrate qualitative and quantitative data sources, which address business needs and provide an improved understanding of the market Design and manage reports and dashboards that relay Janssen performance in the context of market trends and growth Work across countries and functions to identify business needs and decisions that can be addressed or improved via analytics and market research Advise business partners on market research techniques, methodology and vendor partners Interpret and pragmatically translate research learning into feasible and practical business-building strategies and activities, ensuring alignment with key business partners Assist leadership team and cross-functional teams in assessing existing and new business strategies using the data resources within the data-lake platform Champion marketing research and leverage synergies between countries, regions, and functions to promote minimal overlap in project spend, and an aligned view of competitor and market performance Serve as contact point for business and competitive intelligence sources and systems, facilitating access and training to the relevant data sources and subscriptions Provide strategic oversight and guidance on business intelligence, analytics and market research activities, including (but not limited to) market landscapes, product and market forecasts, financial feasibility and price-volume sensitivity Champion the development and implementation of innovative research and analytics approaches/methods that leverage advancements in “big data” technology and best practices from other industries Identify and cultivate meaningful external partnerships, which provide either immediate improvements in efficiency or the possibility of long-term, sustainable innovation
Qualifications
Education and Experience
• Experience within the health care industry or in consultant/data analytic/market research
• Proven track record in project management or working with multiple stakeholders
• University degree, Masters or equivalent in Business/Marketing/Economics/Life Science
Skills

• Strong analytical skills and the ability to develop and communicate a cohesive story through qualitative and quantitative data analysis (proficiency in R, SPSS, SAS, Tableau, SQL/MS Access preferred)

• Fluent English
Character Traits
• Team-oriented, collaborative approach and management style
• Good communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to influence without authority

The goal of Johnson & Johnson Innovation is to advance transformative healthcare solutions that improve the lives of people around the world and, in so doing, to deliver value to Johnson & Johnson. Johnson & Johnson Innovation accomplishes this by catalysing new science and technology through collaboration and exchange of ideas. This growing team is looking for a colleague inspired to help build and innovate new ways of fostering a productive life-science ecosystem.JLABS is the external R&D; engine of Johnson & Johnson, catalysing a community of entrepreneurs in health, operating a network of life science incubators focusing and accelerating emerging companies through development and supporting the portfolio to successful partnering and funding. Job Description: Johnson & Johnson Innovation is recruiting an “Innovation Activation Manager” to be based at the Janssen Vaccines and Prevention B.V. site in Leiden, Netherlands. This position will be responsible for the overall strategy and support of the implementation of JLABS external engagement including campaigns and event activations within the Netherlands and greater Benelux region. Reporting to the Innovation Activation Sr. Manager for EMEA, the Innovation Activation Manager is responsible for supporting the strategic planning, development, implementation and reporting of marketing initiatives for JLABS in the Netherlands. The Innovation Activation Manager will work in partnership with JLABS EMEA team to develop a regional strategy to support the mission of Johnson & Johnson Innovation, and may also include contributing to a team of functional experts. In this role, the manager is responsible for supporting external engagements that advance our business objectives, driving awareness and advancing organizational reputation. The successful candidate will join a multidisciplinary research organization focusing on drug discovery, translational research, and early development of novel small or large molecule drug candidates in Shanghai, China. This job may include expanding and strengthening the company’s internal and external network, research project coordination, out sourcing to CROs, biomarker project initiation and execution, biomarker platform set up and management. This position works closely with drug discovery, translational research, and early development team on biomarker development to support discovery research and clinical development of new compound in the pipeline. The successful candidate should have a well-established track record in scientific research, ideally in pharmaceutical R&D; or other healthcare industry. Good communication skills in both English and Chinese, as well as an ability to interact with collaboration partners both internally and externally.

· Solid scientific background in translational/biomarker research is required. Proactive participation and contribution to scientific community within JNJ will be expected.

The successful candidate is expected to manage state-of-the-art flow cytometry facility, responsible for design, development, qualification/validation of various flow cytometry-based assays, and data analysis/interpretation, to support discovery and biomarker research.

Within Janssen Vaccines and Prevention B.V. (JVP, Leiden, The Netherlands), the Viral Vaccines department focuses on the research and development of vaccines against viral infectious diseases. Within this department, the Preclinical Immunology team evaluates the immunogenicity and efficacy of vaccine candidates against viral infectious diseases in animal models. The focus of the Preclinical immunology team is to conduct proof of concept studies to generate appropriate scientific data that enable vaccine candidates to progress from an early research stage towards clinical evaluation and clinical development.

For the Viral Vaccine Preclinical Immunology team, we are looking for a highly motivated non-clinical scientific writer or scientist with affinity for writing. The person we are looking for should have experience with the conduct of animal studies, preferentially with a background in the field of vaccines, immunology and/or virology. The writer will work closely with the scientists in the Preclinical Immunology team to generate nonclinical study reports, and in cross-functional teams to prepare regulatory documents. All communication and writing is done in English.

The role requires experience in scientific writing (English), and a background understanding of vaccines and in vivo disease models. The writer will primarily be responsible for the writing, review and completion of nonclinical study reports in collaboration with the responsible scientists. The writer will also be involved in the co-ordination and compilation of regulatory documents, such as document packages required for a pre-Investigational New Drug (IND) meeting, IND submissions, Investigators Brochures and Annual Safety reports.

The writer will work with different Preclinical Immunology team leaders on different vaccine programs. The writer will also work together with the nonclinical regulatory writer for the preparation and management of regulatory documents, including working with cross-functional teams from different company departments such as the clinical, regulatory and manufacturing teams. The role requires strong self-motivation and initiative, project management skills, accuracy and attention to detail, reliability, efficiency, flexibility, team player skills and enthusiasm.
Educational background and competencies:

• Master’s degree in the biomedical field; immunology or vaccine background an advantage• Affinity for scientific writing• Knowledge of clinical drug development and regulatory processes and procedures within clinical trials is advantageous but not required• Capable of organizing multiple priorities and projects, and work independently within area of responsibility • Accurate – Critical- Analytical - Communicative - Team player - Planning & organization

For our Janssen Benelux company, we are looking for a Medical Advisor Mood Disorders Belgium:

The role of a Medical Advisor is to be a therapeutic area scientific expert and medical leader. As a Medcial Advisor you will develops the country specific medical strategy and tactics. As such, you are expected to shape and lead the activities of Janssen with Health Care Professionals, for the benefit of patients.

You have a deep scientific/medical knowledge of our products and treatment trends for patients with mood disorders. You can discuss on a peer-to-peer basis with external clinical and non-clinical stakeholders (e.g. Physicians, Pharmacists, Hospital Managers) to feed and shape the medical strategy.

job_description: The Early Talent Recruiter will lead the design, deployment and execution of the Early Talent Acquisition Strategy for a specific region enabling the acquisition of top early talent required to meet business objectives and providing J&J; with a competitive recruiting advantage. You will influence, lead outcomes and communicate closely with hiring managers by sharing best practices and using a consultative, employee and customer-focused approach to understand their needs and ensure the effective attraction, assessment, selection, and development of a high performing, diverse, and sustainable talent pipeline to drive business in alignment with organizational and functional HR strategies. You will advocate for best in class candidate experience to ensure the acquisition of high caliber early talent by effectively utilizing new technologies to locate, engage, and attract prospective candidates. You will shape, connect and lead resources to deliver on key projects. You will maintain confidentiality and operate with poise and integrity in a complex, high-profile and rapidly changing environment.
The Early Talent Recruiter, a member of the J&J; Talent Acquisition University Team, will:

Act as a trusted business partner who serves as a strategic talent advisor and connects internally across an array of stakeholders within aligned businesses or program areas. Foster business intimacy to forge trusted collaborative and consultative relationships with hiring managers and senior leaders. Lead the attraction strategy for a geographical region within EMEA including all on campus and digital channels ensuring J&J; is positioned as an employer of choice for exceptional talent. Have the ability to source and analyze business data (internal), competitor and market research(external), and synthesize and articulate the data into insights leading to strategic actions and initiatives resulting in a qualified and diverse pipeline of candidates to hiring managers. Collaborate with local HR and business leaders to fully understand the region’s talent needs and how our early talent strategy supports those needs. Translate into university relations and recruiting strategy. Have the ability to develop a deep understanding of Johnson & Johnson’s long and short-term strategies and growth drivers and translate that knowledge into early talent attraction strategies for the aligned region Conduct the initial assessment of all candidates leveraging interview guides, digital assessment tools and reports, and lead debrief sessions. Efficiently and effectively evaluate a candidate’s academic and professional experience as well as technical and leadership competencies based on business-based interviews as well as determine screening and assessment criteria for the positions and recommend the best talent to hiring managers and program managers. Coach managers, programs, and campus teams on appropriate assessment tools and Behavioral Based Interviewing. Ensure that every candidate has an optimal recruiting experience, foster a high level of candidate care & service during all stages of the talent acquisition process. Ability to effectively leverage both internal J&J; and external digital platforms to drive student applications. Utilize digital screening tools to assess talent pool and provide expedited and qualified talent slates. Leads with data and can translate data in to information that is of value to the business. Holds self and others (internal and external) accountable for process compliance.
