JOB TITLE: Sr. Director, Customer Engagement Analytics & Operations
job_title: Sr. Director, Customer Engagement Analytics & Operations
job_description: Janssen is actively recruiting for a Sr. Director, Customer Engagement Analytics & Operations position to be located in Titusville, NJ

The Senior Director, Customer Engagement Analytics & Operations develops innovative capabilities that enables Janssen’s business units to optimally engage with customers and drive competitive advantage through agile deployment and execution. As a core member of the Commercial Excellence Leadership Team, this leader is responsible for leveraging cross-functional teams across Commercial Optimization and Deployment (COD), Sales Operations and Field Reporting (SO), Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Incentive Compensation Strategy and Design (IC) to inform critical business decisions through transformative insights and analytics. In close partnership with Business Unit senior leadership and the Field/Marketing Leadership Boards (JF/MLB), this position plays a leading role in shaping and executing high impact strategies to optimize resource deployment and ultimately drive improved customer engagement.

The Senior Director works across all Janssen’s Therapeutic Areas and SCG to optimize the resources invested in the personal selling channel with the potential to expand this to other channels (e.g. marketing) over time. Through a staff of approximately 32 people, and direct oversight of the associated resources and budget, the leader supports Janssen’s entire portfolio across all major products. While not an element of the initial scope, going forward the role is likely to expand to include Actelion.

Acts as a senior trusted advisor to Business Unit Leadership Team members:Applies executive level leadership, problem solving and communication skills to drive significant organizational impact and accelerate growth through agile execution of customer engagement operations.Provides strategic oversight and input into customer segmentation and targeting, optimization of field force deployment, operationalization of customer engagement plans, field execution analytics and reporting, incentive compensation design, strategy and operations.Represents Commercial Excellence on the Field Leadership Board (and in the future Marketing Leadership Board), with broad oversight of all CE-related activities primarily for the demand generating sales force, but potentially in the future for other channels as well:Collaborates with Customer Insights and Strategy (CIS) and other CE teams supporting the BUs to deliver on the long- and short-term strategic goals related to demand generating sales force.Collaborates with Account Management Council and Key Account Management Learning and Development function to develop optimal deployment plans, metrics and analytics to enable and measure success of Key Account Management strategy and roles in SCG and BUs.Deploys CE resources against Integrated local market / regional analytics and field reporting design.Delivers strategic analytics to shape key customer engagement decisions for the Strategic Customer Group (payer and provider customers)Leverages and deploys ROI analytics for critical decisions including sales force optimization, customer targeting strategy, as well as incentive comp strategy and designDefines and manages the budget for Customer Engagement Operations-related Commercial Excellence activities, making appropriate trade-offs to support priority initiatives.Integrates customer and market insights in collaboration with CIS teams, and translates them into significant business impact through effective organizational and growth strategies and agile execution:Analyzes customer data and scans the external market, interpreting emerging customer and market dynamics events and defining the implications for Janssen as we seek to optimize our promotional investments. Collaborates with CE LT members to develop effective resource deployment and field force motivation strategies through deep customer insights, competitive landscape and external environmental analysis. job_description: Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for a Contracts and Grants Senior Manager located in Titusville, NJ. Alternate work locations in New Jersey and Pennsylvania are available with the primary location being Titusville NJ.

Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 130 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.

With $81.6 billion in 2018 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing over 125,000 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Principal accountability is to ensure that contract and grants processes function effectively and efficiently for assigned personnel/function with a focus on the successful progression and management of the assigned C&G; function. Accountable for focusing on the support model and strategic development of the direction of contracting with investigative sites. Management of the efficient execution of the contracts and grants processes in meeting strategic objectives.

Assist and learning to lead & drive innovation and related activities for investigator site contracting. Serve as a subject matter expert for all issues relating to contracts and grants department processes and corporate/GCDO policies and procedures as they relate to contracts and grants functions. Assist in recruiting, training, managing, coaching/mentoring, workload prioritizing, and evaluating staff members. Contribute to ensuring optimum utilization of resources and compliance with project deadlines. Leverage expertise & efficiencies in clinical site contracting across therapeutic areas, recognize opportunities for enhancements, identify and implement solutions. Work closely with stakeholders that are globally located: establish and maintain working relationships with J&J; risk management, J&J; legal, insurance broker(s), privacy, vendors, customers and other identified stakeholders. Liaise with the global C&G; team, J&J; Corporate Law, Local Legal Counsel, GDO Colleagues, Healthcare Compliance, Risk Management, Privacy and other stakeholders to escalate and resolve issues as appropriate. Continuously work to refine GCDO contracts and grants processes in alignment with stakeholder needs and in compliance with corporate process, systems, and strategies by identifying innovative process improvements, determining feasibility, and collaborating with appropriate parties to implement when appropriate. Work proactively to increase global awareness of group processes and procedures and train and educate stakeholders. Identify and execute goals aligned with organizational objectives as defined in the GCDO and C&G; cascades. Assume responsibility for ongoing tracking, maintenance and accuracy of metrics, contract documents, and supporting documentation to ensure inspection readiness and compliance with departmental and J&J; policies, procedures and work instructions. Act as subject matter expert of regional requirements, practices and regulations as they relate to clinical contracts and grants. Contribute to building a knowledge management system of global requirements for contracts and grants functions. Identify and promote best practices. Adhere to SOPs, ethics and departmental compliance as determined by GCDO management as well as operating companies, corporate, HCC and QA guidelines Develop employees, as applicable, via HR Planning programs including but not limited to Performance & Development Management (PDM) and training to meet current employment opportunities and endorse the value of a diverse work force; Assist in recruiting, managing, coaching/mentoring, workload prioritizing, and evaluating cross-functional staff members. Responsible for analyzing contract requests/needs from operating companies and translating into appropriate clinical contracts/budgets. Lead negotiation and execution of agreements including specialized support for negotiations in confidentiality agreements, informed consent forms, amendments and other ancillary contract documents as required. Analyze investigator grants for fair market value aligned with regional knowledge, compliance guidance and the J&J; grant pricing guidelines. Lead the approval escalation of grants as appropriate. Manage CROs contracted to negotiate CTAs globally, inclusive of training and supervision, oversight of tracking, escalations and monitoring/reporting of any gaps or support needed to ensure timelines and expectations are met. Responsible for assessing risks of budget and legal provisions independently. Provide solution and business focused advice to stakeholders and others within J&J; on contract and grant related topics. Support establishing master agreements and other innovative solutions to expedite site initiation. Assure that contract and budget provisions are in compliance with corporate process, systems, and strategies. Review, authorize and/or manage payments. Assist clinical operations or clinical team in ensuring that investigator grants comply with overall study costs and compliance guidelines. Identify and promote best practices. Adhere to SOPs, ethics and departmental compliance as determined by GDO management as well as operating companies, corporate, healthcare compliance and QA guidelines and requests for auditors. Travel: Minimum travel required. ·The ability to travel up to 10% of the time.

job_description: Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C., a division of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies is recruiting for a Scientific Director, located in Beerse, Belgium. At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives. We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found.

Janssen Research & Development, LLC discovers and develops innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Please visit http://www.janssenrnd.com/ for more information.

We are Janssen. Our mission drives us. Our patients inspire us. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We are seeking a motivated computational biologist for a leadership position in the Mechanistic & Investigative Toxicology (MIT) Group within the Nonclinical Safety (NCS) function. You will have computational biology and systems biology experience, including a solid background in genetics /pathway biology/systems models with deep scientific expertise in omics technologies, computer science, bioinformatics, and data analysis. You will have strong leadership, communication, and networking skills to support the global function. You will lead collaborative efforts and joint projects with the broader Janssen R&D; computational biology team(s). You will have a high level of autonomy and will support portfolio projects that span the whole drug discovery process, in addition to driving new innovative computational models for predictive safety. Although a background in toxicology is not required, you should be willing to learn the discipline. Preference for this position is in Beerse, Belgium but additional options for a base in the US (Spring House PA or La Jolla, CA) may be considered.
Key Responsibilities:

Build a computational biology team within NCS that will be part of a collaborative community of computational biologists at Janssen Develop a vision for the group and implement strategies that are aligned with NCS strategies Make hiring decisions, manage staff, and identify training/development needs for direct reports Develop research strategies for the group and track deliverables With the NCS and R&D; Data Sciences groups develop a strategy for systems biology data management to enable integration with other in vitro and in vivo toxicology data for translational risk assessment Build collaborative partnerships across NCS to address computational biology needs and gaps Be a key scientific partner with the computational biology sciences community including the metabolomic and proteomic groups. Identify and implement cutting-edge technologies and systems approaches with translational potential Leverage the scientific capabilities across NCS including pathology, clinical pathology, toxicology, and experts in specific model systems (in vitro and in vivo). Participate in or lead strategically aligned external groups relevant to computational biology sciences and/or toxicology Remain up to date with new developments in the field Work adaptively and flexibly with colleagues across sites spanning the globe in Janssen R&D; and NCS.

Actelion Pharmaceuticals, a Janssen Pharmaceutical Company of Johnson & Johnson, is recruiting for a Brand Manager in Pulmonary Hypertension.

As part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it.

As leader in the field of a rare disease: pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH), with over 15 years of experience in this devastating and incurable cardiovascular disorder, we want to build on this strong foundation to deliver our vision of a normal life for patients with cardiopulmonary disease.

We want to create long-term value for our portfolio through generating a shift in healthcare professional behaviour to enable earlier diagnosis, earlier intensification of treatment and continuous risk-based review.

Within the BeNeLux Business Unit PH (Actelion), we are looking for a Brand Manager eager to contribute to our vision and ready to implement the regional marketing communication strategy for our brand(s) in Belgium and Luxembourg.

Next to the marketing execution, we expect the Brand Manager to provide the team with relevant stakeholder insights, make a solid translation to benefits (as basis for promotional materials) and support them with carefully selected reasons-to-believe and science based insights.

Die Förderung und Entwicklung unserer Mitarbeiter/innen sind zentrale Werte unserer Unternehmenskultur. Menschen, die in einem internationalen Unternehmen ihre Potenziale entfalten und an ihren Aufgaben wachsen möchten, finden bei uns beste Voraussetzungen. Neben der intensiven Einarbeitung und der bedarfsgerechten Weiterbildung sind hervorragende Entwicklungs-möglichkeiten – national und international – sowie eine attraktive Vergütung und überdurchschnittliche Sozialleistungen wichtige Elemente für unsere Mitarbeiter. Darüber hinaus ist unser Konzern gekennzeichnet durch nachwuchs- und karrierefördernde Massnahmen im Einklang mit Familie und Beruf.

Janssen Inc., a member of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for an Immunology Sales Specialist (Rheumatology) to cover AB and SK.

At Janssen, we are dedicated to addressing and solving some of the most important unmet medical needs of our time in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, metabolic and chronic diseases and women’s health. Driven by our commitment to patients, we bring innovative products, services and solutions to people throughout the world. Janssen Inc. is a member of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. Please visit www.janssen.ca for more information.
The primary responsibilities of this position include:

Achieving sales and business objectives (sales & share targets) for assigned brands/indications through customer interactions via 1:1, group selling activity, and CHE activity within the designated territory. Leveraging strong analytical insight, innovative & strategic thinking in order to deliver customer value. Becoming an expert in identifying key insights and business drivers for the specified region/customer group, and how to effectively plan and invest against those identified drivers as articulated in a prepared formalized territory business plan. Leveraging strong analytical insight, innovative & strategic thinking in order to deliver customer value while demonstrating customer engagement in selecting the appropriate mix of activities. Becoming an acknowledged expert in the business within his/her assigned territory by understanding fully the healthcare environment (including customers, products, competitive set, reimbursement policy and regulatory). Developing a complete understanding of health care delivery within the assigned region and how to position the assigned products based on customer needs. Providing technical and educational support to HCP customers. Collaborating with manager and business partners in Sales, Marketing, and Medical Affairs to plan and co-ordinate meetings, symposia and other CME & congress related activities. Collaborating with colleagues to consolidate plans aimed at addressing customer and organizational needs that optimize patient experience.

Johnson & Johnson Vision Surgery

Johnson & Johnson Vision is committed to improving and restoring sight for patients worldwide. Since debuting the world’s first disposable soft contact lens in 1987, it has been helping patients see better through their world-leading ACUVUE® Brand Contact Lenses. In 2017, J&J; expanded into cataract surgery, laser refractive surgery (LASIK) and consumer eye health and now serves more than 60 million patients a day across 103 countries with its eye health portfolio. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer. The Advanced Engineering team for Vision Surgery will play a key role in supporting this strategy.

The Advanced Engineering team leads the delivery of automated solutions for existing and new products within the global Vision Surgery supply chain. The team works in harmony with the manufacturing sites to understand the needs of the business and then develops automated solutions to support product growth, product quality and cost reduction targets. This in reality means working at the cutting edge of automation technology with selected equipment & technology suppliers. All the roles within the team require a commitment to work globally, travelling to manufacturing sites and the automation solution providers to make the projects happen. Great team work & excellent collaboration skills are a must, as is a can-do attitude.

JOB TITLE: Director Biocatalysis API Small Molecule Development
job_title: Director Biocatalysis API Small Molecule Development
job_description: In Pharmaceutical Development & Manufacturing Sciences, the CMC organisation within Janssen Pharmaceutica N.V., we are employing hundreds of scientific researchers and specialized technicians at its site in Beerse, Belgium. In our API Small Molecule Development, we develop practical, efficient, safe and green chemical processes for drug candidates at all stages of development, including second-generation processes and improvement of existing commercial process. We are expanding our in-house development capabilities by hiring a bio-catalysis expert.
Your job function:

You will lead a matrix team focusing on the development of biocatalytic processes for the Janssen pipeline. You will create a dynamic program in the area of bio-catalysis, and will handle its implementation from early development to post-approval.

To do so, you will demonstrate a wide range of research tools and skills, as well as a group of external organizations, contract research and consortia. You will endeavour to remain at the forefront of this discipline via literature, conferences, collaborations and publications
Your key responsibilities:

You are responsible for directing advanced research aimed at the identification – and implementation of bio-catalytic transformations in the synthesis of our therapeutic agents including developing new methodology; originating and developing projects; You will be leading a (matrix) team of scientists; introducing and maintaining a state‑of‑the‑art technical proficiency in the bio catalysis knowledge areas pertaining to process research and development in pharmaceutical industry.You apply state‑of‑the‑art knowledge to own or assigned project. You will demonstrates knowledge/expertise outside of your own field, especially in bridging disciplines.You establish priorities, checkpoints, and time frames for experimental work in support of objectives and for the progress of team projects and objectives.You stay on top of current developments and new techniques by reading the current scientific literature broadly, and by interacting with outside scientists. You will consult on technical and conceptual planes with colleagues in PDMS and may represent Janssen in external knowledge platforms.

Afdeling Chemische Kaliteitsbeheersing - GEEL

Ongeveer 800 medewerkers van Janssen Pharmaceutica zijn werkzaam in onze chemische vestiging in Geel. Hier worden op grote schaal geneeskrachtige stoffen aangemaakt, de actieve bestanddelen van een geneesmiddel die door de farmaceutische productie verwerkt worden in de uiteindelijke toedieningsvorm zoals tabletten, ampullen, zalven en anderen. Chemische Productie Geel legt zichzelf consequent strenge kwaliteitsnormen op, zowel voor producten als werkmethodes . Werken in een veilige, gezonde en milieuvriendelijke omgeving en voldoen aan alle wettelijke vereisten staan dan ook hoog in ons vaandel.
Binnen de afdeling Quality Assurance zijn we op zoek naar een tijdelijke enthousiaste medewerker om het team te versterken
Na een opleidingsperiode zal je mee ingeschakeld worden in het team van kwaliteitsmedewerkers die instaan voor de release onze producten en toezicht over de productie plants.
Dit houdt in dat je verantwoordelijk bent voor de kwaliteitsaspecten gerelateerd aan een set van toegewezen producten zoals :

De vrijgave van grondstoffen, intermediates, finale API’sHet supporteren van onderzoeken en het finaal goedkeuren van onderzoeken gelinkt aan proces- en analytische afwijkingen of out of spec resultaten en/of het bewaken dat ernstige afwkijkingen tijdig ge-escalateerd of geconsulteerd worden binnen de organizatie in lijn met de geldende procedures. De opvolging/uitvoering van projecten i.f.v. procesoptimalizaties, plant transfers, outsourcing inclusief:Impact assessments uitvoeren in functie van geplande wijzigingen, afsluiten van wijzigingenReview en goedkeuring van protocollen en rapporten voor procesvalidatieBetrokken in review van procescriticaliteitsanalyseReview van bedrijfsvoorschriften,Managen van procesgerelateerde product issuesReview en goedkeuring van protollen en rapporten voor analytische transfers.Het vertegenwoordigen van de kwaliteitsafdeling in de technical teams, deze teams hebben als doel de levenscyclus van het proces te supporteren en binnen dit kader initiatieven te initieren ifv continue verbetering van processen ifv kwaliteit, kost, compliance. Het behandelen van vragen van klanten mbt kwaliteitsaspecten, het opvolgen van de naleving van quality agreements en het behandelen van klachten gelinkt aan de productkwaliteit.Review en approval van PQR’s voor de commerciële kritische intermediates, API’s geproduceerd in chemische productie Belgie voor de toegewezen producten.

job_description: DePuy Synthes, a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for Senior Software Quality Test Engineer, Robotic Surgery with a preferred location of Boston, MA. Candidates may also be considered in Raynham, MA. Please note, we currently have an interim/satellite location in Mansfield, MA and candidates may also be eligible to work out of this location.

DePuy Synthes, part of the Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies, provides one of the most comprehensive orthopedics portfolios in the world. DePuy Synthes solutions, in specialties including joint reconstruction, trauma, craniomaxillofacial, spinal surgery and sports medicine, are designed to advance patient care while delivering clinical and economic value to health care systems worldwide. For more information, visit www.depuysynthes.com.

The Digital Orthopedic Surgery team is bringing innovation to patient care. We are using robotics and digital tools for surgical teams to increase the performance, accuracy, and safety of surgical procedures. We are creating an extensible operating room ecosystem to support our surgical robotics. Our vision is to create a process of continuous improvement through analysis of intra-operative and post-operative surgical data. We are dedicated to improving patient outcomes through the advancement of medical technology. The Senior Software Test Automation Engineer works on a cross-functional team to deliver production medical systems.

Develop effective automated testing for applications during the Software Development Lifecycle including design, implementation, and execution.Define testing and test automation strategy alongside a team of software development professionals.Participate in an Agile team of software test engineers focused on the Software Development Lifecycle of our applications ensuring high engagement and high performance in application delivery.Execute test plans and test cases ensuring that they meet provided requirements and acceptance criteria.Develop a detailed understanding and consistent use of our Quality Management System tools and procedures including documentation of Software Verification Protocols and test results.

job_description: DePuy Synthes, a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for Lead Software Test Engineer with a preferred location of Boston, MA. Candidates may also be considered in Raynham, MA. Please note, we currently have an interim/satellite location in Mansfield, MA and candidates may also be eligible to work out of this location.

DePuy Synthes, part of the Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies, provides one of the most comprehensive orthopedics portfolios in the world. DePuy Synthes solutions, in specialties including joint reconstruction, trauma, craniomaxillofacial, spinal surgery and sports medicine, are designed to advance patient care while delivering clinical and economic value to health care systems worldwide. For more information, visit www.depuysynthes.com.

The Digital Orthopedic Surgery team is bringing innovation to patient care. We are using robotics and digital tools for surgical teams to increase the performance, accuracy, and safety of surgical procedures. We are creating an extensible operating room ecosystem to support our surgical robotics. Our vision is to create a process of continuous improvement through analysis of intra-operative and post-operative surgical data. We are dedicated to improving patient outcomes through the advancement of medical technology. The Lead Software Test Engineer will lead and manage test engineers on a cross-functional team to deliver production medical systems.
In this role you will:

Lead a team of test engineers and collaborate with other software development professionals in defining a software test strategy. Lead the development for writing and executing test cases ensuring that they meet provided requirements and acceptance criteria.Participate in an Agile team of software test engineers focused on the Software Development Life Cycle of our applications, ensuring high engagement and high performance in application delivery.Deliver effective testing of applications during the Software Development Life Cycle including design, implementation, and execution.Ensure the consistent use of our Quality Management System tools and document Software Verification Protocols and test results.
Lead a team of test engineers and collaborate with other software development professionals in defining a software test strategy.
Lead the development for writing and executing test cases ensuring that they meet provided requirements and acceptance criteria.
Participate in an Agile team of software test engineers focused on the Software Development Life Cycle of our applications, ensuring high engagement and high performance in application delivery.
Deliver effective testing of applications during the Software Development Life Cycle including design, implementation, and execution.
Ensure the consistent use of our Quality Management System tools and document Software Verification Protocols and test results.

A minimum of a Bachelor's degree is required; A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science is preferred. A minimum of 6 years of experience in software development and/or testing is required.Experience leading software testing/development teams in a regulated environment is highly preferred. Experience creating and executing test plans, including verification of input requirements is required. Experience with QA (Quality Assurance) related aspects of the software development life cycle from development to deployment is required. Experience with continuous integration implementations is required. Familiarity with common programming languages such as C++, C#, and Python is required. Experience managing individual contributors as part of a large, global organization is preferred.Experience writing test cases using the BDD/Gherkin format is preferred.Experience working in an Agile software development team and familiarity with Agile development practices is strongly preferred.Experience using a repository for managing test cases is preferred.Experience working in a highly regulated environment is preferred.Experience with medical device software is strongly preferred.The preferred location for this position is Boston, MA. Johnson & Johnson Vision, a member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is currently seeking a Director, Consumer Experience to be based in Jacksonville, FL.

Johnson & Johnson Vision is committed to improving and restoring sight for patients worldwide. Since debuting the world’s first disposable soft contact lens in 1987, it has been helping patients see better through their world-leading ACUVUE® Brand Contact Lenses. In 2017, J&J; expanded into cataract surgery, laser refractive surgery (LASIK) and consumer eye health and now serves more than 60 million patients a day across 103 countries with its eye health portfolio.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

The Director, Consumer Experience, has a key strategic leadership role within the Vision Care Global Franchise Development (GFD) organization serving as the global brand steward for the $3B ACUVUE® brand. ACUVUE® is the world leader in contact lenses, a leading Personal Care brand worldwide and one of the largest consumer-facing brands within J&J.;

This leader sets global brand strategy, strengthens global brand equity and builds assets and capabilities that leverage the size, scale, and synergies of the ACUVUE®. As the owner of the global ACUVUE® brand, this person is responsible for creating an integrated Consumer Experience that builds brand love with consumers and connects to the Professional Experience.

This Director will be responsible for global communications, digital, precision marketing and social strategy, and content development across all consumer touchpoints. This person will be expected to demonstrate leadership and build strategic partnerships with global agencies and local, regional and global cross functional teams to drive strategy, precision and data analytics and innovation for superior execution globally. This person will also be responsible for staying ahead of industry trends and for bringing innovative ways of working, new tools and marketing plans to the drive new thinking across the marketing organization globally. Other responsibilities include managing the annual Scope of Work (SOW) process and global agency partner selection as well as fostering ongoing talent development across our global marketing organization through Marketing Excellence training and development.

Build the ACUVUE® brand globally including brand definition, architecture, and equity design guidelines across all marketing/communications materials. Deliver an integrated, end-to-end ACUVUE® Experience that is customer-centric and drives category growth and a sustainable competitive advantage. Define and build a comprehensive consumer digital marketing strategy including evolution of ACUVUE.com, social, precision marketing and content management. Foster talent development and build marketing competency across Vision Care by driving Marketing Excellence training and development programs and curriculum.Steward execution of the ACUVUE® Equity ensuring regional alignment, deployment and adoption of the Global Brand Voice, Purpose, Guidelines and Packaging.Leverage Transfer Success Models across regions/countries, transferring learning and best practices globally in partnership with global brand management platform teams. Establish a strong collaborative relationship with agency partners to ensure all global brand management marketing programming and regional marketing needs are being met/exceeded. Own the Scope of Work process with Procurement and Agency Leads and the mid-year and year-end agency and vision care marketing reviews in partnership with JNJ Global Marketing Services Group.Build a global mindset within the broader Vision Care organization and develop marketing expertise within regional/local teams, fostering high-performance environment and culture of collaboration and innovation.Perform other related duties as assigned by management.

Rejoindre nos équipes, c’est s'épanouir dans une entreprise à taille humaine tout en bénéficiant des opportunités d’un grand groupe. La grande majorité de nos opportunités Jeunes Diplômés est pourvue par d’anciens stagiaires et alternants !
Johnson & Johnson Santé Beauté France, recherche
Assistant Chefs de Produits H/F en stage, pour ses marques de médicaments sans ordonnances (OTC).
Le marche concerné: le sevrage tabagique (Nicorette®)
Localisation : Issy-les-Moulineaux (proche Paris)
J&J; se positionne comme l'un des leaders sur le marché de l’automédication et des médicaments sans ordonnances (OTC).

L’assistant chef de produit OTC sera rattaché au Chef de Produit et aura pour mission de contribuer au développement de différentes marques de notre portefeuille. Il aura l’opportunité, au cours de ses projets, de collaborer avec de nombreux acteurs internes (équipe commerciale, équipe category, règlementaires, professionnels de santé…) et externes (agence de création, prestataires…).

Il épaulera le Chef de produit dans la construction de la stratégie long terme des marques et gérera en autonomie des projets opérationnels. Il fera partie intégrante de l’équipe marketing OTC et participera, à ce titre, activement aux meetings d’équipe.

job_title: Praktikant (m/w/d) im Produktmarketing in der Immunologie / Dermatologie
job_description: Uns verbindet die Leidenschaft für unsere Mitmenschen: für Patienten, Kunden, die Gesellschaft, füreinander. Als eines der größten Gesundheitsunternehmen der Welt suchen wir Persönlichkeiten, die mit uns Großes bewirken wollen – das Wohlbefinden und die Gesundheit von Menschen weltweit und in Deutschland zu verbessern. Wir schätzen Charakterköpfe mit Teamgeist, die Verantwortung übernehmen und mit uns innovative Produkte und Services entwickeln. Dafür bieten wir ein modernes, flexibles Arbeitsumfeld und unzählige Karrierewege in unserem internationalen Netzwerk.

Im Geschäftsbereich Pharmaceuticals, bei Janssen in Neuss, widmen Sie sich einigen der größten medizinischen Herausforderungen unserer Zeit. Im Innendienst bei Janssen sind Sie maßgeblich daran beteiligt, die Bedürfnisse von Patienten zu identifizieren und innovative Lösungskonzepte und Therapien zu entwickeln und mit Partnern gemeinsam umzusetzen.

Qualifizierter Nachwuchs nimmt in unserem Hause eine bedeutende Stellung ein. Als Praktikant/in können Sie bei uns umfassende Einblicke in unsere Konzernwelt erhalten und eigenständig an spannenden Projekten mitarbeiten.

In einem Zeitraum von ca. 6 Monaten können Sie in unserer pharmazeutischen Unternehmenssparte Janssen wertvolle Einblicke in die Vermarktung von Arzneimitteln bekommen und aktiv in einem funktionsübergreifend tätigen Team mitwirken.

Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for a Change Maker for Change Management & Communications within the Johnson & Johnson Global Services organization to be located in Prague, Czech Republic.

At Johnson & Johnson, we’ve always excelled in times of change. We stand on the front lines of the biggest health challenges of our time, and we’re here to win. Our long history of firsts–Band-Aids, feminine care, cardiovascular stents, cancer treatments, digital health and, most recently, a life-changing vaccine against HIV–are proof that our proprietary blend of heart, science and ingenuity is profoundly changing the trajectory of health for humanity.
But those epic breakthroughs didn’t really come from Johnson & Johnson the company– they were discovered, developed and distributed by people just like you.
Location: Prague, Czech Republic
Contract: Full-time, unlimited contract

The Change Management Lead plays a key role in ensuring Global Services (GS) projects or projects impacting Global Services meet objectives on time and on budget by increasing employee adoption and usage. The Lead focuses on the people side of change – including changes to business processes, systems and technology, job roles and organization structures. The primary responsibility is creating and implementing change management strategies following a consistent methodology and plans that maximize employee adoption and usage and minimize resistance.

The Change Management Lead works to drive faster adoption, higher ultimate utilization and greater proficiency of the changes that impact employees in the organization to increase benefit realization, value creation, ROI and the achievement of results and outcomes. All in close collaboration with other consultants, functional partners to ensure they are following the methodology when they are responsible for the change work.
Apply a structured methodology and lead change management activities

JnJ Vision Care is focused on providing the full range of advanced refractive technologies and support to help eye care professionals deliver optimal vision and lifestyle experiences to patients of all ages.

AMO Groningen BV is specialized in the development, improvement and manufacturing of state of the art surgical ophthalmic products, mainly intra-ocular lenses. The facility consists of small and integrated Research, Development and Manufacturing teams that have strong track records. Currently we are looking for a talent for the position of:
Tasks and responsibilities

The Optical Scientist is a key addition to the intraocular lens research and development team located in The Netherlands, Europe. He/She will be responsible for R&D; activities related to the design and development of intraocular lenses and will support the development of new optical metrology for testing intraocular lenses. Key tasks and responsibilities are:
• Participate in the development of new concepts for unique medical devices from ideation to market phase
• Support and participate in design and development of new intraocular lenses and new optical metrology for testing intraocular lenses.
• Develop test methods and validation systems to characterize new and existing intraocular lenses.
• Support requirements development, documentation of design, writing and execution of protocols and reports.

• Stay current with the status of competitive products, with cutting-edge medical device industry and with technology trends to ensure innovative product design. Investigate and evaluate existing technologies.
• You will contribute to multi-disciplinary research teams and will be responsible for conducting independent research tasks with European research institutes.
• Work closely within a cross-functional team, with senior research staff, and also with research institutes and R&D; groups in USA.
Requirements
• BS/MS/PhD in optics, physics or vision science
• Preferably 4 or more years of relevant experience
• Proficient in optical design principles, using Zemax, OSLO or other design tools to design and simulate optical systems
• Demonstrated research experience and interest in technology development
• Strong problem solving skills
• Demonstrated verbal and written communication skills
• Self-motivated, creative, flexible, positive attitude individual with the initiative and drive for timely completion of goals
• Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment

JOB TITLE: SENIOR FINANCE DIRECTOR Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Italy
job_title: SENIOR FINANCE DIRECTOR Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Italy
job_description: Johnson & Johnson is the world´s most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services. The values that guide our decision making are motivated by a culture of caring. Caring for the world ... one person at a time…Inspires and unites the people of Johnson & Johnson. The company is operating in the fields of pharmaceuticals, medical devices and consumer health care products with > 130,000 employees in more than 250 companies around the world.

Medical Italy is the operating company responsible for the Italian medical devices business. With ~ € 500 M of Net Trade Sales, it is the second largest country for Medical in EMEA. Medical Italy is #1 or #2 in most of the platforms in which it operates.
For our office in Rome, we are currently looking for a:
Senior Finance Director Medical Devices Italy

The Senior Finance Director will be responsible for the financial leadership, direction and management of Medical Italy. This includes the development, execution, management and follow up of strategies and action plans to maximize the value of our portfolio over the long term. In doing so, the Finance Director will also ensure alignment with all stakeholders to develop and implement these plans. This includes the planning of revenue, allocation of resources, optimization of working capital and the management of the financial risks and opportunities. The role will report directly into the CFO Medical Devices EMEA.
Key responsibilities:

Janssen Global Services, a member of Johnson & Johnson's family of companies, is recruiting for a Sr. Director, Global Medical Affairs Leader (GMAL) Neuroscience, located in Titusville, NJ.

Janssen Global Services, L.L.C. (JGS) is a legal corporate entity encompassing a unique group of departments/organizations/teams that provide leadership across business critical areas for Janssen, the pharmaceutical companies of Johnson & Johnson. The following groups make up JGS: Global Commercial Strategy Organization, Global Pharmaceutical Communication and Public Affairs; U.S. Pharmaceutical Procurement Group (USPPG); and Pharmaceuticals Group Business Development (PGBD).
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

The Global Medical Affairs Leader (GMAL) is responsible for leading the clinical-commercial optimization of product development and life cycle management strategies and plans for the Neuroscience therapeutic area. He/she will partner closely with Regional Medical TA/product leaders to develop integrated global medical affairs perspectives, strategies and plans. The GMAL will be an integral member of the Disease Area Strategy Team, the Compound Development Teams, and Global Commercial Teams as well as an ad hoc member of the clinical teams, Global Marketing Teams and licensing sub-committee of the therapeutic area and will be responsible for development of the global medical affairs plan that reflects prioritized regional needs, and which are included in the overall Compound Development Plan. In addition, the GMAL will be accountable for the global publications plans, global opinion leader relations, global medical education (including symposia, speaker training) and global advisory boards for products starting in early development (phase IIA) and through launch. The GMAL will also be responsible for facilitating and ensuring a consistent approach to Medical Affairs programs/activities globally.

The GMAL will develop global medical affairs strategy and plan for the compound based on prioritizing regional needs; working with the CDT ensures integration with the overall global compound strategy, resulting in one global R&D; and Medical Affairs compound development plan, inclusive of developing a Target Product Profile representing medical affairs global and regional value needs. The GMAL provides a single Medical Affairs voice into the creation of compound development and LCM strategies, plans and trial design from phase IIa through phase IV ensuring optimal product differentiation. Responsible for pre-launch medical activities including product/Therapeutic Area global advisory boards, medical symposia and congress activities, coordination of regional activity in these areas. The GMAL will be an active member of the CDT and will lead a global Medical Affairs TA Team consisting of regionally designated Therapeutic Area Medical Affairs Leaders to create one medical affairs perspective and one "unified" voice on the CDT; Collaborates closely with the regional medical affairs representatives to develop integrated global medical affairs strategies and plans and maintain open, two-way communication to ensure regional medical affairs is up to date on all plans, progress and decisions. The GMAL will synchronize input and output of the Med Affairs plan with the strategic and business plan calendars. The GMAL is the process owner for ReCAP for products and global publications planning process oversight (pre-launch and throughout lifecycle) including manuscripts, abstracts, posters and papers as well as pre-launch global KOL communications & speaker development. Review of manuscripts to ensure alignment with strategy and effective communication/presentation in internal and external audiences (eg. Symposia). For studies run out of the Global Affairs Team, the incumbent will sign off on the protocol and the study reports as the Study Responsible Physician. The GMAL is responsible to ensure all global activities follow J&J; Compliance principles, e g. Health Care Compliance, etc. for new products and will oversee and coordinate the Medical Information Core Responses.

A minimum of an MD degree is requiredSpecialty training in the Neuroscience Therapeutic Area (Neurologist / Psychiatrist) is highly preferred. A minimum of 10 years of combined relevant experience in a medical/clinical environment and/or scientific function in the pharmaceutical industry or CRO is requiredA minimum of 5+ years of experience in the Medical Affairs environment is preferred.Knowledge of products, both J&J; and competitors, in the Neuroscience Area is preferred. A demonstrated track record leading highly matrixed, cross-functional work teams comprised of high-level managers and executives is required. A demonstrated track record of success within Medical Affairs and/or clinical R&D; is required. Global mindset and direct experience in multiple markets and a proven ability to partner cross culturally/regionally is required. In-depth knowledge of study methodology, study data reviews and analysis is required. Excellent knowledge of study execution, benefit risk management and regulatory affairs is preferred. Experience in the generation of real world evidence plans as well as market access requirements are desiredA highly innovative individual with the ability to drive a complex and changing environment and effectively manage and resolve issues within the TA is needed. Proven ability to act as a medical spokesperson for external audiences is required. Also required is strong experience developing and managing strategic relationships with medical experts/opinion leaders. Strong leadership experience with the ability to influence stakeholders is an asset. Proven business understanding and a proven track record on ethics as related to Credo principles is required. This position will require 25% or more annual travel in the US and internationally.

Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C., a division of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies is recruiting for a Senior Associate Scientist, Enzymology/Biochemistry to be located in Spring House, PA.

At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives. We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found. Please visit http://www.janssenrnd.com/ for more information.
We are Janssen. Our mission drives us. Our patients inspire us. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it.

The Lead Discovery team is a critical part of the Discovery Sciences (DS) organization in Janssen R&D;, is committed to the delivery of high quality chemical leads needed for the generation of small molecule clinical compounds in all five Janssen Therapeutic Area (TA) discovery teams. This mission requires deep scientific expertise in a number of disciplines including chemistry, cellular and molecular pharmacology, enzymology, and screening technologies coupled with an ability to work collaboratively with internal and external partners. Building on a strong legacy of success, we are currently seeking an outstanding individual to join our team as a Senior Associate Scientist, Enzymology. This position will report to a senior member of the Molecular & Cellular Pharmacology Group, and be based in Spring House, PA.

The candidate will provide enzymology/biochemistry support and expertise to therapeutic area programs from target nomination through declaration of a clinical candidate. S/he will characterize novel enzymes, elucidate options for hit ID approaches, collaborate with screening scientists on direct binding studies, development of HTS assays, and perform mechanism-of-action studies on validated hits. The candidate will provide enzyme and inhibitor mechanistic data and insight and analyze biochemical and cellular SAR throughout different stages of the project. The candidate will provide enzymology/biochemistry expertise to internal programs as well as external collaborations. S/he will collaborate in a highly multidisciplinary/matrix environment for the progression of drug discovery projects.

A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree with 8 or more years of experience in enzymology /biochemistry/biophysics/pharmacology is required.ORA minimum of a Master’s Degree 4 or more years of experience of experience in enzymology /biochemistry/biophysics/pharmacology is required.Strong record of publications is required.Extensive experience and knowledge in majority of the following areas; mechanism-of-action studies, enzyme characterization, steady state kinetics, protein biochemistry, and assay development is required.Strong capabilities to collaborate with scientists in multiple disciplines is required.Excellent written and oral communication skills is required.Excellent quantitative analytical skills and be an expert in high-throughput mass spectroscopy, mechanistic biochemistry and enzyme kinetics is preferred.Direct experience in mechanistic characterization of the drug candidate molecules with their target proteins is preferred.
A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree with 8 or more years of experience in enzymology /biochemistry/biophysics/pharmacology is required.
OR
A minimum of a Master’s Degree 4 or more years of experience of experience in enzymology /biochemistry/biophysics/pharmacology is required.
Strong record of publications is required.

Extensive experience and knowledge in majority of the following areas; mechanism-of-action studies, enzyme characterization, steady state kinetics, protein biochemistry, and assay development is required.
Strong capabilities to collaborate with scientists in multiple disciplines is required.
Excellent written and oral communication skills is required.
Excellent quantitative analytical skills and be an expert in high-throughput mass spectroscopy, mechanistic biochemistry and enzyme kinetics is preferred.
Direct experience in mechanistic characterization of the drug candidate molecules with their target proteins is preferred.

Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for a Digital Strategy & Branding Specialist for Talent Acquisition within the Johnson & Johnson Global Services organization to be located in Prague, Czech Republic.

employer Branding and digital strategy Specialist

JOB TITLE: Talent Data Intelligence Specialist With German
job_title: Talent Data Intelligence Specialist with German
job_description: Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for a Talent Intelligence Analyst (French Speaking) for Talent Acquisition within the Johnson & Johnson Global Services organization to be located in Prague, Czech Republic.

At Johnson & Johnson, we’ve always excelled in times of change. We stand on the front lines of the biggest health challenges of our time, and we’re here to win. Our long history of firsts–Band-Aids, feminine care, cardiovascular stents, cancer treatments, digital health and, most recently, a life-changing vaccine against HIV–are proof that our proprietary blend of heart, science and ingenuity is profoundly changing the trajectory of health for humanity.
But those epic breakthroughs didn’t really come from Johnson & Johnson the company– they were discovered, developed and distributed by people just like you.
Talent data intelligence specialist with german
Location: Prague, Czech Republic
Contract: Full-time, unlimited contract

As a member of our global recruiting team, Talent Data Analyst will drive business intelligence initiatives which will help our recruitment teams to be the best, so we can recruit for the best talents for Johnson & Johnson to change the trajectory of human health for humanity.

In this role, you will partner to implement a new portfolio of talent analytics products and services. You’ll be an integral part of the wider Global Talent Intelligence team (mostly based in Manila), to drive key components of the Talent Data Intelligence strategy and enable the enterprise to make critical talent decisions based on insights generated through research & data.

Use multiple technologies, data, research and analytical insights to influence and drive Johnson & Johnson enterprise talent strategies and recruiting attraction efforts Deliver high impact products in areas such as: talent supply and demand analysis for diverse types of roles in diverse markets (primarily using your languages), competitive intelligence analysis, talent flow reporting, location strategy research, etc. Apply your expertise in quantitative & qualitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers, identify trends and opportunities, and influence strategies with data-based insights. Partner closely with Talent Building and Recruiting leadership in aligning on intake of product requests, set expectations for delivery, and lead all aspects of product delivery Support ownership and delivery of Talent Building and Recruiting data, metrics and insights. Act as a change agent and influencer, continuing to be on the top of analytical capabilities trends outside of Johnson & Johnson and bringing new knowledge into the organization.
Use multiple technologies, data, research and analytical insights to influence and drive Johnson & Johnson enterprise talent strategies and recruiting attraction efforts

Deliver high impact products in areas such as: talent supply and demand analysis for diverse types of roles in diverse markets (primarily using your languages), competitive intelligence analysis, talent flow reporting, location strategy research, etc.

Apply your expertise in quantitative & qualitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers, identify trends and opportunities, and influence strategies with data-based insights.
Partner closely with Talent Building and Recruiting leadership in aligning on intake of product requests, set expectations for delivery, and lead all aspects of product delivery
Support ownership and delivery of Talent Building and Recruiting data, metrics and insights.
Act as a change agent and influencer, continuing to be on the top of analytical capabilities trends outside of Johnson & Johnson and bringing new knowledge into the organization.
Crucial requirements for candidates:

Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for a Talent Builder for Talent Acquisition within the Johnson & Johnson Global Services organization to be located in Prague, Czech Republic.

At Johnson & Johnson, we’ve always excelled in times of change. We stand on the front lines of the biggest health challenges of our time, and we’re here to win. Our long history of firsts–Band-Aids, feminine care, cardiovascular stents, cancer treatments, digital health and, most recently, a life-changing vaccine against HIV–are proof that our proprietary blend of heart, science and ingenuity is profoundly changing the trajectory of health for humanity.
But those epic breakthroughs didn’t really come from Johnson & Johnson the company– they were discovered, developed and distributed by people just like you.
Location: Prague, Czech Republic
Contract: Full-time, unlimited contract

As a member of our global recruiting team, Talent Builder will help our recruitment teams to be the best, so we can recruit for the best talents for Johnson & Johnson to change the trajectory of human health for humanity.

In this role, you will be an integral part of the Talent Building & Talent Intelligence organization focused on the creation and execution of talent identification and digital engagement strategies for top passive talent to ensure we build robust talent pipelines for current and future needs across Johnson & Johnson organization. You will be focused on building talent pipelines for diverse profiles recruited within Europe – Middle East – Africa region (EMEA).

Use multiple capabilities including innovative technology, data, research and analytical insights to create and drive Johnson & Johnsons talent attraction strategy and directly build talent pipelines through J&J;’s technologies Use enterprise engagement strategies (J&J; employer brand, etc.) and own the development of innovative digital outreach campaigns (via social media, email outreach, etc.) for both short & long-term talent needs Partner with onsite recruiters on assigned requisitions to optimize talent building capabilities and ensure alignment on successful talent search Work closely with the Talent Intelligence team to enhance talent building outcomes based on research and insights and talent landscape analytics provided Partner with Talent Building Leadership Team in reviewing performance metrics, key performance indicators, that improve talent building efficiency and overall individual & team performance

Engineer Lab Equipment

Heb je een passie voor techniek in een lab omgeving en wil je mee op ontdekking naar automatisatie en innovatieve oplossingen voor het lab van de toekomst? Goed nieuws want wij zijn op zoek naar jou! Om het Beerse Lab Equipment Team te versterken zoeken we een engineer die de noden van het lab invult bij de introductie van (gecomputeriseerd) lab equipment en die voortdurend oog heeft voor vernieuwing en automatisatie in het lab. Krijg jij energie om een operationeel lab te ondersteunen met hoogtechnologische oplossingen ? Dan ben jij diegene naar wie we dringend op zoek zijn !

Als engineer kom je terecht in het Lab Equipment Lifecycle Management team van de Janssen Supply Chain te Beerse. Je bent er verantwoordelijk voor de compliance status van GxP-kritisch lab equipment. Je bouwt strategische kennis op over het lab equipment en lab automatisatie om alzo klaar te zijn voor het lab van de toekomst. Samen met je collega’s garandeer je een optimale ondersteuning voor de operationele labo’s in de volledige levenscyclus van lab equipment. Dit is een vaste positie in dagdienst.
Je taken en verantwoordelijkheden binnen het Equipment Lifecycle Management team:

Je garandeert compliance met de wetgeving en procedures in de volledige levenscyclus van een lab equipment. Dit omvat o.m. selectie, installatie, operationele kwalificatie en het testen van standaard en gecomputeriseerd equipment. Je treedt op als aanspreekpunt en hebt verantwoordelijkheid voor de planning, coördinatie, uitvoering, opvolging en kennisborging van de kwalificatie activiteiten. Je implementeert lab automatisatie projecten waarbij “mobility” en data-integriteit relevante doelstellingen zijn. Het verwerven en borgen van kennis en expertise in het team zijn belangrijk.Je biedt ondersteuning bij health authority inspecties.Je voert onderzoeken bij afwijkingen waarbij je correctieve en preventieve acties definieert en implementeert. Je zorgt voor een uitstekende samenwerking met andere afdelingen (QA, EH&S;, R&D;, Technische Dienst, ...) en met de vele leveranciers.Je initieert en implementeert verbeteringsprojecten om bijvoorbeeld de kwaliteit of efficiëntie te verhogen.

Johnson & Johnson Switzerland is hiring a colleague to lead commercially the entire country for our recently acquired new business of Gastro Esophagus Reflux Disease (GERD).

The Senior Sales Consultant will be responsible for the implementation and development of product & specialty specific marketing strategies, which supports the achievement of our ambitious business plan. This new role enables us to bring our new business of Reflux Disease to the next and broader level of utilisation. Our aim is to make a remarkable revolutionary technology available to patients presenting to upper GI surgeons in Switzerland. The product is successfully launched and sold in Germany and in the US already.

ETHICON’s focus for almost a century has been to deliver innovations that matter to our customers and ultimately make a difference for patients. Customers can continue depending on us on world-class solutions for surgery. We are committed to quality in all we deliver.

Reporting to the DACH Lead, you will be responsible for the development and implementation of a new product category by providing clinical and commercial support. You will shape and drive specialty specific sales & marketing strategies, which support the achievement of our ambitious business plan. You will join a dynamic regional team motivated by their ambition to further expand access to a revolutionary newly acquired product to treat GERD and work closely with other cross-country sales teams to enable and drive activities jointly to successfully develop & grow this business opportunity. We are looking for a highly responsible and self-driven person to contribute to the success in our team.

The role has been created for you, if you have the right level of experience and a creative mind on how to drive the Swiss market forward! The BDM not only builds customer relationship, but also drives the right mix of activities needed to support the business strategy on a national level.

JOB TITLE: Team Lead GS Finance ATR Global Process
job_title: Team Lead GS Finance ATR Global Process

job_description: In 2016 Johnson and Johnson acquired NeuWave Medical, a company offering minimally invasive, microwave ablation systems for intervention options for patients with soft tissue lesions. This acquisition is consistent with the Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices’ strategy of advancing innovation and investing in areas of unmet medical needs such as surgical oncology. NeuWave products are currently used by physicians in over half of the top cancer centers in the United States. In EMEA we successfully completed the functional integration, allowing us to now solely focus on business growth, driven by securing market access, shaping reimbursement landscape with clinical and economic data, evidence deployment and execution of marketing strategies.

As we continue to expand our business we are looking for an enthusiastic sales person with a can-do attitude who is up for an exciting and rewarding opportunity. We are a team of energetic and self starter individuals, and look forward to welcoming a new member so that together we can maximise the growth of our innovation.
This position is based in Germany, or in Belgium or NL if the candidate is willing to travel to Germany for most of the week.

As core member of finance team to enforce effective Pricing governance, the candidate will play an important role in supporting BU to manage all Pricing initiative to ensure effective governance is in place while still providing financial input to enhance business value. Lead annual/semi-annual distributor margin analysis and overall manage all product price in SAP system; Lead the task of annual distributor FMV(fair market value) exercise as well as support channel management team in finance related matters as finance partner. Monitor and manage all promotion program performance and work together with BU finance partners & marketing to identify the root cause of variance to original target and provide countermeasure/improvement recommendation. To be a successful candidate, you are an experienced finance professional with good business knowledge and prior extensive interactive experience with BU head level; You can effectively influence business decision with your strong fact based financial analytical skills built upon good business insight.

To maintain full compliance of products with regulatory requirements

Uns verbindet die Leidenschaft für unsere Mitmenschen: für Kunden, Patienten, die Gesellschaft, füreinander. Als größtes Gesundheitsunternehmen der Welt suchen wir Persönlichkeiten, die mit uns Großes bewirken wollen – das Wohlbefinden und die Gesundheit von Menschen weltweit und in Deutschland zu verbessern. Wir schätzen Charakterköpfe, die Verantwortung übernehmen und Lust daran haben, im Team neue Ideen einzubringen und mit uns neue innovative Produkte und Services zu entwickeln. Dafür bieten wir ein modernes, flexibles Arbeitsumfeld und unzählige Karrierewege in unserem internationalen Netzwerk.

Janssen-Cilag ist eine Tochtergesellschaft des weltweit führenden Healthcare-Konzerns Johnson & Johnson. In Deutschland gehört die Janssen-Cilag GmbH zu den führenden, forschenden Arzneimittelanbietern.
Derzeit suchen wir zur Verstärkung unseres HR Workforce Data Administration Teams einen motivierten
Praktikant (m/w/d) - HR Administration
Standort Norderstedt

JOB TITLE: Johnson & Johnson - Operations Manager - JLABS @ Washington, DC,
job_title: Johnson & Johnson - Operations Manager - JLABS @ Washington, DC,
job_description: The Operations Manager will implement the Houston operating model which includes onboarding activities (pre-move-in, move in), ongoing facilities/equipment/EH&S;/security management, overall laboratory management and off-boarding activities for both JLABS and resident companies.You will partner closely with multiple J&J; teams, stakeholders, and suppliers to manage all facets of the service delivery model including but not limited to, day to day facility operations, strategic facility planning, compliance, facility & laboratory equipment maintenance and purchases, all soft services (mailroom, housekeeping, conference room management, shipping & receiving, etc.), security, IT services, and EH&S.; This is accomplished through applying proven leadership abilities, experience, and knowledge while strictly adhering to regulatory/compliance procedures and requirements.The Operations Manager will develop and implement Standard Operating Procedures to facilitate execution of the Operational and Environmental, Health and Safety Management Plans.You will be responsible for the implementation of the Corporate Risk Mitigation Plan, which includes the coordination of periodic business audits and follow-up plans for corrective action and continuous improvement.You will select and provide clear direction for service providers on expectations, develop and implement clear & achievable service levels with remediation and escalation procedures for disputes and oversee all contractor delivered programs to ensure adherence to J&J; standards and policies.You will be directly accountable for developing and managing the operational expense budget, driving cost reductions, cost efficiencies, and optimized contractor management.You will serve as the senior operations leader onsite to manage emergency response to situations in the lab and to liaise with external stakeholders such as fire and police departments, regulatory agencies, etc.You will develop and sustain business relationships with companies residing in JLABS including gaining and maintaining the respect of the scientific community and is responsible for customer relationship management and ensuring positive customer workplace experiences during their residence in JLABS.You will continuously solicit stakeholder feedback on the program and appropriately leverage the feedback to establish goals, direction, and a vision to improve or expand the program with a focus on cost savings and scalability.The Operations Manager will direct and coordinate construction activities to ensure project delivers business & customer value, for agreed scope, on schedule, within budget, and at a defined quality level including managing issues, decisions & risks, and escalation to sponsors as needed.In this role, the Operations Manager is on call 24/7 and will need to be trained in media relations in the event of an emergency.

The Operations Manager will implement the Houston operating model which includes onboarding activities (pre-move-in, move in), ongoing facilities/equipment/EH&S;/security management, overall laboratory management and off-boarding activities for both JLABS and resident companies.

You will partner closely with multiple J&J; teams, stakeholders, and suppliers to manage all facets of the service delivery model including but not limited to, day to day facility operations, strategic facility planning, compliance, facility & laboratory equipment maintenance and purchases, all soft services (mailroom, housekeeping, conference room management, shipping & receiving, etc.), security, IT services, and EH&S.; This is accomplished through applying proven leadership abilities, experience, and knowledge while strictly adhering to regulatory/compliance procedures and requirements.
The Operations Manager will develop and implement Standard Operating Procedures to facilitate execution of the Operational and Environmental, Health and Safety Management Plans.

You will be responsible for the implementation of the Corporate Risk Mitigation Plan, which includes the coordination of periodic business audits and follow-up plans for corrective action and continuous improvement.

You will select and provide clear direction for service providers on expectations, develop and implement clear & achievable service levels with remediation and escalation procedures for disputes and oversee all contractor delivered programs to ensure adherence to J&J; standards and policies.
You will be directly accountable for developing and managing the operational expense budget, driving cost reductions, cost efficiencies, and optimized contractor management.

You will serve as the senior operations leader onsite to manage emergency response to situations in the lab and to liaise with external stakeholders such as fire and police departments, regulatory agencies, etc.

You will develop and sustain business relationships with companies residing in JLABS including gaining and maintaining the respect of the scientific community and is responsible for customer relationship management and ensuring positive customer workplace experiences during their residence in JLABS.

You will continuously solicit stakeholder feedback on the program and appropriately leverage the feedback to establish goals, direction, and a vision to improve or expand the program with a focus on cost savings and scalability.

The Operations Manager will direct and coordinate construction activities to ensure project delivers business & customer value, for agreed scope, on schedule, within budget, and at a defined quality level including managing issues, decisions & risks, and escalation to sponsors as needed.
In this role, the Operations Manager is on call 24/7 and will need to be trained in media relations in the event of an emergency.

You are responsible for ensuring that suppliers and JLABS resident companies follow all Johnson & Johnson Innovation, JLABS policies and procedures and contractor safety guidelines and partners with the Children’s National Hospital, and J&J; Facilities and EH&S; Management to ensure JLABS and resident companies are in compliance with all local, state and federal regulations including FDA, EPA, OSHA, and DEA. You will provide leadership for internal and external inspections.

Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for a Senior Counsel, Litigation, to be located in New Brunswick, NJ.

Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.
