Janssen Vaccines & Prevention B.V. is a global biotech company which is part of the Johnson & Johnson family of companies. Within this family the company focuses on the development, production and marketing of vaccines and antibodies to prevent and combat infectious diseases. At the Leiden Site, talented and multi-scaled people are working in a dynamic culture in which innovation and a 'can do' state of mind are the central points. In order to strengthen our team we are continuously looking for enthusiastic, talented people who have the ambition to develop themselves and can be of value to the company.
For our Engineering, Validation & Maintenance (EVM) department we are currently seeking for a fulltime;
Maintenance Technician Utilities & buildings (M/F)

The Engineering-Validation-Maintenance (EVM) department (> 25 persons) is a young, motivated and dynamic team responsible for the technical support of all utilities, production and laboratory areas and all involved equipment on the Janssen Vaccines & Prevention site Leiden.

We work in a challenging environment where we make great progress in commercializing our vaccines. Engineering has a large project portfolio to improve the existing environment. The Validation group looks after the correct qualification and validation status of GMP critical equipment and processes. The key-focus point of the maintenance group is asset maintenance management of all assets.
Job Description:

As a maintenance technician UB (Utilities & Buildings) you are responsible for preventive/corrective maintenance and troubleshooting on utility & building systems. You will be working in a Pharmaceutical environment which means that you ensure to be in compliance with Good Maintenance and Manufacturing Practices. The technical focus area will be primarily mechanical and electrical of a wide variety of U&B; systems. Furthermore you will operate U&B; systems, like: water, steam, HVAC, gas and automation systems

For this job you will be using Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) to plan, record and close work orders, maintenance logs, (spare) part usage, and other required maintenance documentation. You will be guiding third parties (contractors) during the execution of their work and at the same time oversee safe work habits in the designated areas. You will be a member of the EVM 24/7 support team which means that on a regular basis you will have to be available for first line trouble shooting outside normal office hours.

DePuy Synthes Companies of Johnson & Johnson ist das größte und umfassendste Orthopädie- und Neurologieunternehmen der Welt. DePuy Synthes bietet eine beispiellose Breite und Tiefe unterschiedlicher Technologien, Produkte, Dienstleistungen und Programme in den Bereichen Orthopädie, Traumatologie, Wirbelsäule, Sportmedizin, Neurologie, Gesichts- und Schädelchirurgie, Power Tools und Biomaterialien an. Unsere breite Palette an innovativen und qualitativ hochwertigen Angeboten trägt dazu bei, die Gesundheit und das Wohlbefinden von Menschen auf der ganzen Welt nachhaltig zu verbessern. Ihre Aufgaben Als ausgewiesene Fachperson beraten und schulen Sie Ihre Ansprechpartner wie Orthopäden, Neurochirurgen, OP-Leitungen und das OP-Personal in Spitälern und Kliniken bei der Implantation. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit den Aussendienstmitarbeitern nehmen Sie eine zentrale Rolle bei der korrekten Anwendung der hochwertigen und innovativen Produkte ein.Sie bilden Ihre Kunden vor und während der Eingriffe aus, erläutern die OP-Techniken und stehen mit Ihrem kompetenten Wissen beratend zur Seite.Weiter gehören die Organisation von Kundenschulungen, die Optimierung des Inventarmanagements sowie die Steigerung der logistischen Effizienz zu Ihrem sehr vielseitigen und spannenden Aufgabengebiet.

Für die Welt sorgen … beim Einzelnen beginnen. Dieser Leitsatz inspiriert und eint die Menschen bei Johnson & Johnson. Die Kultur der Fürsorge steht im Mittelpunkt unserer Unternehmensphilosophie, welche im Credo verankert ist.

job_title: Lehrstelle als Polymechaniker/in EFZ Hägendorf / Balsthal 2019
job_description: Für die Welt sorgen … beim Einzelnen beginnen. Dieser Leitsatz inspiriert und eint die Menschen bei Johnson & Johnson. Die Kultur der Fürsorge steht im Mittelpunkt unserer Unternehmensphilosophie, welche im Credo verankert ist.

DePuy Synthes Companies of Johnson & Johnson ist das grösste und umfassendste Orthopädie- und Neurologieunternehmen der Welt. DePuy Synthes bietet eine beispiellose Breite und Tiefe unterschiedlicher Technologien, Produkte, Dienstleistungen und Programme in den Bereichen Orthopädie, Traumatologie, Wirbelsäule, Sportmedizin, Neurologie, Gesichts- und Schädelchirurgie, Power Tools und Biomaterialien an. Unsere breite Palette an innovativen und qualitativ hochwertigen Angeboten trägt dazu bei, die Gesundheit und das Wohlbefinden von Menschen auf der ganzen Welt nachhaltig zu verbessern.
Suchst du eine Lehre als Polymechaniker in der Medizinalbranche - ein Beruf mit Zukunft?
Lehrstelle als Polymechaniker/-in EFZ
Hägendorf / Balsthal

Dank den Polymechanikern und Polymechanikerinnen können Hightech-Werkstücke produziert und Neuentwicklungen umgesetzt werden. Aufgrund von Konstruktionszeichnungen und 3-D Modellen bestimmen sie die Bearbeitungsschritte und programmieren komplexe Werkstücke. Sie programmieren ihre Arbeiten an externen Programmierstationen oder direkt auf modernen computergesteuerten Maschinen. Die Umsetzung der Programme erfolgt auf hochpräzisen, mehrachsigen Dreh- und Fräsanlagen. Technologien wie Erodieren, Schleifen und Tiefbohren runden das Profil ab. Mit hochpräzisen Mess- und Prüfinstrumenten kontrollieren sie die gefertigten Werkstücke und dokumentieren diese. Sie montieren Geräte, Anlagen und Maschinen oder nehmen diese in Betrieb.

JOB TITLE: Senior Scientist, Biomarker Signatures - San Diego, CA
job_title: Senior Scientist, Biomarker Signatures - San Diego, CA
job_description: Janssen Pharmaceuticals, Inc, a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Senior Scientist, Biomarker Signatures to be located in La Jolla, CA.

Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson are dedicated to addressing and solving the most important unmet medical needs of our time, including in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious disease, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Driven by our commitment to patients, we develop sustainable, integrated healthcare solutions by working side-by-side with healthcare stakeholders, based on partnerships of trust and transparency.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

The Senior Scientist, Biomarker Signatures will be a member of the Neuroscience Biomarkers team and will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting biomarker data related to the Mood Disorder and Neurodegenerative Disease areas, with an emphasis on genetic and epigenetic biomarkers. Responsibilities also include assessing and validating new biomarker technologies.

The position will focus on identifying and validating biomarker signatures aimed at diagnosis & staging, stratification, therapy response, and relapse prediction, using genetics and epigenetics data, fluid biomarkers, “omics” - phenotype associations, and neuro-functional measurements.
The Senior Scientist, Biomarker Signatures will provide input and results to Mood and Neurodegeneration biomarker experts in therapeutic discovery, clinical translation and clinical development.

S/he will work with internal and external collaborators/partners/CROs, to develop and validate biomarker signatures for mood disorders and Neurodegeneration. S/he will interface internally with Project Scientists and Laboratory Personnel and interact outside of the immediate group with Scientists in Neuroscience Discovery, Quantitative Sciences, Experimental Medicine and Clinical Development, RA/QA, Safety, Finance, Purchasing, and Contracting. S/he will interface externally with Life science and instrument vendors, academic researchers, collaborators, and KOL’s.

A Ph.D. degree in pharmacology/biology/biomedical engineering/genetics and genomics or related fields is required.A minimum of 3 years of relevant experience. On-the-job experience with the identification and/or use of DNA, RNA, and/or epigenetic markers of disease, ideally in combination with other phenotypes such as neuroimaging is preferred. The ability to carry out data processing and analysis in addition to knowledge of statistical inference techniques and machine learning are a strong plus. Experience with establishing & validating biomarker links to phenotypes, and application in drug discovery, translation and clinical development in NS is a plus. Excellent communication skills and a strong publication record are required.Strong collaboration and influencing skills are required. The position is located at our office site in La Jolla, CA and may require <20% travel.
A Ph.D. degree in pharmacology/biology/biomedical engineering/genetics and genomics or related fields is required.
A minimum of 3 years of relevant experience.
On-the-job experience with the identification and/or use of DNA, RNA, and/or epigenetic markers of disease, ideally in combination with other phenotypes such as neuroimaging is preferred.
The ability to carry out data processing and analysis in addition to knowledge of statistical inference techniques and machine learning are a strong plus.
Experience with establishing & validating biomarker links to phenotypes, and application in drug discovery, translation and clinical development in NS is a plus.
Excellent communication skills and a strong publication record are required.
Strong collaboration and influencing skills are required.
The position is located at our office site in La Jolla, CA and may require <20% travel.

Uns verbindet die Leidenschaft für unsere Mitmenschen: für Kunden, Patienten, die Gesellschaft, füreinander. Als größtes Gesundheitsunternehmen der Welt suchen wir Persönlichkeiten, die mit uns Großes bewirken wollen – das Wohlbefinden und die Gesundheit von Menschen weltweit und in Deutschland zu verbessern. Wir schätzen Charakterköpfe, die Verantwortung übernehmen und Lust daran haben, im Team neue Ideen einzubringen und mit uns neue innovative Produkte und Services zu entwickeln. Dafür bieten wir ein modernes, flexibles Arbeitsumfeld und unzählige Karrierewege in unserem internationalen Netzwerk.

Manager Health Economics & Outcome Research (m/w/d)

Unter Anleitung des Head of HEOR Entwicklung und Koordination der Umsetzung der Methodenstrategie in GBA-Verfahren (insbesondere in der frühen Nutzenbewertung (AMNOG)) in Kooperation und engem Austausch mit den zuständigen nationalen (z.B. Dossierteam) und internationalen (z.B. EMEA Biostatistics group) Teams. Etablierung und strategische Nutzung dieser Methoden. Proaktives Erkennen und Nutzen der daraus erwachsenden strategischen Opportunitäten, Mitgestaltung der Abteilungsstrategie; strategischer Treiber für diese Themen. Weiterentwicklung der dafür notwendigen Kompetenzen.Erkennen und strategisches Nutzen methodischer Trends im Bereich HTA (AMNOG) sowie OR/RWE, Umsetzung von methodischen Erkenntnissen in MA-Projekten. Position Summary:
The Global Services Associate will work to resolve global client inquiries, concerns and issues regarding HR processes and policies through phone, email, web-form, and chat.

As a Global Services Associate you will work to meet all expected service levels and business performance goals, performing a whole range of services and fully documenting all cases in the Case Management system. You will also support the J&J; employees and HR community regarding all inquiries related to employee programs and services, HR policy, process, and procedures including navigational support working with the Team Lead of Contact Center on customer concerns.

Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for a Talent Builder for Talent Acquisition within the Johnson & Johnson Global Services organization to be located in Prague, Czech Republic.

At Johnson & Johnson, we’ve always excelled in times of change. We stand on the front lines of the biggest health challenges of our time, and we’re here to win. Our long history of firsts–Band-Aids, feminine care, cardiovascular stents, cancer treatments, digital health and, most recently, a life-changing vaccine against HIV–are proof that our proprietary blend of heart, science and ingenuity is profoundly changing the trajectory of health for humanity.
But those epic breakthroughs didn’t really come from Johnson & Johnson the company– they were discovered, developed and distributed by people just like you.
Location: Prague, Czech Republic
Contract: Full-time, unlimited contract

As a member of our global recruiting team, Talent Builder will help our recruitment teams to be the best, so we can recruit for the best talents for Johnson & Johnson to change the trajectory of human health for humanity.

In this role, you will be an integral part of the Talent Building & Talent Intelligence organization focused on the creation and execution of talent identification and digital engagement strategies for top passive talent to ensure we build robust talent pipelines for current and future needs across Johnson & Johnson organization. You will be focused on building talent pipelines for diverse profiles recruited within Europe – Middle East – Africa region (EMEA).

Use multiple capabilities including innovative technology, data, research and analytical insights to create and drive Johnson & Johnson talent attraction strategy and directly build talent pipelines through J&J;’s technologies Use enterprise engagement strategies (J&J; employer brand, etc.) and own the development of innovative digital outreach campaigns (via social media, email outreach, etc.) for both short & long-term talent needs Partner with onsite recruiters on assigned requisitions to optimize talent building capabilities and ensure alignment on successful talent search Work closely with the Talent Intelligence team to enhance talent building outcomes based on research and insights and talent landscape analytics provided Partner with Talent Building Leadership Team in reviewing performance metrics, key performance indicators, that improve talent building efficiency and overall individual & team performance

Janssen, eine Tochtergesellschaft des weltweit führenden Healthcare Konzerns Johnson & Johnson, ist ein international tätiges, forschendes Pharmaunternehmen. Zahlreiche Produkteinführungen, eine vielversprechende Forschungspipeline und umfangreiche Serviceleistungen für Ärzte und Patienten sind dabei Schlüsselelemente unseres Erfolgs. Ebenso stolz wie auf unser erfolgreiches Produktportfolio sind wir auf unser engagiertes Team, dessen Leidenschaft, Energie und Begeisterungsfähigkeit Grundlage für unser kontinuierliches Wachstum bilden.

Ein wichtiges therapeutisches Gebiet für Janssen ist die pulmonale Hypertonie (PH). Durch die Produkte von Janssen/ Actelion konnte das Leben von Patienten mit diesem Krankheitsbild verbessert werden. Als National Sales Manager (m/w) Österreich leisten Sie und Ihr Team einen wichtigen Beitrag dazu, betroffenen Personen Zugang zu unseren Produkten zu ermöglichen.

job_description: MISSIONS

Manage et développe une (ou des) équipe(s) de Responsables Scientifiques Régionaux (RSR/MSL) sur une aire thérapeutique définie. Coordonne la mise en place des activités des RSR/MSL, en ligne avec la stratégie des Affaires Médicales afin de maximiser la valeur de nos médicaments apportée à la communauté médicale et aux patients. Garantit la communication éthique et de haute qualité scientifique des RSR/MSL auprès des professionnels de santé contribuant à inscrire Janssen comme le partenaire scientifique le plus reconnu et respecté de toute l’industrie pharmaceutique.
ACTIVITES PRINCIPALES
1. Management des collaborateurs sous 4 versants :
Capitaine :
- Garantir l’appropriation par son équipe des objectifs et de la stratégie des Affaires Médicales et de l’Entreprise
- Challenger le RSR dans la mise en œuvre de son plan d’action médical régional
- Gérer la performance et le pilotage de l’activité :
. Mettre en œuvre les actions nécessaires afin d’assurer l’excellence scientifique et opérationnelle des RSR afin de construire des partenariats médicaux avec les KOL
. Garantir la mise en œuvre et le déploiement de la communication des RSR

. Garantir la planification et la mise en œuvre des activités du plan médical régional en cohérence avec les besoins identifiés au sein du Comité Opérationnel Régional (COR) et en ligne avec la stratégie nationale produit

. S’assurer de la mise en place et du suivi de l’ensemble des actions de « Medical Education» régionales en collaborant avec l’équipe médicale afin de garantir une communication scientifique de haut niveau pour renforcer l’image scientifique et éthique de Janssen
- Motiver :
Identifier, susciter, entretenir la motivation de son équipe
- Recruter, Intégrer :
. Evaluer les besoins de ressources sur une région donnée
. Etre force de proposition concernant les évolutions de la structure
. Assurer le recrutement et l’intégration des RSR
Entraineur :
- Accompagner régulièrement le RSR dans ses actions terrain au travers de duos
- Organiser et animer des réunions d’équipe en présentiel ou en délocalisé
- Evaluer et développer les compétences de ses collaborateurs :
. Savoir détecter les besoins de formation et s’assurer de la mise en œuvre un plan de formation
. Identifier les évolutions de carrières de ses collaborateurs
-Identifier et suivre les RSR à potentiel
- Former :
. S’assurer du niveau scientifique des RSR en complément de leur formation initiale
. Organiser la formation des RSR sur l’environnement scientifique des produits et les techniques de communication
. Planifier la participation aux congrès de ses collaborateurs et en piloter le coût
. Suivre les acquis de la formation
Arbitre :
- Définir et suivre les objectifs individuels des collaborateurs et les moyens de mise en œuvre
- Réaliser les 5 conversations de ses collaborateurs et établir des recommandations salariales
- Gérer la performance insuffisante, en relation avec la DRH : plans d’actions, départs et licenciements
- Suivre les indicateurs de suivi et de reporting de l’activité des RSR dans I- Connect
- Vérifier la conformité des actions « Medical Education» régionales et les valider dans I-Connect
- Piloter le budget de fonctionnement de l’équipe RSR
- S’assurer de la préparation des supports scientifiques (actualisés et validés par le médecin produit) en adéquation avec la stratégie de l’entreprise
- S’assurer du respect des règles de compliance dans l’activité des RSR
Co-équipier :
- Encourager la mise en œuvre d’actions collaboratives au sein du COR et auprès des acteurs internes:
. S’assurer de la remontée des informations sur les tendances médicales au sein des comités opérationnels régionaux COR
. Consolider et partager ces informations avec les équipes produit au national (CVT)
. Etre l’interface avec les différents départements de l’entreprise (compliance, réglementaire, marketing, ventes…)
- Participer à la mise en place de la communication des RSR en collaboration avec l’équipe médicale
2. Contribuer à la construction de la stratégie Médicale Nationale :
- Contribution à la vision et à l’alignement stratégique de la Stratégie Médicale Nationale
- Partager les Insights Médicaux régionaux sur le domaine thérapeutique concerné avec la CVT et l’équipe médicale afin d’enrichir la stratégie médico-marketing
- Participer à l’élaboration du Brand Plan du domaine thérapeutique concerné en lien avec la CVT et la CVT élargie
- Contribuer aux différents projets transverses d’entreprise en lien avec le métier de MSL
- Anticiper les besoins, l’adéquation des ressources et les changements organisationnels nécessaires à la mise en place du Brand Plan moyen et long terme

Niveau d’anglais : Maîtrise de l’anglais obligatoire >700 TOEIC

- Savoir manager, avec un bon équilibre exigence/autonomie, une équipe à haut niveau de compétences

- Aptitude à accompagner le développement des personnes et mettre en œuvre l’ensemble des process RH pour soutenir son équipe et le business
- Savoir participer et conduire des projets transversaux
- Esprit collaboratif et prédispositions au travail matriciel dans le contexte du déploiement des objectifs des Affaires Médicales
- Savoir animer des réunions, leadership, prise de parole en public
- Savoir gérer un budget
- Connaissance des domaines thérapeutiques et cliniques ou capacité d’acquisition de ces connaissances
- Connaissance de l’environnement médical, réglementaire et institutionnel des domaines concernés et capacité à le réactualiser en permanence
- Connaissance des outils informatiques

JOB TITLE: 【Medical】 CMF & ｵｰｿﾍﾟﾃﾞｨｯｸ ｿﾘｭｰｼｮﾝ事業部　Sales Rep
job_title: 【Medical】 CMF & ｵｰｿﾍﾟﾃﾞｨｯｸ ｿﾘｭｰｼｮﾝ事業部　Sales Rep
job_description: 【職務内容】
CMF & オーソぺディックソリューション事業部は、脳神経外科・口腔外科・形成外科・整形外科、さらには獣医師向けなど幅広い領域に使用される医療機器を取り扱う事業部です。
なかでもCMF営業部は、主に口腔外科・形成外科における医療従事者のベストパートナーとなるべく、ニーズに即した製品、情報、教育を提供しています。
当社の骨固定デバイスはかねてより評価が高く、特に口腔外科においてはNO.1のシェアを堅持しています。今後も新製品の導入を予定しており、市場の創出・シェアの拡大が期待されます。
また近年ではWin-Winな関係となる、医師に対するプロフェッショナルエデュケーションを積極的に展開しており、製品のみならず会社としての価値も顧客に感じて頂きつつ関係強化を進めています。
CMF営業部では営業職としてPDCAサイクルを自発的に回し、結果に拘り、患者及びその家族のQOL向上に貢献する気概のある方を募集します。
【職務経験】
・法人営業経験5年以上（車での営業経験要）
【知識・技能】
・コミュニケーションスキル
・プレゼンテーションスキル
・基本的なPCスキル(Word、Excel, Power point など)
【学歴】
大学卒業以上
【資格】
・普通自動車免許
業務上車両の運転が必要となる職種については、自動車運転免許を保持している又は入社までに取得できることが条件となります。なお、道路交通法に基づく一定の症状により免許取得や更新ができなくなる可能性がある方（※）については事前にお申し出ください。
※〔確認項目〕
過去５年以内において、病気（病気の治療に伴う症状を含みます。）を原因として、又は原因は明らかでないが、意識を失ったことがある。
過去５年以内において、病気を原因として、身体の全部又は一部 が、一時的に思い通りに動かせなくなったことがある。
過去５年以内において、十分な睡眠時間を取っているにもかかわらず、日中、活動している最中に眠り込こんでしまった回数が週３回 以上となったことがある。
過去１年以内において、次のいずれかに該当したことがある。 ・飲酒を繰り返し、絶えず体にアルコールが入っている状態を３日 以上続けたことが３回以上ある。 ・病気の治療のため、医師から飲酒をやめるよう助言を受けている にもかかわらず、飲酒したことが３回以上ある。
病気を理由として、医師から、運転免許の取得又は運転を控えるよう助言を受けている。

The Johnson & Johnson Law Department is recruiting for a Senior Counsel, Government Investigations and Litigation. This attorney will be based in Shanghai and will report to the head of the Government Investigations and Litigation Practice Group in New Brunswick.
This position involves extensive travel throughout China.
Description

This attorney holding this position will conduct and supervise internal investigations of potential violations of local and United States law, internal policies and procedures and other standards by company employees and business partners. This attorney will be expected to manage some investigations personally, by conducting interviews, reviewing documents and other material onsite. This attorney will also be expected to select, engage and supervise external investigative resources, including local and international law firms, accounting firms, etc. This attorney will be expected to work with local attorneys on particular government investigations in China. This attorney will be expected to keep current on local and international developments in anti-corruption law, as well as enforcement trends and local business practices in China. This attorney will be expected to provide support, anti-corruption and health care compliance advice with respect to M&A; due diligence efforts in the China and provide advice with respect to anti-corruption audits in China. This attorney will be expected to work with local clients to conduct training, raise awareness and generally facilitate the prompt identification, escalation, and investigation of relevant compliance and legal issues to the corporate Triage Committee based in New Brunswick. This attorney will be expected to partner with other departments to enhance processes and further improve compliance efforts.

Should have a bachelors or Master’s Degree in law with 5 + years of specific experience of conducting investigations in China, preferably from the Lifesciences sector or a law firm with focus on life sciences investigations.
Fluency in the local language a must.

DePuy Synthes Companies of Johnson & Johnson is the largest, most comprehensive orthopedic and neurological business in the world. DePuy Synthes offer an unparalleled breadth and depth of technology, devices, services and programs in the areas of joint reconstruction, trauma, spine, sports medicine, neurological, cranio-maxillofacial, power tools and biomaterials. Building on the legacy and strengths of two great companies, we are creating one organization that will be agile and better equipped in today’s evolving health care environment. Our broad array of inspired, innovative and high-quality offerings help advance the health and wellbeing of people around the world.

In this position, Inspection and Testing Supervisor administers Quality Laboratories, and directly supervises Lab. Technicians in day-to-day activities supporting Surgicel, Gynecare and Matrix Manufacturing areas providing test result reporting, test method validation, documentation review, and support projects and process upgrading of existing processes and products and subsequent qualifications.
This position is part of the new MD Lab. Transformation Organization, and reports directly to the EMEA Lab. Director, and dotted-line to the Plant Quality Manager.
Under general direction and in accordance with all applicable federal, state and local laws/regulations and Corporate Johnson & Johnson, procedures and guidelines, this position:

Supervises the daily activities of the quality assurance technicians and other quality assurance activities. Ensure compliance with applicable laboratory regulations, standards and procedures. Trains, plans, schedules and assigns work, appraises performance and resolves problems. Manage laboratory testing of raw materials, in process materials and finished product in support of the manufacturing schedule and to ensure timely delivery of product to customers. Ensures laboratory test equipment is in a compliant state, including timely replacement and new equipment introduction. Ensures the coordination of test method, laboratory equipment validation (IQ/OQ/PQ) and acts as validation approver for Operations Validations. Supervising Environmental Monitoring Program. Ensure dose Audit Program is scheduled and executed timely. Performing and managing monthly or/and quarterly report/trending charts for EM, Dose Audit and Bioburden. Manage annual qualifications for Ethylene Oxide and Gamma Sterilization. Support any sterilization non-conformance investigation. Review Ethylene Oxide sterilization certificates, processing parameters and releasing to QA/QC. Investigate non-conformances event and initiates corrective actions as required. Supports investigations and approve related non-conformances. Initiating and implementation of corrective and preventive action and quality data trending for CAPA review board evaluation. Reviews, for approval or rejection, all procedures or specifications impacting on the identity, purity and quality of final products. Evaluates, recommends and approves expenses requirements to ensure maximum utilization of laboratory supplies to fulfill department objectives. Manage budget for the laboratories. Janssen Shanghai Discovery Center is seeking a highly motivated and seasoned medicinal chemist to fill the position of Associate Director of Chemistry, who will play a key role in the medicinal chemistry team aiming to discover novel medicines to treat cancer and HBV related diseases. The successful candidate will drive medicinal chemistry strategy, manage a contracted chemistry team, build internal chemistry capabilities with high efficiency. The candidate must possess strong knowledge of modern medicinal chemistry and is capable to deliver differentiated New Molecular Entities to the Janssen product development pipeline. Using a mix of internal and external resources, he/she will partner with key stakeholders and represent medicinal chemistry on cross-functional project teams, and be responsible for building, managing, and delivering the chemical matter of the clinical pipeline.

Ability to work and effectively lead a cross functional team that consists of molecular & cellular biology, pharmacology, cheminformatics, ADME, toxicology, structural biology, computational chemistry, chemical development. As a chemistry leader, drive and direct medicinal chemistry function for one or more drug discovery projects. Strong scientific insight contributes to high quality drug candidate selections and milestone deliveries. Familiar with modern drug discovery design and modeling tools, able to anticipate challenges and creatively implement the novel concepts and technology platforms to solve problems. Provide scientific oversight and accountability of medicinal chemistry activities in assigned projects with high laboratory productivity. Responsible for developing medicinal chemistry strategies and ensuring efficient execution of tactics to meet project goals and timelines. Strategic thinker with excellent communication skills. Effective global stakeholder management through oral presentations and written reports. Manage a medicinal chemistry team of multiple MS/PhD-level scientists both internal and external within ongoing portfolio projects. Develop the capabilities of the staff through mentoring and by promoting a culture that embraces open scientific debate and accountable for timely decision-making. High learning agility and capable to work effectively across disease/therapeutic areas. Strong interpersonal and communication skills and be able to establish & maintain productive partnership within the diverse group of talents across global R&D; organizations through clear and transparent communication. Participate in portfolio and stage-gate reviews, aid in the preparation and presentation of dossiers for new molecular entity nomination and advancement. Participate in shaping and implementing strategies that support medicinal chemistry department growth objectives. Serve as a scientific expert in Janssen medicinal chemistry community and provide insight and recommendations on new targets and emerging external opportunities.

JOB TITLE: Global Practice Principal Recruiter- Health Tech/Data Science/E-Commerce
job_title: Global Practice Principal Recruiter- Health Tech/Data Science/E-Commerce
job_description: Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for a Global Practice Principal Recruiter – Health Tech/Data Science/E-Commerce within the Johnson & Johnson Global Services organization to be located in High Wycombe, United Kingdom

Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.

With $76.5 billion in 2017 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 265 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing approximately 126,500 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

The Global Practice Principal Recruiter will be responsible for the delivery, execution, and assessment of our newly envisioned, Talent Acquisition Practice Model that will provide Johnson & Johnson with a competitive advantage. You will utilize Health Tech/DS/E-Com industry & business acumen as an active, strategic, trusted advisor to Business Leaders and Human Resource Partners. You will bring deep expertise and market knowledge while staying on top of trends and market changes and knowledgeable about talent competitors. You will be a Talent Advisor as you translate the Health Tech/DS/E-Com enterprise and business strategy to craft the talent priorities for a particular Practice. At this level, you will have a greater degree of impact on the implementation of strategies aligned to business priorities of a supported Health Tech/DS/E-Com Practice.
Responsibilities

Translate the strategies of Global Practice model into deliverables, building, innovating and improving recruiting, Utilize a deep understanding of J&J;'s long and short-term strategies, with special focus on its different growth drivers and innovation pipeline. Apply deep technical acumen, including knowledge of industry and functional/therapeutic area to coach and influence hiring managers in the most critical talent insights. Stay largely connected with the external Market Access practice community, positioning oneself as an established professional with deep technical expertise, strong business network, significant social media presence, knowledge production and attendance of events and seminars. Cultivate a high level of candidate care & service during all stages of recruiting process. Craft long term relationships by acting as a career coach and becoming part of his/her network while building a consistent pipeline of passive talent for future opportunities. Lead a portfolio and guide internal clients in the best recruiting standards. Serve as a strategic talent advisor and as an ambassador for the Global D&I; Strategy. Collaborate in a culture of agile thinking through a fast, adaptive and iterative recruiting approach. Utilize business data, technology, and other operational metrics to "sell" qualified diverse candidates to hiring managers and to "sell" J&J; to passive and active talent. Integrate internal talent availability and external trends into a compelling talent narrative to drive data based decisions while observing emerging talent priorities. Build the Talent Sourcing plan to ensure the Company will find elite talent utilizing Global Talent Management strategies. Help others understand internal and external digital platforms to develop & execute sourcing strategies, build sustainable candidate pipelines and cultivate relevant prospect/candidate relationships.
Translate the strategies of Global Practice model into deliverables, building, innovating and improving recruiting,

job_description: Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for a University TA Delivery Manager for Talent Acquisition within the Johnson & Johnson Global Services organization to be located in Prague, Czech Republic.

At Johnson & Johnson, we’ve always excelled in times of change. We stand on the front lines of the biggest health challenges of our time, and we’re here to win. Our long history of firsts–Band-Aids, feminine care, cardiovascular stents, cancer treatments, digital health and, most recently, a life-changing vaccine against HIV–are proof that our proprietary blend of heart, science and ingenuity is profoundly changing the trajectory of health for humanity.
But those epic breakthroughs didn’t really come from Johnson & Johnson the company– they were discovered, developed and distributed by people just like you.

The Molecular & Cellular Pharmacology (MCP) Group is a critical part of Lead Discovery in the Discovery Sciences organization in Janssen R&D; and is committed to the delivery of high-quality chemical leads needed for the generation of small molecule clinical compounds in all five Janssen Therapeutic Area (TA) discovery teams. We are currently seeking an outstanding individual to join our team as a Scientific Director of the MCP Group. This position will be based in Beerse, Belgium and will report to the Global Head of Molecular & Cellular Pharmacology. The candidate will lead the MCP Group in Beerse, Belgium (MCP-BE), consisting of Ph.D. and non-Ph.D. scientists. S/he will recruit, teach and develop pharmacologists with drug discovery experience. The MCP-BE group will develop physiologically-relevant cellular assays to characterize target engagement and downstream effects of small molecule modulators, elucidate options for hit ID approaches, collaborate with screening scientists on development of HTS assays, and perform mechanism-of-action studies on validated hits. The MCP-BE Group will also employ phenomic approaches to hit identification and optimization. The Scientific Director of MCP-BE will set standards for scientific rigor and excellence and build a culture of innovation that is fully aligned with therapeutic area objectives. S/he will be a key senior leader within the global MCP Group and, as such, will be an important contributor to the strategic planning for the larger group. The candidate will be the cellular pharmacology expert for MCP and contribute scientifically to discussions regarding external collaborations.

DePuy Synthes, a member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Biomaterials R&D; Co-op located in West Chester, PA to support the Biomaterials Research and Development (R&D;) Group.

The DePuy Synthes Companies of Johnson & Johnson is the largest, most innovative and comprehensive orthopedic and neurological business in the world. DePuy Synthes offers an unparalleled breadth and depth of products, services and programs in the areas of joint reconstruction, trauma, spine, sports medicine, neurological, craniomaxillofacial, power tools and biomaterials. Our implants and instruments are used by orthopedic surgeons to treat patients with conditions resulting from traumatic injuries, degenerative diseases, deformities, and sports related injuries. Our environment is entrepreneurial, learning-driven, and is as challenging as it is rewarding.

The Biomaterials R&D; Group within DePuy Synthes develops products based on advanced biomaterials such as ceramic bone void fillers, bio absorbable polymer implants, drug-device combination products, and cell-based therapies. We engage in early stage evaluation of new materials technologies, device design and development, manufacturing process development, and support of preclinical testing and regulatory submissions. The Biomaterials R&D; group collaborates with other divisions within DePuy Synthes (Trauma, Spine, Joint Reconstruction, etc.), as well as surgeons, Regulatory Affairs, Marketing, Sales, and other functional departments to define and develop product concepts.
The Biomaterials R&D; co-op will:

Perform R&D; activities in a team environment.Assist scientists and engineers in our R&D; laboratories to fabricate device prototypes, and may conduct mechanical, chemical, and performance testing to evaluate device performance.Conduct experiments and provide data, results analysis, and reports to project teams in a timeline driven process and will contribute to the efficient operation of R&D; laboratories.Exercise technical judgment in the design, execution and interpretation of experiments, and use professional concepts to solve complex problems in creative and effective ways.Maintain a laboratory notebook and other technical documentation according to required guidelines.Be asked to provide other project or product support as needed in order to support Synthes’ business objectives.This position requires work in a Biosafety Level 2 lab and requires less than 5% travel.
Perform R&D; activities in a team environment.
Assist scientists and engineers in our R&D; laboratories to fabricate device prototypes, and may conduct mechanical, chemical, and performance testing to evaluate device performance.
Conduct experiments and provide data, results analysis, and reports to project teams in a timeline driven process and will contribute to the efficient operation of R&D; laboratories.
Exercise technical judgment in the design, execution and interpretation of experiments, and use professional concepts to solve complex problems in creative and effective ways.
Maintain a laboratory notebook and other technical documentation according to required guidelines.
Be asked to provide other project or product support as needed in order to support Synthes’ business objectives.
This position requires work in a Biosafety Level 2 lab and requires less than 5% travel.

You will use your technology knowledge to support the process of developing trauma orthopedics products. You will use Creo 3.0 to layout and/or design surgical implants, instruments, test fixtures. You will contribute to the development of the products by drafting and running development tests. You will have an opportunity to work with product development engineers in support of a variety of verification activities including, but not limited to, drawing reviews, tolerance stack analysis, mechanical testing and finite element analysis. Engineering students who like to “tinker” and/or work with their hands are preferred. Must have the ability to work independently with minimal supervision. You will maintain active, regular communication and involvement with internal and external project team members. You will maintain the highest levels of professionalism, ethics and compliance at all times.

Accounting/Finance Intern positions are available at numerous operating companies within Consumer, Medical Devices and Diagnostics, and the Pharmaceutical Sectors, as well as Johnson & Johnson Corporate Headquarters. These positions are located in: California, Florida, Indiana, Massachusetts, New Jersey, Ohio and Pennsylvania.

The Internship Program is a full time 10 - 12 week program focused on providing college students with practical business experience. It allows them to develop leadership skills, broaden their understanding of the concepts learned in school and "get a taste of the real world" before they are fully committed to it. The Intern program is one of the primary feeders for entrance into Johnson & Johnson's Finance Leadership Development Program (FLDP). The Financial Leadership Development Program (FLDP) is a two-year program designed specifically to prepare future generations of business leaders within the Johnson & Johnson accounting and finance organization. Participants gain invaluable on-the-job experiences during two rotations just under twelve months, at various J&J; business units; receive leadership and technical training, and thorough, recurring evaluations. There are six weeks of training over the course of the two-year program. Training covers all areas and competencies that are critical to success at J&J; and is delivered through a combination FLDP leadership, J&J; executives, Finance management, and external consultants.

Internship program participant roles include financial accounting and analysis, sales & marketing finance, operations finance, research and development finance, and internal audit. Specific responsibilities may include budget support, capital budgeting, financial consolidation, sales reporting and analysis, and/or ad-hoc projects. Other common tasks include analysis of financial questions and problems (i.e. Regression and Trend Analysis), problem solving, active business partnering and developing innovative methods to improve job metrics and processes.

Legal Authorization to work in the United States, without requiring sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g. H1-B status) now or in the future is required. A minimum 3.00 cumulative GPA is required. Current enrollment in an accredited College/University is required. Finance/Accounting Majors are preferred. Intermediate level of knowledge of MS Excel and Word is required.

DePuy Synthes, a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for R&D; Engineering Co-Ops for Trauma to be in West Chester, PA

DePuy Synthes is a Johnson & Johnson company that is one of the leaders in the medical device industry. Our implants and instruments are used by orthopedic surgeons to treat patients with conditions resulting from traumatic injuries, degenerative diseases, deformities, and sports related injuries. Our environment is entrepreneurial, learning-driven, and is as challenging as it is rewarding.

DePuy Synthes Companies of Johnson & Johnson is the largest, most innovative and comprehensive orthopedic and neurological business in the world. DePuy Synthes Companies will offer an unparalleled breadth and depth of products, services and programs in the areas of joint reconstruction, trauma, spine, sports medicine, neurological, craniomaxillofacial, power tools and biomaterials. Building on the legacy and strengths of two great companies, we are creating one organization that will be agile and better equipped in today's evolving health care environment. With a focus on activating insights to develop innovative, comprehensive solutions, we are inspired to advance patient care in greater ways than either company could accomplish on its own
Description of Specific Sector

The DePuy Synthes Trauma R&D; – Nail Technologies team is focused on the design and development of innovative medical devices for the surgical treatment of bone fractures, including novel implants and instrumentation. The use of intramedullary nails has become the standard for many fracture types because of its advantages in orthopedic trauma surgery.The team coordinates with surgeons, manufacturing, regulatory affairs, sales, marketing, and other functional departments to develop product requirements and concepts.
